{{short description|None}}

This is a list of manuscripts written in the [[Glagolitic script]]. For printed works see [[List of Glagolitic books]]. For inscriptions see [[List of Glagolitic inscriptions]].

{{horizontal TOC|align=center|nonum}}


{| style="background:transparent"
|bgcolor="MistyRose"|Light red represents manuscripts with Glagolitic only as inclusions or paratext.
|-
|bgcolor="LavenderBlush"|Pale red represents mixed manuscripts with Glagolitic as a main script.
|}

==900–999==

| missal
| [[Kiev Missal|Fg(Mi)Kij]]
| 925–935, 1081-1096<ref name="Miklas 2015">{{cite book |last1=Hürner |first1=Dana |last2=Miklas |first2=Heinz |date=2015 |title=''A Numerical Approach for Dating and Localising Glagolitic-Old Church Slavonic Documents on Graphemic Grounds'' |location=[[Vienna]]}}</ref>
| F. 301 No. 328P
| [[Vernadsky National Library of Ukraine]]
| [[Dalmatia]], Czech Republic?
| 13
| 14.7 x 10.7&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Kiev Folia (Kyiv Folia, Kijevski listići, Kiever Blätter). The first page has a different and younger origin from the rest: it is Croatian, while the rest is Czech according to some.<ref name="Kul'bakin 1915">{{cite book |last1=Kul'bakin |first1=Stepan Mikhaylovich |date=1915 |title=Грамматика церковно-славянского языка по древнейшим памятникам |trans-title=Grammar of the Church Slavonic Language According to Ancient Texts |series=Энциклопедия славянской филологии |language=ru |location=Saint Petersburg |url=http://elib.shpl.ru/ru/nodes/56405-vyp-10-grammatika-tserkovno-slavyanskogo-yazyka-po-drevneyshim-pamyatnikam-1915#mode/inspect/page/10/zoom/6}}</ref><ref name="Schaeken 1987">{{cite journal |first=Jos |last=Schaeken |title=Die Kiever Blätter |language=de |trans-title=The Kiev Folia |journal=Studies in Slavic and General Linguistics |location=Amsterdam |volume=9}}</ref><ref name="Mincheva 1995 Kiev">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Angelina |last=Mincheva |date=1995 |contribution=Киевски листове |language=bg |encyclopedia=Кирило-методиевска енциклопедия |volume=2 |pages=248–260}}</ref><ref name="Slavova 2003 Kiev">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Tatyana |last=Slavova |contribution=Киевски глаголически листове |language=bg |trans-title=Old Bulgarian Literature - Encyclopedic Dictionary |title=Старобългарска литература - енциклопедичен речник |date=2003 |pages=245–246}}</ref><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /><ref name="Boiadziev 2020" /> Abecedary from 1872 by Andrej Antoninъ Kapustinъ prepended to manuscript for several facsimile editions. FgKij-C by same scribe as PsDim-X and MSin-B. It is FgKij-A and FgKij-B that are dated to 925–935.<ref name="Miklas 2015" /> Written on cow or goat parchment.<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Cappa |first1=Federica |last2=Miklas |first2=Heinz |last3=Piñar |first3=Guadalupe |last4=Brenner |first4=Simon |last5=Frühmann |first5=Bernadette |last6=Wetter |first6=Wilfried |last7=Schreiner |first7=Manfred |last8=Engel |first8=Patricia |last9=Sterflinger |first9=Katja |date=2022 |title=The Kiev Folia: An interdisciplinary approach to unravelling the past of an ancient Slavonic manuscript |journal=International Biodeterioration & Biodegradation |volume=167 |page=105342 |language=en |url=https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0964830521001724 |doi=10.1016/j.ibiod.2021.105342|s2cid=244723388}}</ref><ref>Transcriptions at [http://titus.uni-frankfurt.de/texte/etcs/slav/aksl/kievfol/kievf.htm TITUS], [http://manuscripts.ru/mns/main?p_text=61350133&p_lang=EN Manuskript], [https://kiev.stin.hr/index.php?menu=10 Staroslavenski institut].</ref>

| Cod. 1/2 (532)
| [[Odesa National Scientific Library]]
| Bulgaria
| 2
| 17 x 20&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Ohrid Glagolitic fragments (''Evangelium Achridanum'').<ref name="Dogramadzhieva 1995">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Ekaterina |last=Dogramadzhieva |contribution=Охридски листове |language=bg |trans-title=Cyrillo-Methodian Encyclopedia |encyclopedia=Кирило-методиевска енциклопедия |date=1995 |volume=2 |pages=903–905}}</ref><ref name="Hristova 2003 Ohridsko">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Iskra |last=Hristova |contribution=Охридско евангелие (Охридски глаголически листове) |language=bg |title=Старобългарска литература - енциклопедичен речник |trans-title=Old Bulgarian Literature - Encyclopedic Dictionary |date=2003 |pages=341–342}}</ref> Discovered 1845 in Ohrid by Viktor Grigorovič.<ref name="Boiadziev 2020" /> Possibly written by one of the hands of the Sinai Psalter. Facsimile published in Ilinskiy 1915.<ref name="Ilinskiy 1915">{{cite book |first=Grigoriy |last=Andreevich Ilĭinskiy |title=Охридские глаголические листки. Отрывок древне-церковно-славянского евангелия XI в. |language=ru |trans-title=The Ohrid Glagolitic Folia. A Fragment of an Old Church Slavonic Gospel of the XI Century. |location=Saint Petersburg |series=Памятники старославянского языка |date=1915}}</ref><ref name="Lysaght 1982">{{cite book |first=Thomas Alexander |last=Lysaght |title=A Selection of Ancient Slav Literary Monuments: Incorporating Monumenta Minora palaeobulgaricae |location=Vienna |publisher=Fassbaender |date=1982}}</ref>

| фонд И. И. Срезневского 24.4.15, Rila No. 3/6
| [[Rila Monastery]], [[Library of the Russian Academy of Sciences]]
| Bulgaria
| 11
| 27.5 x 21.3&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Rila fragments (Rilski listići i ostrišci).<ref name="Boiadziev 2020" /> Facsimile of one folio published by Ilĭinskiy 1909 ([http://relig-library.pstu.ru/modules.php?name=580 BRF]). First full facsimile of all folia in Goshev 1956 "Рилски глаголически листове". Some images hosted at [https://sesdiva.eu/en/virtual-rooms/medieval-written-heritage/item/82-rila-glagolitic-folia-en SESDiva]. Rila fragments (FgRil) include Macedonian Glagolitic Folium (FgMac), being by same scribe, who potentially also wrote FgGri.<ref name="Miklas 2015" />

| 2 co
| ''Codex Assemanius''. Hand Ass-2 is dated 1046–1081, in contrast to the earlier parts.<ref name="Miklas 2015" /><ref>Transcription at [http://titus.uni-frankfurt.de/texte/etcs/slav/aksl/asseman/assem.htm TITUS], [https://korp.csc.fi/download/ccmh-src/www/assemanianus.html CCMH].</ref> Facsimile by Vajs and Kurz published 1929.<ref name="Vajs and Kurz 1929">{{cite book |first1=Jozef |first2=Jozef |last1=Vajs |last2=Kurz |title=Evangeliarium Assemani. Codex Vaticanus 3, slavicus glag. |volume=1 |location=Prague |date=1929}}</ref><ref name="Vajs and Kurz 1955">{{cite book |first1=Jozef |first2=Jozef |last1=Vajs |last2=Kurz |title=Evangeliarium Assemani. Codex Vaticanus 3, slavicus glag. |volume=2 |location=Prague |date=1955}}</ref><ref name="Ivanova-Mavrodinova and Dzhurova 1981a">{{cite book |first1=Vera |last1=Ivanova-Mavrodinova |first2=Aksinija |last2=Dzhurova |title=Асеманиевото евангелие. Старобългарски глаголически паметник от X век |language=bg |trans-title=The Assemanius Gospel. An Old Bulgarian Glagolitic Monument of the X Century |volume=1 |date=1981 |location=Sofia}}</ref><ref name="Ivanova-Mavrodinova and Dzhurova 1981b">{{cite book |first1=Vera |last1=Ivanova-Mavrodinova |first2=Aksinija |last2=Dzhurova |title=Асеманиевото евангелие. | fourfold gospel
| [[Codex Zographensis|Zog]]
| 987–1006, 1046–1081<ref name="Miklas 2015" />
| MS. Glag. 1 +
| [[National Library of Russia]]
| Macedonia
| 271+17
|
| 1 co
| ''Codex Zographensis''. Folios 41-57 are a palimpsest of an earlier Glagolitic manuscript, part of whose text was published in Cyrillic transcription by Dobrev 1971.<ref name="Dobrev 1971">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Dobrev |contribution=Палимпсестовите части на Зографското евангелие |language=bg |title=Константин-Кирил Философ. Доклади от симпозиума, посветен на 1100-годишнината от смъртта му. |trans-title=Constantine-Cyril the Philosopher. Publications from the Symposium, Held on the 1100th Annerversary of His Death. |date=1971 |location=Sofia |pages=157–164}}</ref><ref name="Moszyński 1967">{{cite journal |first=Leszek Józef |last=Moszyński |title=Euzebiusza w głagolskim rękopisie kodeksu Zografskiego |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |number=25–26 |date=1976 |pages=77–119}}</ref><ref name="Dobrev 1985 Zographensis">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Ivan |last=Dobrev |contribution=Зографско евангелие. |encyclopedia=Кирило-методиевска енциклопедия |language=bg |trans-title=Cyrillo-Methodian Encyclopedia |volume=1 |date=1984 |pages=734–740}}</ref><ref name="Musakova 1991" /><ref name="Musakova 1995">{{cite book |first=Elisaveta |last=Musakova |contribution=Бележи върху украсата на Зографското четириевангелие |language=bg |title=Светогорска обител Зограф |trans-title=The Family Zograph of the Holy Mountain |location=Sofia |date=1995 |pages=107–111}}</ref><ref name="Hristova 2003 Zographensis">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Iskra |last=Hristova |contribution=Зографско евангелие |title=Старобългарска литература - енциклопедичен речник |language=bg |trans-title=Old Bulgarian Literature - Encyclopedic Dictionary |page=207}}</ref><ref name="Uhanova 2004">{{cite journal |first=Elena |last=Vladimirovna Uhanova |title=К вопросу о происхождении принципов оформления глаголических рукописей X-XI вв |language=ru |trans-title=On the Question of the Source of the Principles of Formation of the Glagolitic Manuscripts of the X-XI Centuries |journal=Древнерусское искусство |volume=25 |location=Saint Petersburg |date=2004 |pages=221–224}}</ref><ref name="Musakova 2015">{{cite book |first=Elisaveta |last=Musakova |contribution=Глаголическите старобългарски ръкописи от X и XI век: състрояние на проучаванията върху тяхната украса |language=bg |title=Европейският Югоизток през втората половина на X - началото на XI век |trans-title=The European Southeast Through the Second Half of the X - Beginning of the XI Century |location=Sofia |date=2015 |pages=760–779}}</ref><ref name="Miltenov 2019">{{cite journal |first=Yavor |last=Miltenov |title=Три пласта на лексикално редактиране в Зографското евангелие |journal=Словѣне}}</ref><ref name="Miltenov 2019 Zographensis">{{cite book |first=Yavor |last=Miltenov |contribution=The Five Ws of the Old Church Slavonic Codex Zographensis: Recent Studies, Future Tasks |title=Digital and Analytical Approaches to the Written Heritage |date=2019 |publisher=Gutenberg Publishing House |pages=169–187 |url=https://www.academia.edu/42243902}}</ref><ref name="Miltenov 2021">{{cite journal |first=Yavor |last=Miltenov |language=bg |title=Вмъкнатите глаголически листове в Зографското евангелие |trans-title=Glagolitic Folia Inserted in the Codex Zographensis |journal=Българска реч |date=2021 |number=2 |pages=107–120 |url=https://www.academia.edu/88045736}}</ref><ref name="Boiadziev 2020">{{cite book |first=Andrei |last=Boiadziev |title=Старобългарски писмени паметници |date=25 January 2020 |url=https://bg.wikibooks.org/wiki/Старобългарски_писмени_паметници}}</ref> Partial facsimile in Jagić 1879, reprinted Graz 1954.<ref name="Jagić 1879">{{cite book |first=Vatroslav |last=Jagić |title=Quattuor evangeliorum codex glagoliticus olim Zographensis nunc Petropolitanus |location=Berlin |date=1879 |url=https://archive.org/details/quattuorevangeli00jagiuoft/page/n226/mode/1up}}</ref> Hand Zog-2 is dated 1046-1081, in contrast to the earlier parts.<ref name="Miklas 2015" /><ref>Transcription at [http://titus.uni-frankfurt.de/texte/etcs/slav/aksl/zograph/zogra.htm TITUS], [https://korp.csc.fi/download/ccmh-src/www/zographensis.html CCMH].</ref>

| homiliary
| [[Glagolita Clozianus|HomCloz]]
| 996-1017<ref name="Miklas 2015" />
| ms. 2476 + Dip. 973
| Municipal Library of Trento, [[Tyrolean State Museum]]
| Macedonia, [[Croatia]]
| 14
| 27 x 20,5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Cloz Miscellany (''Glagolita Clozianus'', Kločev glagoljaš, Клоцов сборник). Acquired by Ivan Frankopan (died 1486). Today 12 folia in Trento, 1 dolia in Innsbruck.<ref name="Vondrak 1893">{{cite book |first=V. |last=Vondrák |title=Glagolita Clozův |location=Prague |date=1893}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1955">{{cite journal |first=Vjekoslav |last=Štefanić |title=Kločev glagoljaš i Luka Rinaldis |language=hr |trans-title=The Cloz Glagolitic Manuscript and Luka Rinaldis |journal=Radovi Staroslav. Instituta |volume=2 |location=Zagreb |date=1955 |pages=129–154 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/clanak/21492}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="Smyadovski 1995">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Stefan |last=Smyadovski |date=1995 |contribution=Клоцов сборник |language=bg |encyclopedia=Кирило-методиевска енциклопедия |trans-title=Cyrillo-Methodian Encyclopedia |volume=2 |pages=347–351}}</ref><ref name="Musakova 2000">{{cite book |first=Elisaveta |last=Musakova |date=2000 |contribution=Клоцовият сборник: Кодикологични и археографични добавки |title=Glagolitica: Zum Uhrsprung der slavischen Schriftkultur |pages=95–108 |location=Vienna |language=bg | trans-title=Glagolitic: On the Source of the Slavic Literary Culture |publisher=Verlag der Österreichischen Akademie der Wissenschaften}}</ref><ref name="Hristova 2003 Klocov">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Iskra |last=Hristova |date=2003 |contribution=Клоцов сборник |language=bg |title=Старобългарска литература - енциклопедичен речник |trans-title=Old Bulgarian Literature - Encyclopedic Dictionary |page=254}}</ref><ref name="Boiadziev 2020" /> Facsimile and additions published in ''Zum Glagolita Clozianus'' 1836 ([https://books.google.com/books?id=Es8GAAAAQAAJ Google Books]) by [[Jernej Kopitar]], then 1860 by [[Franz Miklosich]] ([[:File:Zum Glagolita Clozianus.djvu|WM]]).<ref name="Kopitar 1836">{{cite book |first=Jernej |last=Kopitar |title=Glagolita Clozianus |location=Vienna |date=1836}}</ref><ref name="Dostal 1959">{{cite book |first=A. |last=Dostáč |title=Clozianus, staroslověnský hlaholský sborník tridentský a innsbrucky |language=cs |trans-title=Clozianus, Old Slavic Glagolitic Tridentine and Innsbruck Miscellany |location=Prague |date=1959}}</ref>

| aprakos gospel
| VatPal
| 1000s<ref name="Džurova 2002" /> (original)
| Vat.gr.2502
| [[Vatican Library]]
| Bulgaria
| 112
|
| 1 co
| Palimpsest with Greek over Cyrillic. Glagolitic in margins in 4 places (i.e. f. 10v, 22v, 111v).<ref name="Miltenov 2009" /> Discovered 1981.<ref name="Krastanov 1982">{{cite journal |first=Trendafil |last=Krastanov |title=Неизвестен старобългарски ръкопис-палимпсест, вероятно от XI в., във Ватиканската библиотека |language=bg |trans-title=Unknown Old Bulgarian Manuscript-Palimpsest, Likely from the XI Century, in the Vatican Library |journal=Дыховна култура |volume=LXII |date=1982}}</ref><ref name="Džurova et al. 1985" /><ref name="Ruysschaert 1985" /><ref name="Krastanov 1988">{{cite journal |first=Trendafil |last=Krastanov |title=Български Ватикански палимпсест Cod.Vat.gr.2502. (Кирилско кратко изборно евангелие от втората половина на X в.) |language=bg |trans-title=Bulgarian Vatican Palimpsest Cod.Vat.gr.2502 (Cyrillic Short Aprakos Gospel of the Second Half of the X Century) |journal=Старобългаристика |volume=XII |date=1988 |number=1 |pages=38–66}}</ref><ref name="Mussakova 1994">{{cite journal |first=Elisaveta |last=Mussakova |language=de |title=Der kyrillische Palimpsest in cod. Vat. gr. 2502 und sein Schmuck |trans-title=The Cyrillic Palimpsest in cod. Vat. gr. 2502 and its Ornamentation |journal=Palaeobulgarica |date=1994}}</ref><ref name="Krastanov et al. 1996">{{cite journal |first1=Trendafil |first2=Anna-Maria |first3=Ivan |last1=Krastanov |last2=Totomanova |last3=Dobrev |title=Ватиканско евангелие: старобългарски кирилски апракос от X в. в палимпсестен кодекс Vat.gr.2502 |language=bg |trans-title=Vatican Gospel: Old Bulgarian Cyrillic 10th Century Aprakos in Palimpsest Codex Vaticanus Graecus 2502 |journal=Centre International Sur les Sources de l'Historie Balkanique et Mediterraneenne |location=Sofia |date=1996 |url=https://www.academia.edu/38732051}}</ref> Facsimile published 2002. Originally reported to date to the 10th century, the date has been revised to probably after ''Codex Suprasliensis''.<ref name="Džurova 2002">{{cite book |first=Aksinija |last=Dobreva Džurova |title=L'enluminure du palimpseste cyrillique du Vatican Vat. Gr. 2502 |language=fr |trans-title=The Illumination of the Cyrillic Palimpsest of the Vatican Vat. Gr. 2502 |series=Monumenta Slavico-Byzantina et Medievalia Europensia |number=15 |location=Sofia |date=2002}}</ref><ref name="Mazhlekova 2004">{{cite book |first=Mariya |last=Mъzhlekova |title=Специализираните морфологични средства за изразяване на притежание във Ватиканския палимпсест |language=bg |trans-title=Specialised Morphological Tools of Expressing Possession in the Vatican Palimpsest |location=Veliko Tarnovo |date=2004}}</ref><ref name="Mazhlekova 2005">{{cite book |first=Mariya |last=Mъzhlekova |title=Специализираните синтактични средства за изразяване на притежание във Ватиканския палимпсест |language=bg |trans-title=Specialised Syntactical Tools of Expressing Possession in the Vatican Palimpsest |location=Veliko Tarnovo |date=2005}}</ref><ref name="Boiadziev 2020" /> The Vatican library has not yet digitised it.<ref>{{cite web |title=Vat.gr.2502 |url=https://opac.vatlib.it/mss/detail/Vat.gr.2502}}</ref>

| FgGri
| 1006-1025<ref name="Miklas 2015" />
| РАН, Спб., фонд И. И. Срезневского 24.4.17
| [[Library of the Russian Academy of Sciences]]
|
| 2

| Grigorovič Folium (Лист Григоровича).<ref name="Ilinskiy 1909">{{cite book |first=Grigoriy |last=Andreevich Ilĭinskiy |date=1909 |title=Македонский глаголический листок |series=Памятники старославянского языка |location=Saint Petersburg |url=https://rusneb.ru/catalog/000199_000009_003758188}}</ref><ref name="Goshev 1956">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Goshev |date=1956 |title=Рилски глаголически листове |language=bg |location=Sofia}}</ref><ref name="Smyadovski 1980">{{cite journal |first=Stefan |last=Smyadovski |date=1980 |title=Към въпроса за състава на Рилските глаголически листове |language=bg |journal=Български език |volume=6 |pages=500–501}}</ref><ref name="Velcheva 2003 Rilski">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Boryana |last=Velcheva |contribution=Рилски глаголически листове |language=bg |title=Старобългарска литература - енциклопедичен речник |trans-title=Old Bulgarian Literature - Encyclopedic Dictionary |pages=431–432}}</ref><ref name="Smyadovski 2003 Rilski">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Stefan |last=Smyadovski |contribution=Рилски глаголически листове |language=bg |date=2003 |encyclopedia=Кирило-методиевска енциклопедия |trans-title=Cyrillo-Methodian Encyclopedia |volume=3 |pages=468–473}}</ref> Sometimes argued to have originated in the same document as the Rila Fragments.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://ksana-k.ru/?page_id=1296 |title=Рыльские глаголические листки |website=Библиотека Фронтистеса |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140426051401/http://ksana-k.ru/?page_id=1296 |archive-date=2014-04-26 |quote=Помимо названного издания существует, по всей вероятности, как составная часть рыльского глаголического сборника еще так наз. Лист Григоровича, который хранится в Библиотеке АН СССР в Ленинграде под шифром 24.4.17.}}</ref><ref name="Miklas 2015" />

| Prague Fragments.<ref name="Šafarik 1857">{{cite book |first=Pavel Jozef |last=Šafár̆ik |title=Glagolitische Fragmente |language=de |trans-title=Glagolitic Fragments |date=1857 |publisher=Prag, G. Haase |url=https://archive.org/details/gri_33125015063403}}</ref> PF-B dated to 1006-1010, PF-A to 1006-1023.<ref name="Miklas 2015" /><ref>Text at [http://titus.uni-frankfurt.de/texte/etcs/slav/aksl/praglist/pragl.htm TITUS].</ref>

| 1 co
| Sinai Psalter (''Psalterium Sinaiticum'', Синайски псалтир).<ref name="Ilchev 1979">{{cite book |first=Petŭr |last=Ilchev |date=1979 |contribution=Текстова структура на Синайския псалтир |language=bg |title=Изследвания върху историята и диалектите на българския еик. Сборник в памет на чл.-кор. Кирил Мирчев |location=Sofia |pages=200–205}}</ref><ref name="Ilchev 1980">{{cite book |first=Petŭr |last=Ilchev |contribution=Синайският псалтир и неговите писачи |title=Славянска палеография и дипломатика |language=bg |location=Sofia |date=1980 |pages=89–95}}</ref><ref name="Boyadzhiev 2003">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Andrey |last=Boyadzhiev |date=2003 |contribution=Синайски Псалтир |language=bg |title=Старобългарска литература - енциклопедичен речник |trans-title=Old Bulgarian Literature - Encyclopedic Dictionary |pages=454–455}}</ref><ref name="Penkova and Karachorova 2003">{{cite encyclopedia |first1=Pirinka |last1=Penkova |first2=Ivona |last2=Karachorova |date=2003 |contribution=Синайски псалтир |language=bg |encyclopedia=Кирило-методиевска енциклопедия |trans-title=Cyrillo-Methodian Encyclopedia |volume=3 |pages=616–622}}</ref> There is an [https://glagoljica.hr/?knjige=iiif.v.a&id=577519&tify=%7B%22view%22:%22info%22%7D 1883 transcription] in Cyrillic. PsSin-A, PsSin-A1, PsSin-B, PsSin-B1, PsSin-B2, PsSin-B3, PsSin-C, PsSin-C1, PsSin-C2, PsSin-D, PsSin-E dated to 1010-1018.<ref name="Miltenov 2009" /> A facsimile was published 1971<ref name="Altbauer 1971">{{cite book |first=Moshé |last=Altbauer |title=Psalterium Sinaiticum. An 11th Century Glagolitic Manuscript from St. Catherine's Monastery, Mt. Sinai |date=1971 |location=Skopje}}</ref> and transcriptions have also been published.<ref name="Severyanov">{{cite book |first=Sergey |last=Nikolaevich Severĭyanov |date=1922 |title=Синайская псалтырь. Глаголический памятник XI века |language=ru |location=Saint Petersburg |url=https://viewer.rsl.ru/ru/rsl01004827745?page=1&rotate=0&theme=white}}</ref><ref name="Mareš et al. 1977">{{cite journal |first=František Václav |last1=Marek |first2=Petra |last2=Fetková |first3=Zoe |last3=Hauptová |first4=Václav |last4=Konzal |first5=Ludmila |last5=Pacnerová |first6=Jana |last6=Švábová |date=1977 |title=Psalterium Sinaitici pars nova (monasterii s. Catharinae codex slav. 2/N) |location=Vienna |publisher=Verlag der Österreichischen Akademie der Wissenschaften}}</ref>

| ''Codex Marianus''. Discovered by Viktor Grigorovič in 1844-1845 on Athos in the skete "Sv. Bogorodica". Entered Russian State Library with Grigorovič archive.<ref name="Boiadziev 2020" /> Transcription by Jagić 1883, reprinted Graz 1960.<ref name="Jagić 1883">{{cite book |first=Vatroslav |last=Jagić |title=Quattuor Evangeliorum versionis palaeoslovenicae codex Marianus Glagoliticus |location=Saint Petersburg |date=1883 |url=https://archive.org/details/quattuorevangel00unkngoog}}</ref><ref name="Musakova 1991">{{cite journal |first=Elisaveta |last=Musakova |title=Украсата на два глаголически ръкописа - Зографското и Маринското четириевангелие |language=bg |journal=Проблеми на изкуството |volume=24 |date=1991 |number=4 |pages=27–36}}</ref><ref name="Mostrova 1995">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Tatyana |last=Mostrova |title=Mariinsko evangelie |language=bg |journal=Кирило-методиевска енциклопедия |trans-title=Cyrillo-Methodian Encyclopedia |volume=2 |location=Sofia |date=1995}}</ref><ref name="Slavova 2003">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Tatyana |last=Slavova |contribution=Мариинско евангелие |title=Старобългарска литература - енциклопедичен речник |trans-title=Old Bulgarian Literature - Encyclopedic Dictionary |pages=294–295}}</ref><ref>Text at [http://titus.uni-frankfurt.de/texte/etcs/slav/aksl/marianus/maria.htm TITUS], [https://korp.csc.fi/download/ccmh-src/www/marianus.html CCMH].</ref>

| glag. 2+3 + Sin. slav. 1/N

| Macedonia, Croatia

| Sinai Euchologium (''Euchologium Sinaiticum'').<ref name="Ševčenko 1982">{{cite journal |first=Ihor |last=Ševčenko |title=Report on the Glagolitic Fragments (of the Euchologium Sinaiticum?), Discovered on Sinai in 1975 and Some Thoughts on the Make-up of the Earliest Glagolitic Manuscripts |journal=Harvard Ukrainian Studies |volume=6 |number=2 |date=1982 |pages=119–151}}</ref><ref name="Ševčenko 1991">{{cite book |first=Ihor |last=Ševčenko |title=Byzantium and the Slavs in Letters and Culture |date=1991}}</ref><ref name="Laleva and Boyadzhiev 2003">{{cite encyclopedia |first1=Tanya |last1=Laleva |first2=Andrey |last2=Boyadzhiev |contribution=Синайски молитвеник (Евхологий, Требник) |language=bg |title=Старобългарска литература - енциклопедичен речник |trans-title=Old Bulgarian Literature - Encyclopedic Dictionary |date=2003 |pages=452–454}}</ref><ref name="Penkova and Cibranska 2003">{{cite encyclopedia |first1=Pirinka |last1=Penkova |first2=Mariyana |last2=Cibranska |contribution=Синайски евхологий |language=bg |title=Кирило-Методиевска енциклопедия |trans-title=Cyrillo-Methodian Encyclopedia |date=2003 |pages=604–614}}</ref><ref name="Penkova 2008">{{cite book |first=Pirinka |last=Penkova |title=Речник-индекс на Синайския евхологий |language=bg |location=Sofia |date=2008 |publisher=Академично издателство „Проф. Марин Дринов“}}</ref><ref name="Boiadziev 2020" /> A facsimile was published 1941<ref name="Nachtigal 1941">{{cite book |first=Rajko |last=Nachtigal |title=Eucholgium Sinaiticum, starocerkovnoslovanski glagolski spomenik |volume=I |date=1941}}</ref> and 1988,<ref name="Tarnanidis 1988" /> and there is an [https://glagoljica.hr/?knjige=iiif.v.a&id=577517 1882 transcription] in Cyrillic.<ref name="Frček 1933">{{cite journal |first=Jan |last=Frček |date=1933 |title=Eucholgium Sinaiticum, texte slave avec sources grecques et traduction française |language=fr |journal=Patrologia Orientalis |volume=XXIV.5}}</ref><ref name="Frček 1939">{{cite journal |first=Jan |last=Frček |date=1939 |title=Eucholgium Sinaiticum, texte slave avec sources grecques et traduction française |language=fr |journal=Patrologia Orientalis |volume=XXXV.3}}</ref><ref name="Nachtigal 1942">{{cite book |first=Rajko |last=Nachtigal |title=Eucholgium Sinaiticum, starocerkovnoslovanski glagolski spomenik |volume=II |date=1942}}</ref> By same scribe as MSin-A and maybe SlužSin (the latter being the Euchology fragment, not the ''Euchologium Sinaiticum'', dated to 1014-1031).<ref name="Miklas 2015" />

| sacramentary
| MSin (MissSin)
| 1026-1118<ref name="Miklas 2015" />
| 5/N
| [[Saint Catherine's Monastery]]
|
| 80
|
|
| Sinai Missal (''Sacramentarium (Missale) Sinaiticum'').<ref name="Tarnanidis 1988" /><ref name="Schaeken 1999">{{cite book |first=Jos |last=Schaeken |contribution=Palaeoslovenica. Würdigung neuentdeckter Handschriften |language=de |title=Dutch contributions to the Twelfth international congress of Slavists, Cracow: Linguistics |series=Studies in Slavic and general linguistics |volume=24 |pages=251–376 |date=1999}}</ref><ref name="Velcheva 1999" /><ref name="Velcheva 2003 Sinai Missal">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Boryana |last=Velcheva |contribution=Синайски мисал |language=bg |encyclopedia=Кирило-Методиевска енциклопедия |trans-title=Cyrillo-Methodian Encyclopedia |pages=615–616}}</ref><ref name="Boiadziev 2020" /> Austrian Science Fund grant number [https://cvl.tuwien.ac.at/project/the-sinaitic-glagolitic-sacramentary-euchologium-fragments/ P19608-G12] included scanning the manuscript. [https://sinaimanuscripts.library.ucla.edu/catalog?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=&search_field=all_fields SMDL] also to digitise it. MSin-A by same scribe as EuSin, but MSin-B by same scribe as PsDim-X and FgKij-C. MSin-A dated to 1026-1031, MsSin-C to 1046-1081, MsSin-B to 1106-1118.<ref name="Miklas 2015" />

| Bojana palimpsest (Боянски палимпсест). Cyrillic over Glagolitic. 26 pages have Glagolitic. Discovered by Viktor Grigorovič in the Boyan church near Sofia in 1945.<ref name="Dobrev 1972">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Dobrev |title=Глаголическият текст на Боянския палимпсест |language=bg |location=Sofia |date=1972}}</ref><ref name="Dobrev 1985">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Ivan |last=Dobrev |contribution=Боянски палимпсест |language=bg |title=Кирило-Методиевска енциклопедия |trans-title=Cyrillo-Methodian |date=1985 |volume=1 |page=236}}</ref><ref name="Slavova 2003 Boyan">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Tatyana |last=Slavova |contribution=Боянско евангелие |language=bg |title=Старобългарска литература - енциклопедичен речник |trans-title=Old Bulgarian Literature - Encyclopedic Dictionary |date=2003 |pages=78–79}}</ref><ref name="Boiadziev 2020" />

| The psalter of Dimitri the Ol'tar'nik, Medical Folia.<ref name="Velcheva 1991 Medical">{{cite journal |first=Boryana |last=Velcheva |title=Новооткрит лекарственик, написан с глаголица |language=bg |journal=Старобългарска литература |trans-title=Old Bulgarian Literature - Encyclopedic Dictionary |date=1991}}</ref><ref name="Dobrev 1990">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Dobrev |contribution=Българска народна лексика в един ръкопис от XII век |title=Христоматия по съвременен български език |pages=10–28 |location=Blagoevgrad |language=bg |date=1990}}</ref><ref name="Rosenschon 1994">{{cite journal |first=Ursula |last=Rosenschon |date=1994 |title=Sechs Seiten medizinischer Rezepte im glagolitischen Psalter 3/N des Sinaiklosters |language=de |journal=Byzantinoslavica |volume=55 |issue=2 |pages=304–335}}</ref><ref name="Dobrev and Slavova 1995">{{cite book |first1=Ivan |last1=Dobrev |first2=Tatyana |last2=Slavova |date=1995 |title=Старобългарски текстове. Христоматия за университетите. |location=Sofia |edition=1st}}</ref><ref name="Dobrev and Slavova 1996">{{cite book |first1=Ivan |last1=Dobrev |first2=Tatyana |last2=Slavova |date=1996 |title=Старобългарски текстове. Христоматия за университетите. |location=Sofia |edition=2nd}}</ref><ref name="Velcheva 1999" /><ref name="Marti 1999">{{cite book |first=Roland |last=Marti |contribution=Abecedaria. A Key to the Original Slavic Alphabet |date=1999 |title=Thessaloniki – Magna Moravia |pages=175–200}}</ref><ref name="Miklas and Gau 2000">{{cite book |first1=Heinz |last1=Miklas |first2=Melanie |last2=Gau |contribution=Preliminary Remarks on the Old Church Slavonic Psalterium Demetrii Sinaitici |title=The Bible in Slavic Tradition |date=2000 |page=21 |url=https://www.academia.edu/31310426}}</ref><ref name="Dimova 2014">{{cite journal |first=Diana |last=Dimova |title=The Two Non-Canonical Prayers and the Glagolitic Abecedarium in Psalterium Demetrii Sinaitici |journal=Scripta & E-Scripta |volume=2014 |number=13 |pages=215–221}}</ref><ref name="Boiadziev 2020" /> PsDim-X by same scribe as FgKij-C and MSin-B. PsDim has hands PsDem-A, PsDem-B, PsDem-C all dated 1058-1066, and PsDem-X dated 1094-1106.<ref name="Miklas 2015" /><ref>Transcriptions at Manuskript of [http://manuscripts.ru/mns/main?p_text=63876685&p_lang=EN Dimitri's] and [http://manuscripts.ru/mns/main?P_TEXT=94122765&p_lang=EN Medical].</ref> Facsimile by Miklas 2012.<ref name="Miklas 2012">{{cite book |first=Heinz |last=Miklas |date=2012 |title=Psaterium Demetrii Sinaitici: Monasterii s. Catharinae codex slav. 3/N, adiectis foliis medicinalibus |location=Vienna |publisher=Hozhausen}}</ref>

| Evgeniev psalter (Eвгениевски псалтир). Psalter with commentary of Pseudo-Athanasius. Cyrillic with 3 Glagolitic initials (folia 6r, 18r, 20r).<ref name="Schmidt et al. 1984">{{cite book |last1=Ottovich Schmidt |first1=Sigurd |last2=Petrovna Zhukovskaya |first2=Lidiya |last3=Nikolaevich Pokrovskiy |first3=Nikolay |first4=Mariya |last4=Igorevna Avtokratova |first5=Gennadiy |last5=Pavlovich Enin |last6=Aleksandrovna Knyazevskaya |first6=Olĭga |last7=Vladimirovna Kukushkina |first7=Margarita |last8=Vasilĭevich Lëovochkin |first8=Ivan |last9=Sergeevich Lihachev |first9=Dmitriy |last10=Ivanovich Rogov |first10=Aleksandr |last11=Borisovich Tihomirov |first11=Nikolay |last12=Arkadĭevich Turilov |first12=Anatoliy |last13=B. Shelemanova |first13=N. |last14=Lavrentĭevich Yanin |first14=Valentin |last15=Nikolaevich Shchapov |first15=Yaroslav |last16=Nikolaevich Rozov |first16=Nikolay |title=Сводный каталог славяно-русских рукописных книг, хранящихся в СССР, XI-XIII вв. |language=ru |date=1984 |url=https://archive.org/details/svodnuei}}</ref><ref name="Tvorogov et al. 1988">{{cite book |last1=Viktorovich Tvorogov |last2=Mihaylovich Oleg |first2=Vyacheslav |last3=Haimovich Gorfunkelĭ |first3=Aleksandr |last4=P. | Enina apostle (Енински апостол). In Cyrillic but with two examples of Glagolitic initial Buky among other Glagolitic letters.<ref name="Mirchev and Kodov 1965">{{cite book |first1=Kiril |last1=Spiridonov Mirchev |first2=Hristo |last2=Nikolov Kodov |title=Енински апостол |location=Sofia |date=1965}}</ref><ref name="Miltenov 2009" /><ref name="Dogramadzhieva 1985 Eninski">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Ekaterina |last=Dogramadzhieva |title=Енински апостол |language=bg |encyclopedia=Кирило-Методиевска енциклопедия |volume=1 |trans-title=Cyrillo-Methodian |pages=652–655}}</ref><ref name="Ikonomova 2003 Eninski">{{cite book |first=Zhivka |last=Ikonomova |contribution=Енински апостол |language=bg |title=Старобългарска литература - Енциколедичен речник |trans-title=Old Bulgarian Literature - Encyclopedic Dictionary |edition=2nd |pages=162–163}}</ref><ref name="Boiadziev 2020" /> Facsimile published 1983.<ref name="Kodov 1983">{{cite book |first=Hristo |last=Kodov |title=Енински апостол. | triodion
| TrRes
| 1000s (late)
| X. No. 37
| [[Bulgarian Academy of Sciences]]
| Macedonia
| 1
| 24 x 17&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Resen (Dragoslav) fragment (Триод на Кодов). Cyrillic palimpsest of Cyrillic with one Glagolitic note, not on the palimpsest but the over-text. Discovered by Hristo Kodov in Gabrovo in 1963.<ref name="Kodov 1966">{{cite book |first=Hristo |last=Nikolov Kodov |contribution=Фрагмент от старобългарски ръкопис с глаголическа приписка |title=Климент Охридски. Сборник от статии по случай 1050 г. от смъртта му. |location=Sofia |date=1966 |pages=121–131}}</ref><ref name="Kodov 1969">{{cite book |first=Hrist |last=Nikolov Kodov |title=Опис на славянските ръкописи в Библиотеката на Българската академия на науките |location=Sophia |date=1969 |url=https://archiv.cl.bas.bg/pdf/opisi/Kodov.pdf}}</ref><ref name="Miklas 2015" /> Notes are often mixed Cyrillic and Glagolitic (i.e. 38 f133v, see 2/N f31v).<ref name="Petrov and Kodov 1973">{{cite book |first1=Hristo |last1=Nikolov Kodov |first2=Stoyan |last2=Petrov |title=Старобългарски музикални паметници |location=Sofia |date=1973}}</ref><ref name="Velcheva 1999">{{cite journal |first=Boryana |last=Velcheva |title=Късната българска глаголица |journal=Кирило-Методиевски студии |volume=12 |pages=87–153}}</ref><ref name="Popov 2003">{{cite encyclopedia |first=Georgi |last=Popov |contribution=Триоден фрагмент с глаголическа приписка |language=bg |title=Кирило-Методиевска енциклопедия |volume=4 |pages=178–180}}</ref><ref name="Miltenov 2009" /><ref name="Bojadžiev 2015">{{cite book |first=Andrej |last=T. Bojadžiev |title=Старобългарска читанка |volume=3 |date=2015}}</ref><ref name="Boiadziev 2020" />
| bgcolor=#FFE6FB | [https://archiv.cl.bas.bg/pdf/opisi/Kodov.pdf 1969] <nowiki>[low res.]</nowiki>

| Life of [[Simeon Stylites]]

| 1 co
| Budapest fragment (Budimpeštanski odlomak). 2 fragments. The only Croato-glagolitic text that still distinguishes between the two half-vowels. [https://adt.arcanum.com/en/view/MTA_StudiaSlavica_01/?pg=324 1955 facsimile] requires academic access, and consists of black and white scans and [http://hrvatska-bosna.eu5.org/hr_kultura/budimpestanski_odlomci.htm this] colour page. [https://www.obshtezhitie.net/texts/bgf/uni/bgf.html 2005 transcription] by Ralph Cleminson.<ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Contains part of the Macarius-legend according to Anica Nazor.<ref name="OSU 1981" />

| 1100 (January 1)

| [[Dobrinj]]
|
|
|
| {{interlanguage link|Donation of Dragoslav|hr|Darovnica slavnoga Dagoslava}}. Transcription of translation of Petar Petriš published by Ivan Črnčić in "Katolički list" 1860, br. 29.<ref name="Črnčić 1860">{{cite journal |last=Črnčić |first=Ivan |date=1860 |title=Dva slovinska spomenika glagoljicom pisana u dobrinju na otoku Krku |trans-title=Two Slavic Monuments Written in Glagolitic in Dobrinj on the Island of Krk |language=hr |journal=Katolički list |volume=29 |pages=226–229}}</ref><ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /> Original lost, survives only in 1724 translation by Petriš of Latin translation by Benetto Grabbia (fl. 1570-1580) with the aid of parish priest Juraj Mavrović. Črnčić transcription transliterated into Glagolitic by Kukuljević.<ref name="Bratulić 2017">{{cite book |last1=Bratulić |first1=Josip |last2=Ivšić |first2=Stjepan |date=2017 |title=Hrvatske glagoljične i ćirilične isprave iz zbirke Stjepana Ivšića 1000.-1527. |language=hr |series=''Acta Croatica'' - Hrvatski spomenici |location=Zagreb |url=https://www.researchgate.net/publication/326060333}}</ref><ref name="Šurmin 1898">{{cite book |last1=Šurmin |first1=Đuro |date=1898 |title=Hrvatski spomenici |language=hr |series=Monumenta historico-juridica Slavorum Meridionalium |location=Zagreb}}</ref><ref name="Jelenović 1939">{{cite journal |last=Jelenović |first=I. |date=1939 |title="Dota" crkvice Sv. Vida |language=hr |journal=Krčki kalendar |pages=46–50 |location=Zagreb}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1939">{{cite journal |last=Štefanić |first=Vjekoslav |date=1939 |title=Povijest crkve Sv. Vida kraj Dobrinja |trans-title=History of the Church of St. Vitus by Dobrinj |language=hr |journal=Krčki kalendar |pages=39–46 |location=Zagreb}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="Jelenović 1973">{{cite journal |last=Jelenović |first=Ive |date=1973 |title=Mikrotoponimija dobrinjskog područja |trans-title=Microtoponymy of the Dobrinj Area |language=hr |journal=Hrvatski dijalektološki zbornik |volume=3 |page=218 |location=Zagreb}}</ref><ref name="Kirinčić and Velčić 2000">{{cite book |last1=Kirinčić |first1=Josip |last2=Velčić |first2=Franjo |date=2000 |title=Darovnica slavnoga Dragoslava |language=hr |location=Dobrinj}}</ref><ref name="Mihaljević 2000">{{cite journal |last=Mihaljević |first=Milan |date=2000 |title=Dosadašnja čitanja darovnice slavnoga Radoslava |language=hr |journal=Fluminensia |volume=12 |number=1–2 |pages=1–15 |location=Zagreb}}</ref>

| ''Abecenarium bulgaricum''. Latin with Glagolitic abecedary.<ref name="Kidrič 1910">{{cite journal |first=France |last=Kidrič |title=Pomote in potvare za razne potrebe |language=sl |journal=Naši zapiski |trans-title=Our Notes |date=1910}}</ref><ref name="Marti 1991">{{cite journal |first=Roland |last=Marti |title=Slavische Alphabete in nicht-slavischen Handschriften |language=bg |journal=Кирило-Методиевски студии |trans-title=Cyrillo-Methodian Studies |volume=8 |pages=139–164}}</ref> Housed at the National Library of France as Ms. lat. 2340. First mentioned in the 1744 catalogue, last used for Kopitar 1836, reported lost 1858.<ref name="Martynov 1848">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Mihaĭlovich Martynov |title=Les manuscrits slaves de la Bibliothèque impériale de Paris |language=fr |trans-title=The Slavic Manuscripts of the Imperial Library of Paris |date=1848 |location=Paris |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=AXxBAAAAYAAJ}}</ref> Confirmed lost in a 1910 investigation by Jagić.<ref name="Jagić 1911" /> But letters published in the 1750 book ''Nouveau Traité de Diplomatique''.<ref name="Kempgen 2020">{{cite journal |first=Sebastian |last=Kempgen |title=Das Pariser Abecenarium bulgaricum |language=de |trans-title=The Paris Abecenarium bulgaricum |journal=Die Welt der Slaven |volume=65 |issue=1 |pages=142–163 |issn=0043-2520 |url=https://fis.uni-bamberg.de/bitstream/uniba/47720/1/fisba47220.pdf}}</ref>

| Apostolus Christinopolitanus (Кристинопольський Апостол). Cyrillic with Glagolitic abecedaries and Glagolitic used functionally for commentary marking.<ref name="Miltenov 2009" /><ref name="Bakshaeva 2020">{{cite journal |first=Alyona |last=Andreevna Bakshaeva |title=Записи на полях Христинопольского Апостола XII века |language=ru |journal=Славянский мир |trans-title=The Slavic World |date=2020 |doi=10.31168/2619-0869.2020.2.01 |s2cid=235051183 |url=https://inslav.ru/sites/default/files/29_bakshaeva.pdf}}</ref> Text published 1896, 1908, 1910.<ref name="Kałużniacki 1896">{{cite book |first=Emil |last=Kałużniacki |title=Actus epistolaeque apostolorum palaeoslovenice |language=la |trans-title=The Old Slavonic Acts and Epistles of the Apostles |date=1896 |location=Vienna |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=NagDAAAAYAAJ}}</ref><ref name="Voskresenskiy 1908">{{cite book |first=Grigoriy |last=Aleksandrovich Voskresenskiy |title=Древнеславянский Апостол |language=ru |trans-title=Old Slavonic Apostle |date=1908}}</ref><ref name="Maslov 1910">{{cite journal |first=Sergey |last=Ivanovich Maslov |title=Отрывок Христинопольского апостола, принадлежащий библиотеке Университета св. | Baška strips (Baščanski ostrišci, Premudini ostrišci). Two strips found by Vinko Premuda, lost for a time, then found again. | Gršković apostle fragment (Grškovićev odlomak apostola). Found at the end of the 19th century by chaplain Niko Gršković in [[Vrbnik]]. Cyrillic marginal notes. Text includes Acts of the Apostles. ==1200–1299==

| missal
| {{interlanguage link|Split missal fragment|lt=FgSpal|hr|Splitski odlomak misala}}
| 1200s (early)
| 1468
| Kaptolski arhiv, [[Split, Croatia|Split]]
| Bosnia and Herzegovina
| 1
| 30 x 22&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Splitski odlomak misala (Split missal fragment). Found by Vjekoslav Štefanić. Used in binding of the Cartulary of Saint Anastasia at Split. One of the last uses of Glagolitic in Bosnia. Described by Vjekoslav Štefanić in 1957.<ref name="Štefanić 1957">{{cite journal |first=Vjekoslav |last=Štefanić |title=Splitski odlomak glagoljskog misala starije redakcije |language=hr |trans-title=Split Fragment of the Older Redaction of the Glagolitic Missal |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |volume=6-7-8 |date=1957 |pages=54–133 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/13735}}</ref><ref name="OSU 1981" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://hrcak.srce.hr/13735 1957]
|-
| breviary
| Fg(Br)Lond
| 1200s (early)
| Add. 31,951
| [[British Library]]
| Croatia
| 1
| 30.5 x 22&nbsp;cm
|
| Londonski odlomak brevijara (London breviary fragment). Described by Vajs in ''Charvatsko-hlaholský kodex a hlaholský zlomek v Britském museu v Londýně''.<ref name="OSU 1981" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />

|-bgcolor="LightGray"
| legal
|
| 1230 (December 30)
|
|
| Dobrinj
|
|
|
| Juraj Pariježić nadaruje crkvu sv. Jurja kod Dobrinja, koju je sám i sagradio. Transcription of Petriš translation published by Ivan Crnčić in "Katolički list" 1860, br. 29.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Črnčić 1860" /> Original lost. Survives only in 1724 translation by Petar Petriš of Latin translation by Benetto Grabbia. Transcribed by Ivan Črnčić then transliterated into Glagolitic by Kukuljević.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" /><ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Gršković and Štefanić 1953" >{{cite book |last1=Gršković |last2=Štefanić |first1=Ivan |first2=Vjekoslav |date=1953 |title="Nike uspomene starinske" Josipa Antuna Petrisa |language=hr}}</ref>

| dedication
|
| 1288
|
|
| [[Trsat]]
| 1
|
|
| Written by Stipan od Staroga Dubrovnika bishop of [[Modruš]]. Discovered by Franjo Glavinić in 1614 in the crkva sv. Luke by Trsat. Published in ''Historia Tersattana'' by Glavinić 1648 in Udine, then by Valvasor in ''Die Ehre des Herzogthums Krain'' 1689 in Ljubljana.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863">{{cite book |last1=Kukuljević Sakcinski |first1=Ivan |date=1863 |title=''Acta Croatica'' |language=hr |location=Zagreb}}</ref><ref name="Jelić 1906" />

| missal
|
| 1200s
| III a 36 (negativni otisak)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 1
| 20.5 x 16&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Negativni otisak u Kopijalnoj knjizi obitelji Tanić. A missal fragment once used as a cover for the III a 36 left a negative print. Text includes Psalm 17. It was taken off at some point and Štefanić could not locate the original cover.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

|-
| breviary
| Fg(Br)Ts+Fg(Br)Zag
| 1200s (by end)
| Ms. Misc. 81, Fragm. glag. 46 a+b
| Biblioteca civica of [[Trieste]], [[Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts|Arhiv HAZU]]
| Kvarner
| 2+1
| 18.3 x 14&nbsp;cm, 13.9 x 18.2&nbsp;cm
|
| Tršćanski odlomak brevijara i Zagrebački odlomak brevijara (Trieste breviary fragment and Zagreb breviary fragments).. Jagić 1911 published a photograph on table XIV. Dialectal influence (especially ''če'') may point to Vrbnik, Omišalj or Cres as the place of writing. Once used in the cover of a Latinic book. Acquired by Kukuljević 6 January 1867 from Stefan Kocijančić in Gorica, who acquired them from his students in Istria and Kvarner. Parchment.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Jagić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /> Photograph of one page published in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| breviary
| Fg(Br)Vb
| 1200s
| n/a
| [[Vrbnik]] parish library
| [[Krk]] (probably)
| 2
| 17 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| Vrbnički odlomci brevijara (First Vrbnik breviary fragment). Fragments A (17 x 19&nbsp;cm), B (27 x 22&nbsp;cm), C (29.5 x 23&nbsp;cm), D (23 x 20.7&nbsp;cm). Found together with Fg(Br)Vb₂. Leaves A and D belonged to the same breviary, while B and C to a different manuscript. They were used as wrappings for some parish documents.<ref name="Vajs 1903">{{cite book |first=Josef |last=Vajs |title=Recensio novi fragmentii croato-glagolitici Verbenicensis |series=Glagolitica |number=I |location=Krk |date=1903}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />

| Fragm. glag. 4

| Croatia
| 2
| 35 x 26&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 31 ro
| Odlomak Legende o svetoj Tekli (Fragment of the Legend of Saint Thecla). A note by Kukuljević points to it having been attached to the cover of BrN<sub>2</sub>. Kukuljević brought it to Zagreb, by 1853 on the evidence of Šafařík. | epistolary
| Fg(Ap)Om
| 1200s/1300s
| n/a
| [[Krk]], Archive of the original [[Old Church Slavonic Institute]]
| Croatia
| 1
| 29 x 21.5&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Omišaljski list apostola (Omišalj apostle folio). Parchment. Removed from cover of 1602 book ''Ordo baptizandi et alia sacramenta administrandi'' by Josip Hamm in 1956. Was at Omišalj. Brought to Krk.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />

| breviary
| BrVb₁<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1200s/1300s
| n/a
| [[Vrbnik]] parish library
| [[Vrbnik]]
| 259
| 35 x 27&nbsp;cm
| 2 co x 33 ro
| Prvi vrbnički brevijar (First Vrbnik breviary). Written by 3 hands.<ref name="Berčić 1864" /><ref name="Berčić 1864-1871">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Berčić |title=Ulomci svetoga pisma |date=1864–1871}}</ref><ref name="Jagić 1866" /><ref | breviary
|
| 1200s/1300s
| Fragm. glag. 14
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 1
| 32.4 x 26.4&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 30 ro
| List brevijara (lekcionara). Acquired by Kukuljević in Gorica from S. Kocijančić on 6 January 1867.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Photograph of one page published in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| breviary
|
| 1200s/1300s
| Fragm. glag. 26
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 1
| 14.8 x 21.8&nbsp;cm
|
| Komad lista brevijara. Once used as cover of manuscript of pop Antun Franki of Omišalj sign. III a 5. Acquired by Kukuljević from Stjepan Kocijančić in Gorica, who acquired it from some theology student from Omišalj. Scribe identical to that of Fragm. glag. 14.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| breviary
|
| 1200s/1300s
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata I, 96 (159), 97 (160), 161
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
| 2
| 23 x 17&nbsp;cm
|
| Dva lista. Acquired by Berčić from Korčula in 1862. Both from same manuscript. Contains the biblical story of Noah. Photograph in Karinski. Facsimile of one side of 97 in Milčetić 1955.<ref name="Berčić 1864" /><ref name="Jelić 1906" /><ref name="Karinski 1908" /><ref name="Milčetić 1955" />

==1300–1399==

| demarcation
|
| 1309 (October 15)
|
| Arhiv HAZU
| [[Novi Vinodolski]]
| 1
| 20 x 11&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| The People of Novigrad and of Bribir Solve a Border Dispute Before [[Dujam II Frankopan|Dujam Frankopan]] (Novogradci i Bribirani rješavaju granični spor pred knezom Dujmom).<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Strčić and Jašo 2000">{{cite journal |last1=Strčić |last2=Jašo |first1=P. |first2=M. |title=Dvije glagoljske isprave iz 1309. o sporu Novoga Vinodolskoga, Ledenica i Bribira |journal=Novljanski zbornik |issue=IV |location=Novi Vinodolski |date=2000 |pages=46–58}}</ref><ref name="Putanec 2000">{{cite journal |last=Putanec |first=V. |title=Prilog tumačenju glagoljske isprave iz 1309 (Raspal Rašpor, Počitelj) |journal=Novljanski zbornik |issue=IV |location=Novi Vinodolski |date=2000 |pages=59–64}}</ref><ref name="Moguš 2000">{{cite journal |last=Moguš |first=Milan |title=Filološki pogled na starohrvatske pravne spomenike |journal=Novljanski zbornik |issue=IV |location=Novi Vinodolski |date=2000 |pages=65–70}}</ref> Lost and rediscovered by Stjepan Ivšić 23 December 1929.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" /> Facsimiles published.<ref name="Geitler 1883">{{cite book |last=Geitler |first=Leopold |date=1883 |contribution=Die albanischen und slavischen Schriften |title=Die albanesischen und slavischen Schriften |trans-title=The Albanian and Slavic Scripts |language=de |location=Vienna |publisher=Alfred Hölder}}</ref><ref name="Jagić 1911">{{cite book |last=Jagić |first=Vatroslav |date=1911 |contribution=Глаголическое письмо |title=Энциклопедія славянской филологіи: Графика у славян |trans-title=The Glagolitic Script |language=ru |location=Saint Petersburg |publisher=Отд-ние рус. яз. и словесности Императ. акад. наук}}</ref>
| bgcolor=#FFE6FB | [https://archive.org/details/diealbanesische00geit/page/n249/mode/2up Geitler]

| demarcation
|
| 1309 (? 21)
|
| Arhiv HAZU
| [[Novi Vinodolski]]
| 1
| 20 x 11&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Isprava kojom se potvrđuje da Žlemišalj pripada Novogradcima. Written on the 21st of unknown month.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" /><ref name="Strčić and Jašo 2000" /><ref name="Putanec 2000" />
|
|-bgcolor="LightGray"
| legal
|
| 1325 (5 May)
|
|
|
|
|
|
| Istrian Demarcation (Istarski razvod). Original lost, 1546 transcript preserved.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" />
|
|-bgcolor="MistyRose"
| legal
|
| 1325 (October 8)
|
|
| [[Venice]]
|
|
|
| In Ivan Lucio's ''Memorie istoriche di Tragurio'' published 1674 in Venice on page 203, it is noted that the Register of [[Trogir]] included both a Latin and a Croatian version of orders and punishments of doge Ivan Superancio.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" />

|

| 1300s (beginning)
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata I, 65 (106)
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
| 1
|
|
| Acquired by Berčić on Ugljan 24 September 1856. Photographs published in Jagić 1911 and Milčetić 1955 (one side).<ref name="Jagić 1911" /><ref name="Milčetić 1955" />

|-
| miscellany
| Fg(C)Pis
| 1300s (beginning)<ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
| Fragm. glag. 89, 90 a-j
| Arhiv HAZU, Pazin (Franjevački samostan)
| Croatia
| 17
| 15 x 22.5&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Pazin Miscellany fragments (Pazinski odlomci zbornika, Odlomak neke legende ili slova). [[Ivan Kukuljević Sakcinski]] found 11 fragments, while 6 were found in 2005 in the Franciscan Monastery of [[Pazin]]. Additional fragments discovered by brother Mavro Velnić of the Franciscan monastery in Pazin.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Premuda 1913" /><ref name="Jagić 1913" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Grabar 1973">{{cite journal |first=Biserka |last=Grabar |title=Mučenje Jakova Perzijanca u hrvatskoglagoljskim odlomcima XIV. st. |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |date=30 September 1973 |number=23 |pages=141–160 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/en/14140}}</ref><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Parchment.<ref name="Nazor 2010">{{cite journal |first=Anica |last=Nazor |title=Još glagoljskih Pazinskih fragmenata iz početka XIV. stoljeća |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |number=60 |date=2010 |pages=575–608 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/en/clanak/98563}}</ref> Facsimile published 1957.<ref name="Graz 1957">{{cite book |title=Mihanović Homiliar |series=Editiones Monumentorum Slavicorum veteris dialecti |location=Graz |date=1957}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Photograph of two pages published in Štefanić 1970.
| [https://hrcak.srce.hr/en/clanak/98563 2010] <nowiki>[partial]</nowiki>

| psalter
| [[Sofia Psalter|Ps1337]]
| 1337
| No. 2
| Library of the Bulgarian Academy of Sciences
|
| 317
|
|
| Sofia Psalter (Софийски песнивец, Pesnivec na car Yoan Aleksandъr).  with some Glagolitic (f. 269v, 270r, 271v, 272v, 273r).<ref name="Miltenov 2009" />
|
|-
| breviary
|
| 1300s (first half)
| Fragm. glag. 21/b
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 1
| 14.2 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| Komad lista brevijara (psaltira). Given to Kukuljević by Mate Volarić chaplain on Pag, probably the Mate Volarić born in Vrbnik 1825 who served in Novalja before 1856.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
| breviary
|
| 1300s (first half)
| Fragm. glag. 31/a
| Arhiv HAZU
| Omišalj?
| 4
| 21 x 19.2&nbsp;cm
|
| Četiri lista brevijara. Includes ''Proprium de tempore''. Oficij is very different from that of other Glagolitic breviaries. The use of ''če'' may point to Omišalj. On 12 August 1619 it was together with I b 68. Acquired by Kukuljević in Senj.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
| breviary
|
| 1300s (first half)
| Fragm. glag. 38/k
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 1
| 13 x 6&nbsp;cm
|
| Komadić psaltira. Contains Psalm 22:2-5, 24:3-5. Acquired by Kukuljević in Dalmacija.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
| breviary
|
| 1300s (first half)
| Fragm. glag. 59, 73
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 6
|
|
| Tri dvolista brevijara - psaltira. Acquired by Kukuljević in Croatian/Austrian Primorje. Kukuljević displayed one of them in an exhibition according to a note on its envelope.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| missal
| Fg(M)Drg<sub>1</sub>
| 1300s (first half)
|
| Državni Arhiv in Rijeka
|
|
|
|
| First Draguć Missal Fragment (Prvi dragućki fragment misala). Described by Štefanić in ''Glagoljski notarski protokol u Draguću u Istri'', "Radovi Staroslavenskog instituta" 1 (1952).<ref name="OSU 1981" />

| missal
|
| 1300s (first half)
|
| Krk (arhiv samostana trećoredaca)
| Krk
| 1
| 17.5 x 18.2&nbsp;cm
|
| Fragmenat misala. Štefanić removed it from the cover of a copy of the 1743 ''Nauk karstjanski'' of Jeronim Bonifačić.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

| Homily of Saint [[John Chrysostom]] on the Beheading of [[John the Baptist]]
| FgLab₂
| 1300s (first half)
| Glagolitica 16/I Gč 48. Fg. glag. hom.
| [[National and University Library of Slovenia]]
| Croatia
| 2
| 23.5 x 17-21.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Ljubljanski odlomak homilije (Ljubljana homily fragment). Formerly in the ''Museo Rudolphino Labacensi''.<ref>Geitler 1863.</ref><ref name="Jelić 1906" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />

| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 1
| 38 x 27&nbsp;cm
|
| List brevijara. Acquired by Kukuljević in Trsat, likely from the Franciscan monastery there.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Photograph of one page published in Štefanić 1970.

|-
| breviary
|
| 1300s (first half)
| Fragm. glag. 41
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 1
| 35.5 x 21.4&nbsp;cm
|
| List brevijara. Once used as cover of a book that was property of fra đakon Ludovik Milčetić who was gvardijan of the Franciscan monastery of the Third Order in Krk 1787-1789. Kukuljević acquired it from a Franciscan.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Photograph of one page published in Štefanić 1970.

| abecedary
|
| 1400s (after 1356)
| CLM 14684
| Munich (BSB)
|
| 100
|
|
| Emmeramer Abecedary (Emmeramer Abecedarien). In Latin manuscript with other alphabets including Glagolitic and Cyrillic.<ref name="Halm et al. 1876">{{cite book |first1=Carolus |last1=Halm |first2=Fridericus |last2=Keinz |first3=Guilelmus |last3=Meyer |first4=Georgius |last4=Thomas |title=Catalogus codicum latinorum Bibliothecae Regiae Monacensis |language=la |trans-title=Catalogue of Latin Codices of the Royal Library of Munich |volume=II,2 |location=Munich |date=1876 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=tG1oAAAAcAAJ}}</ref><ref name="Bischoff 1981">{{cite journal |first=Bernhard |last=Bischoff |title=Übersicht über die nichtdiplomatischen Geheimschriften des Mittelalters |language=de |journal=Mittelalterliche Studien |volume=III |location=Stuttgart |date=1981 |pages=120–148}}</ref><ref name="Marti 1991" />

| XXIII G 67

| 12 x 10&nbsp;cm

| SANU-Beograd

| missal
| [[Missal of duke Novak|MNov]]<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1368
| Codex slave 8
| [[Austrian National Library]]
| [[Lika]]
| 271
| 32 x 24&nbsp;cm
| 2 co x 29 ro
| Novak's Missal (Misal kneza Novaka, Novakov misal). Written and illuminated by [[knez (title)|knez]] Peter Novak Disislavić of clan Mogorović, a knight in the court of king [[Louis I of Hungary]]. It later served as the type for the [[Missale Romanum Glagolitice]].<ref name="Berčić 1864" /><ref name="Jelić 1906" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Vajs 1948" /><ref name="Štefanić 1952" /><ref name="Pantelić 1967">{{cite journal |first=Marija |last=Pantelić |title=Prvotisak glagoljskog misala iz 1483. prema Misalu kneza Novaka iz 1368. |language=hr |journal=Radovi Staroslavenskog Instituta |volume=6 |date=1967 |pages=5–108 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/clanak/21455}}</ref><ref name="OSU 1981" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [http://digital.onb.ac.at/RepViewer/viewer.faces?doc=DTL_6279761&order=1&view=SINGLE ÖNB], [https://glagoljica.hr/?rukopisi=iiif.v.a&id=19456 GHR]
|-
| breviary
| BrVat₅+BrVat₆<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021">{{cite journal |last1=Šimić |first1=Ana |last2=Vela |first2=Jozo |date=2021 |title=From the Little Chapters to the Big Question: How were the Croatian Glagolitic Breviaries and Missals Compiled? |language=en |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |volume=71 |pages=121–168}}</ref>
| ~1350-1375
| Borgiano illirico 5+6
| [[Vatican Library]]
| Tribihovići, Lika
| 248+212
| 31 x 22&nbsp;cm
|
| Vatikanski brevijar Illirico 5+6 (Vatican breviary Illirico 5+6). Ransomed from the Turks in 1487. At one point, this manuscript was split in two. The second half was written by a scribe named Fabijan.<ref name="Assemani 1755">{{cite book |first=Giuseppe Simone |last=Assemani |title=Kalendaria Ecclesiae Slavicae |date=1755}}</ref><ref name="Kukuljević 1857 putovanje">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Kukuljević |title=Izvjestje o putovanju kroz Dalmaciju u Napulj i Rim s osobitim obzirom na slavensku književnost, umjetnost i starine |location=Zagreb |date=1857}}</ref><ref name="Berčić 1864" /><ref name="Jelić 1906" /><ref name="Vajs 1910" /><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Hamm 1953">{{cite journal |last=Hamm |first=Josip |date=1953 |title=Varijante u prijepisima hrvatskih glagoljaša |trans-title=Variants in the Copies of Croatian Glagolites |language=hr |journal=Slovo |volume=2 |pages=13–35}}</ref><ref name="Hamm 1958">{{cite journal |last=Hamm |first=Josip |date=1958 |title=Judita u hrvatskim glagoljskim brevijarima |trans-title=Judith in Croato-Glagolitic Breviaries |language=hr |journal=Radovi Staroslavenskog Instituta |volume=3 |pages=5–72 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/clanak/21480}}</ref><ref name="Džurova et al. 1985">{{cite book |last1=Džurova |first1=Axinia |last2=Japundžić |first2=Marko |last3=Stančev |first3=Krasimir |date=1985 |title=Catalogo dei manoscritti slavi della Biblioteca Vaticana |trans-title=Catalogue of Slavic Manuscripts in the Vatican Library |language=it |location=Sofia |publisher=Svjat}}</ref><ref name="Damjanović 2001">{{cite journal |last=Damjanović |first=Stjepan |date=2001 |title=Muka kao nepresušno nadahnuće kulture |trans-title=Suffering as an Unquenchable Inspiration of Culture |language=hr |journal=Pasionska baština |pages=89–95}}</ref><ref name="Badurina Stipčević 2004a">{{cite journal |last=Badurina Stipčević |first=Vesna |date=2004 |title=The Old Testament Book of Esther in Croatian Glagolitic Vatican Illirico 5 Breviary from 14th century |journal=Palaeoslavica |volume=XXII/2 |pages=5–39}}</ref><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />
|

| grant
|
| 1372 (October 5)
|
| Ljubljana (archive of Franciscan monastery)
| [[Brinje]]
| 1
| 25.5 x 13.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Lord [[Ivan IV Frankopan|Anž Frankopan]] Grants the [[Order of Saint Paul the First Hermit|Pauline]] Monastery the Proceeds from his Lands in [[Draga Bašćanska|Baška Draga]] to the Monastery of Holy Salvation by [[Senj]] (Knez Anž Frankapan daruje pavlinskom samostanu Sv. Spasa kod Senja prihode s njegovih posjeda u Baškoj Drazi). First published 1954 by Vjekoslav Štefanić.<ref name="Štefanić 1954">{{cite journal |last=Štefanić |first=Vjekoslav |date=1954 |location=Zagreb |title=Dvije frankapanske glagoljske darovnice pavlinima (g. 1372. i 1452.) |journal=Zbornik historijskoga instituta JAZU |pages=137–141 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=181317}}</ref><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
| [https://hrcak.srce.hr/clanak/124579 1954]
|-
| miscellany
| CPar<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1375
| Slave 73
| [[Bibliothèque nationale de France]]
| Croatia
| 296
| 15 x 11.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Borislavićev zbornik. Acquired by Paris from Spain in 1951. Described in Tadin 1954, ''Recueil glagolitique croate de 1375''.<ref name="Tadin 1954 Recueil">{{cite journal |first=Marin |last=Tadin |language=fr |title=Recueil glagolitique croate de 1375 |journal=Revue des Études Slaves |location=Paris |date=1954 |volume=31 |pages=21–32 |doi=10.3406/slave.1954.1616 |url=https://www.persee.fr/doc/slave_0080-2557_1954_num_31_1_1616}}</ref><ref name="OSU 1981" /><ref name="Badurina-Stipčević 2004 Slave 73">{{cite journal |first=Vesna |last=Badurina-Stipčević |title=Muka Kristova po Marku u hrvatskoglagoljskom Pariškom zborniku Slave 73 |journal=Filologija |year=2004 |volume=42 |issue=42 |pages=1–21 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/en/156904}}</ref><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/btv1b52511552v?rk=21459;2 BnF]
|-
| legal
|
| 1375
|
| Arhiv HAZU
| [[Baška, Croatia|Baška]]
| 1
| 22+11.5 x 32&nbsp;cm
|
| Senjanin Ivan Mikulanić prodaje pavlinskom samostanu Sv. Spasa kod Senja zemljišni posjed u Baškoj Drazi za 12 dukata; Rada, kći Krasnelinova, daruje samostanu sv. Spasa zemlju u Bašci na otoku Krku. Acquired by Kukuljević Sakcinski.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> One deed dated 11 August 1375 (written by "Mirša prvad, ki sam pisac opći"),<ref name="Kolanović 1983" /> another dated 23 September, both on same parchment.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
|
|-bgcolor="MistyRose"
| legal
|
| 1379 (March 12)
|
| Dobrinj (župni arhiv), Arhiv HAZU
| Dobrinj
|
|
|
| Pavao Banić i njegov brat Dminić prodaju zemlje i drmune plovanu Mavru od Dobrinja. Survives in 18th century Latin transcription by Antun Cutinis, which preserves the Glagolitic year and one I. Acquired by Kukuljević.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Kept at Arhiv HAZU. Glagolitic transcription by Antun Cutinis from second half of 18th century discovered in the same book in the župni arhiv in Dobrinj in which the 1100 grant survives, but it seems to be a back-translation from Latin or Italian.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
|
|-
| missal
|
| 1300s (first half to middle)
| Fragm. glag. 106
| Arhiv HAZU
| Kvarner or Istria?
| 10
| 29.8 x 22.8&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 28 ro
| Počinini odlomci misala. Parchment. Includes marginal note on f. 1 by Mateša Tomičin. Jagić and Štefanić places its origin in Kvarner or Istria by words ''sutlь'' and ''petěhь''. But it arrived in the Zadar-Šibenik archipelago judging from the character of the note. Discovered by Zadar professor-priest Roko Počina around 1890, who donated them to JAZU.<ref name="Jagić 1900">{{cite journal |first=Vatroslav |last=Jagić |title=Bruchstück eines glagolitischen Messbuches |journal=Archiv für slavische Philologie |volume=XXII |date=1900 |language=de |pages=525–542}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1960" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|

| missal
|
| 1300s (first half to middle)<ref name="Paclova 1962" />
| fragments collection, No 1
| Wertheim (Löwenstein-Wertheim archive)
| Croatia or Prague
| 2
| 35 x 21 cm
|
| Wetheim fragments.<ref name="Pacnerova 2008" /> First reported by Schuster.<ref name="Bohm 1959">{{cite book |first=Hans |last=Böhm |title=Das Wertheimer glagolitische Fragment |location=Meissenheim am Glan |date=1959}}</ref> Written in Prague or brought there from Pašman.<ref name="Paclova 1962">{{cite journal |first=Ilona |last=Páclová |title=Zpráva o knize Hans Böhm: Das Wetheimer glagolitische Fragment |language=cs |journal=Slavia: časopis pro slovanskou filologii |issn=0037-6736 |date=1962 |volume=31 |location=Prague |pages=649–650 |url=https://kramerius.lib.cas.cz/view/uuid:4715a393-518b-11e1-1027-001143e3f55c?page=uuid:4715a3a0-518b-11e1-1027-001143e3f55c}}</ref>

|-
| breviary
| Fg(Br)Foj
| 1300s (middle)
| n/a
| n/a
| Croatia
| 1
| 17.5 x 23&nbsp;cm
|
| Fojnički glagoljski odlomak brevijara (Fojnica Glagolitic breviary fragment). It was found in 1950 by [[Josip Hamm]] in the [[Fojnica Franciscan Monastery]], and for some time it was kept in the library of the Franciscan Monastery of Sants Peter and Paul on the Hill in [[Livno]], but today it is lost. Text closest to BrVat<sub>19</sub>.<ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> It was used in the binding of the printed ''Razmišljanja'' of Matija Jerković published 1582 in Venice.<ref name="OSU 1981" /><ref name="Šimić 2010">{{cite journal |first=Marinka |last=Šimić |title=Fojnički glagoljski fragment brevijara |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |number=60 |date=2010 |pages=687–724 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/en/clanak/98571}}</ref>

| 16
|
| 2 co
| Ostrišci iz Apokrifa o prepiranju Isusa s Đavlom. 16 small and very small fragments. Similar to text of IV a 48 and VII 30.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

|-
| breviary
|
| 1300s (middle)
| Fragm. glag. 60, 82 (III b 10)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 3
|
|
| Tri lista brevijara. Fragment 82 was once used as a cover of ''Ordo agendorum et cantandorum in actibus Processionalibus pro FF. Franciscanis regularis observantiae in provincia Bosnae, Croaticae, Carniolae etc. Venetiis MDCLX''. Other papers used for the same cover were written in Latinic and belonged to a 17th century school practice book in a Kajkavian dialect with Hungarian orthography. Acquired by Kukuljević from the fratarska knjižnica u Klanjcu.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| homily
|
| 1300s (middle)
| Fragm. glag. 108
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 2
| 13.5 x 10.2&nbsp;cm
|
| Fragment govora o svetkovanju nedjelje. Translation from Czech.<ref name="Havranek 1940">{{cite book |first=Bohuslav |last=Havránek |contribution=Staročeská literatura v hlaholském písemnictví charvátskem |language=cs |title=Co daly naše země Evropě a lidstvu |location=Prague |date=1940}}</ref><ref name="Šterbova 1954">{{cite book |first=Markéta |last=Štěrbová |contribution=K otázce bohemik v charvátsko-hlaholském písmenictví |title=Studie a práce linguistické I |location=Prague |date=1954 |pages=376–384}}</ref> Graphically similar to IV d 56 of Novi Vinodolski. Once possession of Benković family in Grižane. Probably once part of Kukuljević collection.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Photograph of one page published in Štefanić 1970.

| confirmation deed
|
| 1380
| ''Pergamene dell' Archivio Notarile di Zara'', fasc. I No 219 (A. 1380)
| Državni arhiv Zadar
| Sokol (Bihać)
| 1
| 22.5 x 15&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Sokol confirmation (Sokolska isprava). ''Sokolski knez Ilprant i podknez Petar Svija zajedno sa bihaćkim sucima potvrđuju da je Stanislav, sin Novakov, koji je bio u sporu s Cvitom Filetom, vlasnik jednog zemljišnog posjeda kod Bihaća.'' First published in Latinic translation with photograph 1927 by Arturo Cronia and Glagolitic abecedary inside cover.<ref name="Cronia 1927">{{cite journal |first=Arturo |last=Cronia |title=Jedna glagolska listina iz godine 1380. |journal=Glasnik Zemaljskoga muzeja u Bosni i Hercegovini |issue=39 |date=1927 |pages=221–224}}</ref><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| 1381 (August 9)
|
| Arhiv HAZU
| [[Modruš]]
| 1
| 25 x 18&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Knez krčki Stefan odpuštja fratrom manastira sv. Spasa dohodke, koji su ga išli od njihovih vinogradah u drazi bašćanskoj. Acquired by Kukuljević Sakcinski.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šafarik 1853">{{cite book |first=Pavel Jozef |last=Šafár̆ik |publisher=Bohumil Haase |title=Památky hlaholského písemnictví |location=Prague |date=1853}}</ref><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> First published by Šafařík.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
|
|-
| breviary
| BrAc<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1384?
| III c 12 (Kuk. 802)
| [[Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts|Arhiv HAZU]]
| [[Istria]]
| 70
| 29.2 x 20.5&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 42 ro
| Akademijin brevijar (Academy Breviary). It includes a psalter. One hand f. 1-61c, a different hand f. 61d-70d. First hand is more conservative and similar in ornamentation of initials in BrDrg and likely the same as hand A of BrDrg (which is dated 1407). Second hand likely responsible for ornamentations. Dated to 1384 on the basis of the Easter table. Probably from the Pavlikani rather than Benediktinci or Franjevci. Kukuljević believed it was from Istria. It may have been, but Kukuljević purchased it from the Rosenthal antiquary in Munich after receiving the notice about it being for sale through Ivan Frankói who forwarded it 11 July 1879. Acquired by JAZU through Kukuljević archive.<ref name="Vajs 1910" /><ref name="Vajs 1911">{{cite journal |first=Josef |last=Vajs |title=Лунныя обозначенія въ календаряхъ глаголическихъ рукописей |language=ru |journal=Русс. филол. вѣстникъ |volume=LXV |location=Warsaw |date=1911}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Vajs 1916">{{cite book |first=Josef |last=Vajs |title=Psalterium palaeoslovenicum croato-glagoliticum |location=Prague |date=1916}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref>{{cite journal |last=Šimić |first=Marinka |date=2006 |title=Grafijske i fonološke osobitosti ''Akademijina brevijara'' (III c 12) |trans-title=Graphical and Phonological Qualities of the ''Academy Breviary'' (III c 12) |language=hr |journal=Rasprave Instituta Za Hrvatski Jezik I Jezikoslovlje |volume=32 |pages=249–267}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |last=Šimić |first=Marinka |date=2008 |title=Leksik psaltira ''Akademijina brevijara'' (III c 12) |trans-title=Lexicology of the Psalter in the ''Academy Breviary'' (III c 12) |language=hr |journal=Slovo |volume=56-57 |issn=0583-6255 |pages=531–544}}</ref><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Partial facsimile in Vajs 2016 ([https://archive.org/details/psalteriumpalaeo01vajs/page/12/mode/2up IA]). Photograph of one page published in Štefanić 1970.
|

| treaty
|
| 1393 (August 15)
|
| Arhiv HAZU
| [[Počitelj, Gospić|Počitelj]]
| 1
| 35 x 12&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Počitelj treaty (Počiteljska isprava). Tomaš and Butko, lords of Krbava, confirm a peace between Dujmam Miničević and Netrmac and his kin. Acquired by Kukuljević Sakcinski.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šafarik 1853" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Jagić 1911" /> First published by Šafárik 1853. Jagić photograph incomplete, Geitler photograph complete.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" /><ref name="Geitler 1883" />

| fourfold gospel
| [[Reims Gospel|Dur]]
| 1395
| Manuscrits. Ms. 255
| [[Carnegie Library of Reims]]
|
| 32
| 23.5 x 17.6&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Codex written in the [[Emmaus monastery]] in [[Prague]], commonly known as the Emmaus Evangelie or Reims Gospel.<ref name="Berčić 1864-1871" /><ref name="Jelić 1906" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Includes a Czech Glagolitic colophon.<ref name="Pastrnek 1891">{{cite journal |first=F. |last=Pastrnek |title=Evangelium Sázavo-emauzské čili remešské |language=cs |trans-title=The Emmaus or Reims Gospel |journal=ČMM |volume=15 |date=1891 |pages=331–340}}</ref><ref name="Leger 1899">{{cite journal |first=L. |last=Leger |title=L'Évangéliaire Slavon de Reims |language=fr |trans-title=The Reims Slavonic Gospel |journal=Texte du Sacre |date=1899}}</ref><ref name="Vykoukal 1948">{{cite book |first=A. |last=Vykoukal |contribution=Remešský staroslovanský Evangeliář, zvaný "Texte du sacre", s liturgického hlediska |title=Slovanské studie |language=cs |trans-title=Slavic Studies |date=1948 |pages=189–206}}</ref><ref name="Hamm 1952" />
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://www.bm-reims.fr/PATRIMOINE/doc/SYRACUSE/1866490/liber-evangeliarum-et-epistolarum-ad-usum-ecclesiae-ss-hieronymi-et-procopii-pragensis-vulgo-texte-d BMR]

| demarcation
|
| 1395 (November 2)
| ''Acta Collegii Jesuitarum Fluminensis''
| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| Divin?<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
|
|
|
| Kožljac demarcation (Kožljački razvod). A Latin translation also survives alongside a Latin act from 1539. A 17th century Glagolitic transcription also survives.<ref name="Kukuljević 1852">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Kukuljević Sakcinski |title=Arkiv za povjestnicu jugoslavensku |volume=2 |date=1852}}</ref><ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Vlahov 2010">{{cite journal |first=Dražen |last=Vlahov |title=Zbirka glagoljskih isprava iz Istre |journal=DAPA, Posebna Izdanja 19, Glagoljski Rukopisi 8 |language=hr |location=Pazin |date=2010 |pages=98–101}}</ref> Once kept in Budapest in the Hungarian National Archive as M.O.D.L. 35819.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| miscellany
| CIv (CIvan)
| 1300s-1400s or 1395<ref name="Jelić 1906" />
|
| Saint Francis Xavier Monastery in Zagreb
| Croatia
|
|
|
| Ivančićev zbornik (Ivančić miscellany). Once at Glavotok. | breviary
| BrVO<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1396
| Codex slave 3 (Cod. slav. 3)
| [[Austrian National Library]]
| [[Omišalj]]
| 468
| 35 x 27&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Brevijar Vida Omišljanina (Breviary of Vid of Omišalj). The first part, until page 379, was written by a scribe named Vid of Omišalj, for the church of [[Roč]].<ref name="Črnčić 1859">{{cite journal |first=Ivan |last=Črnčić |title=Vid Omišljanin, naš pisac XIV. vieka |journal=Zagrebački katolički list |date=1859 |number=43 |url=https://archive.org/details/zagrebacki_katolicki_list_tecaj_deseti_1859}}</ref><ref name="Berčić 1864-1871" /><ref name="Vajs 1905 Ruta">{{cite book |first=Josef |last=Vajs |title=Knjiga o Ruti |series=Glagolitica |number=2 |date=1905}}</ref><ref name="Jelić 1906" /><ref name="Vajs 1910" /><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="Birkfellner 1975">{{cite book |last=Birkfellner |first=Gerhard |date=1975 |title=Glagolitische und kyrillische Handschriften in Österreich |trans-title=Glagolitic and Cyrillic Manuscripts in Austria |language=de |location=Vienna |publisher=Austrian Academy of Sciences}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |last=Mihaljević |first=Milan |date=1997 |title=Jezična slojevitost Brevijara Vida Omišljanina iz 1396. godine |trans-title=Linguistic Layering in the Breviary of Vitus of Omišalj from 1396 |language=hr |journal=Suvremena Lingvistika |volume=43-44 |pages=191–209}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |last=Badurina Stipčević |first=Vesna |date=2009 |title=''Knjige o Makabejcima'' u hrvatskoglagolkskoj književnosti: ''Druga knjiga o Makabejcima'' u hrvatskoglagoljskim brevijarima |trans-title=''The Books of Maccabees'' in Croato-Glagolitic Literature: ''The Second Book of Maccabees'' in Croato-Glagolitic Breviaries |language=hr |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |volume=59 |pages=1–75}}</ref><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />

| abecedary
|
| 1390s
| Ms. 95
| Tours (Bibliothèque municipale)
| [[Sorbonne University|Sorbonne]]
| 129
|
|
| Paris abecedary (''Istud alphabetum et chrawaticum''). In Latin manuscript with Glagolitic f. 075v-78v. Scribe: [[George of Slavonia|Georgius de Sclavonia]] "Juraj iz Slavonije" of Brežice on the Sava.<ref name="Kos 1924">{{cite journal |first=Milko |last=Kos |title=Slovanski teksti v kodeksu 95 mestne biblioteke v Toursu |journal=Slavia: časopis pro slovanskou filologii |volume=3 |date=1924 |pages=371–391}}</ref><ref name="Šanjek and Tandarić 1984">{{cite journal |first1=Franjo |first2=Josip |last1=Šanjek |last2=Tandarić |title=Juraj iz Slavonije (oko 1355/60-1416.) profesor Sorbonne i pisac, kanonik i penitencijar stolne crkve u Toursu |journal=Croatica Christiana Periodica |language=hr |volume=8 |number=13 |date=1984 |pages=1–23 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/clanak/145624}}</ref><ref name="Heger and Matillon 1986">{{cite book |first1=Henrik |first2=Janine |last1=Heger |last2=Matillon |contribution=Les Croates et la civilisation du livre |title=Actes du 1er symposium international d'études sur l'aire culturelle croate |location=Paris |date=1986}}</ref><ref name="Šanjek 1988">{{cite book |first=Franjo |last=Šanjek |title=Crkva i kršćanstvo u Hrvata. 1. Srednji vijek |location=Zagreb |publisher=Kršćanska sadašnjost |date=1988 |pages=177–181, 335–339}}</ref><ref name="Hasenohr 1992">{{cite book |first=Geneviève |last=Hasenohr |contribution=Georges d’Esclavonie |title=Dictionnaire des lettres françaises: le Moyen Âge |location=Paris |date=1992 |page=512 |url=https://www.arlima.net/eh/georges_desclavonie.html}}</ref><ref name="Tandarić 1993">{{cite book |first=Josip Leonard |last=Tandarić |contribution=Glagolski abecedarij penitencijara Jurja iz Slavonije |title=Hrvatsko-glagoljska liturgijska književnost. Rasprave i prinosi |date=1993 |location=Zagreb |pages=41–50}}</ref><ref name="Malić 1996">{{cite journal |first=Dragica |last=Malić |title=Jezik glagoljičke početnice Jurja iz Slavonije |journal=Filologija HAZU |volume=26 |date=1996 |location=Zagreb |pages=25–40 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/165299}}</ref><ref name="Žubrinić 2002">{{cite web |first=Darko |last=Žubrinić |title=Juraj Slovinac, Georges d'Esclavonie, George de Sorbonne: glagoljaš i profesor na pariškoj Sorboni od 1394. do 1403 |date=2002 |url-status=live |url=http://www.croatianhistory.net/etf/juraj.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160915231809/http://www.croatianhistory.net/etf/juraj.html |archive-date=2016}}</ref><ref name="Tenšek 2004">{{cite journal |first=Stanko |last=Tenšek |title=Hrvat - profesor na Sorboni i francuski književnik |journal=Croatica Christiana Periodica |language=hr |volume=28 |number=54 |date=2004 |pages=137–148 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/9686}}</ref><ref name="Zaradija Kiš 2008">{{cite journal |first=Antonija |last=Zaradija Kiš |title=Louis Leger (1843. - 1923.) i Juraj iz Toursa (1355./60. - 1416.) |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |number=56–57 |date=2008}}</ref><ref name="Novak 2010">{{cite journal |first=Zrinka |last=Novak |title=Juraj Slovinac - teolog i profesor pariške Sorbone |journal=Croatica Christiana Periodica |volume=34 |language=hr |number=65 |date=2010 |pages=19–28 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/63671}}</ref><ref name="Šanjek 2015">{{cite book |first=Franjo |last=Šanjek |title=Les relations franco-croates dans le domaine de la culture, des études et des sciences |series=VIIIe-XIXe siècles |location=Paris |date=2015 |pages=77–84}}</ref>

|-
|
|
| 1300s (second half)
| IV d 56
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 10
| 12.7 x 9.7&nbsp;cm
|
| Egzorcizmi, zapisi i recepti. Written in poluustav by anonymous scribe in Novi Vinodolski for use by priestss. Once belonged to the same codex as IV d 55, though the two were not written at the same time. The two were bound together by the time of the 17th century Latin notes by Mate Benković in Grižane. Possibly sent to JAZU as late as after Milčetić's work for his 1911 book and before 1913, but path to JAZU was unknown even then.<ref name="Milčetić 1913">{{cite journal |first=Ivan |last=Milčetić |title=Stari glagolski recepti, egzorcizmi i zapisi |language=hr |trans-title=Old Glagolitic Recipes, Exorcisms and Notes |journal=Vjesnik Staroslavenske Akademije |volume=I |location=Krk |date=1913 |pages=61–69 |url=https://archive.org/details/vjesnikstaroslav02star}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Photograph of one page published in Štefanić 1970.
