| missal
|
| 1300s
| Fragm. glag. 100
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 2
| 20.2 x 15&nbsp;cm
|
| Krnji dvolist misala. Text very similar to that of MVat<sub>4</sub>. Came to JAZU 1939. It was used as the cover of a ''Quadernicha'' notebook dated 1670 or later originating with the family Miklić of Bribir in Vinodol. Donated to JAZU by Fran Jurković, principal of the građanska škola in Sušak. Parchment.<ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

Veder |hdl=1811/91960 |url=https://kb.osu.edu/handle/1811/91960}}</ref><ref name="OSU 1981">{{cite journal |last1=Allisandratos |first1=Julia |last2=Beynen |first2=Bert |last3=Bogdanović |first3=Dimitrije |last4=Capaldo |first4=Mario |last5=Cazacu |first5=Petǎr |last6=Džurova |first6=Aksinija |last7=Dujčev |first7=Ivan |last8=Fine |first8=John |last9=Fullerton |first9=Sharon |last10=Gribble |first10=Charles |last11=Huntley |first11=David |last12=of Holy Trinity Monastery Jordanville |first12=Ioannikos |last13=Kasinec |first13=Edward |last14=Kožuharov |first14=Stefan |last15=Kuev |first15=Kujo |last16=Lebo |first16=Maxine |last17=Lunt |first17=Horace |last18=Matejić |first18=Mateja |last19=Matejić |first19=Predrag |last20=Matejka |first20=Ladislav |last21=Mathiesen |first21=Robert |last22=McDaniel |first22=Gordon |last23=Mutafčieva |first23=Vera |last24=Nedić |first24=Vera |last25=Naumow |first25=Aleksandr |last26=Olmsted |first26=Hugh |last27=Picchio |first27=Ricardo |last28=Poirier |first28=Paul-Hubert |last29=Pope |first29=Richard |last30=Robinson |first30=Andrej |last31=Robinson |first31=David |last32=Rusek |first32=Jerzy |last33=Šarova |first33=Krumka |last34=Shashko |first34=Philip |last35=Slaveva |first35=Lidija |last36=Stolz |first36=Benjamin |last37=Tachiaos |first37=Antoine-Emile |last38=Thomson |first38=Francis |last39=Twarog |first39=Leon |last40=Van den Baar |first40=Anton |last41=Veder |first41=William |last42=Velčeva |first42=Borjana |last43=Waugh |first43=Daniel |last44=Worth |first44=Dean |date=October 1981 |title=Лѣтопись: 11-13 April 1981: Columbus, OH. | [[Vrbnik]] parish library

| 295
| 36 x 27&nbsp;cm
| 2 co x 28-29 ro
| Drugi vrbnički brevijar (Second Vrbnik breviary). | 2 co
| Ulomak brevijara.
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://digitalna.nsk.hr/pb/?object=info&id=580097 NSK], [https://glagoljica.hr/?rukopisi=iiif.v.a&id=580097 GHR]

| psalter
|
| 1300s
| F.п.I.2.
| RNB-Sankt-Peterburg
| Russia
| 334

| Psalter without commentary. Cyrillic with Glagolitic in titles.<ref name="Miltenov 2009" />
|
|-
| breviary
| BrPm<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1300s, 1400s<ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
| III b 10
| [[Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts|Arhiv HAZU]]
| Croatia
| 414
| 27.5 x 20.5&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 29 ro
| Pašmanski brevijar (Pašman breviary). First folio of codex comes from an 11th century Latin manuscript. F. 405-414 were written about a half century later and added in, paleographically dated to the 1400s. Language is ikavian but confusingly uses both ''ča'' and ''če'' like BrVb<sub>1</sub> and BrVO. Yet forms like ''(j)ema'' and ''(j)emaju'' point to it having been written in the Zadar area as opposed to Kvarner, though the text from which it was copied or possibly the original form of the manuscript were probably from Krk. Includes numerous notes, including a 15th century abecedary. The earliest datable note is from 1433 or maybe 1434. By the 1442 note of priest Radmil it was kept in the extinct village Račice (between Zadar and Vrana, near Gorica and Raštane), at least as late as 1532. Berčić learned of the breviary some time between 1850 and 1853 according to one of his manuscripts written then kept at Glavotok. Berčić wrote to Pašman parish priest Juraj Baćinić who had inherited it 1821 from the previous parish priest Grgur Burić, and related that there was a tradition the manuscript had once been part of the library of archbishop Matej Karaman. It is unknown how it ended up in JAZU but Berčić probably played a role.<ref name="Šafarik 1853" /><ref name="Šafarik 1858">{{cite book |first=Pavel Jozef |last=Šafárik |title=Über den Ursprung und die Heimath des Glagolismus |language=de |location=Prague |date=1858}}</ref><ref name="Berčić 1859" /><ref name="Berčić 1864" /><ref name="Berčić 1864-1871" /><ref name="Valjavec I">{{cite journal |first=Matija |last=Valjavec |title=O prijevodu psalma u ńekijem rukopisima hrvatsko-srpsko i bugarsko-slovenskijem |language=hr |journal=Rad |volume=XCVIII |pages=1–84 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=169503}}</ref><ref name="Valjavec II">{{cite journal |first=Matija |last=Valjavec |title=O prijevodu psalma o ńekijem rukopisima hrvatsko-srpsko- i bugarsko-slovenskijem |language=hr |journal=Rad |volume=XCIX |pages=1–72 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=169507}}</ref><ref name="Jelić 1906" /><ref name="Vajs 1908 Festschrift">{{cite book |first=Josef |last=Vajs |title=Jagić-Festschrift - Zbornik u slavu Vatroslava Jagića |location=Berlin |date=1908 |pages=230–234}}</ref><ref name="Vajs 1910" /><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Jagić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Vajs 1932" /><ref name="Hamm 1952" /><ref name="Hamm 1953" /><ref name="Hamm 1958" /><ref name="Vašica and Vajs 1957">{{cite book |first1=Josef |first2=Josef |last1=Vašica |last2=Vajs |title=Soupis staroslovanských rukopisů Národního musea v Praze |location=Prague |date=1957}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1969">{{cite book |last=Štefanić |first=Vjekoslav |date=1969 |title=Glagoljski rukopisi Jugoslavenske akademije znanosti i umjetnosti |trans-title=Glagolitic Manuscripts of the Yugoslav Academy of Sciences and Arts |language=hr |location=Zagreb |publisher=[[Yugoslav Academy of Sciences and Arts]]}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Photograph of three pages published in Štefanić 1970. Šafařík made a transcription housed in Prague under sign. IX E 20.<ref name="Spurna 2016">{{cite journal |first=Kateřina |last=Spurná |title=Šafaříkova knihovna ve spírkách knihovny Národního muzea |language=cs |trans-title=Šafarik's Library in the Collections of the Library of the National Museum |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |volume=66 |date=2016 |location=Zagreb |pages=185–207}}</ref>

| rule
| RegBen
| 1300s (end)
| I a 74 (Kuk. Cod. Glag. X)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 60
| 17.2 x 12.8&nbsp;cm
|
| Regula svetoga Benedikta (Rule of Saint Benedict).<ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> The only surviving Rule of Saint Benedict in the Glagolitic tradition. Written for the Rogovska opatija, which retained its name after moving in 1129 from the mainland near Biograd na More to Tkon on Pašman. It may have been copied from an original from the 12th century. It was probably written during the abbacy of the Petar who reigned 1364-1380. The earliest dated note is from 1406. Facsimile by Ostojić.<ref name="Šafarik 1853" /><ref name="Jagić 1866" /><ref name="Pavić 1875">{{cite journal |first=A. |last=Pavić |title=Regule sv. Benedikta |language=hr |journal=Starine JAZU |volume=VII |location=Zagreb |date=1875 |pages=57–129}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Vajs 1932" /><ref name="Pechuška 1940">{{cite journal |first=Fr. |last=Pechuška |title=Benediktinské opatství Rohovské v Dalmacii |language=cs |journal=ČKD |volume=80 |location=Prague |date=1940}}</ref><ref name="Kirigin 1940">{{cite journal |first=Martin |last=Kirigin |title=Iz starohrvatskoga prijevoda pravila sv. Benedikta |language=hr |journal=Život s crkvom |volume=VI |location=Hvar |date=1940 |pages=158–164}}</ref><ref name="Ostojić 1960">{{cite journal |first=Ivan |last=Ostojić |title=Benediktinci glagoljaši |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |number=9–10 |location=Zagreb |pages=20–22}}</ref><ref name="Ostojić 1963">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Ostojić |title=Benediktinci u Hrvatskoj |volume=I |location=Split |language=hr |date=1963}}</ref><ref name="Ostojić 1964">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Ostojić |title=Benediktinci u Hrvatskoj |volume=II |location=Split |language=hr |date=1964}}</ref><ref name="Ostojić 1965">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Ostojić |title=Benediktinci u Hrvatskoj |volume=I |location=Split |language=hr |date=1965}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Photograph of one page published in Štefanić 1970.

| 15 x 10.2&nbsp;cm
| 2 co x 28 ro
| Oxfordski brevijar (Oxford breviary). It includes a missal and a Roman Ritual. There is a date 1310 at the end, which Tadin takes as genuine, but which Vajs and du Feu dismiss as a late addition. Cyrillic "у" in the insertion умислиш on f. 244r and possibly some Cyrillic initials.<ref name="Syrku 1907">{{cite book |first=P. |last=A. Syrku |title=Заметки о славянских и русских рукописях в Bodleian Library в Оксфорде |location=Saint Petersburg |date=1907}}</ref><ref name="Jagić 1911" /><ref name="Vajs 1915b">{{cite journal |last=Vajs |first=Josef |date=1915 |title=Hlaholské kodexy v Bodlejaně v Oxfordě |trans-title=Glagolitic Codices in the Bodleian in Oxford |language=cs |journal=Časopis katol. | missal

| 1300s/1400s
|
| Škofja Loka (Capuchin Monastery)
|
|
|
| 2 co
| Used as cover of sign. Q 4 (a book printed 1686). Arrived at Škofja Loka from the Capuchin Monastery in Kranj, probably after that monastery was abolished in 1786. In 1999, brother Bono Zvonimir Šagi was informed by brother Angel Kralj that the library of the Capuchin Monastery in Škofja Loka in Slovenia had books wrapped in Glagolitic. They were first examined in 2002 by Anica Vlašić-Anić.<ref name="Vlašić-Anić 2004" />

| missal or breviary
|
| 1300s/1400s
|
| Škofja Loka (Capuchin Monastery)
|
|
|
| 2 co
| Used as cover of sign. N 4 (a book "Ritus induendi fratres et sorores / tertij ordinis"). In 1999, brother Bono Zvonimir Šagi was informed by brother Angel Kralj that the library of the Capuchin Monastery in Škofja Loka in Slovenia had books wrapped in Glagolitic. They were first examined in 2002 by Anica Vlašić-Anić.<ref name="Vlašić-Anić 2004" />

|-
| missal

| missal
|
| 1300s/1400s
| Fragm. glag. 124
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 1
| 23 x 16.3&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 30 ro
| List misala. Text includes Epistle to Timothy and Wisdom of Solomon. Used as cover of Molitvenik with sign. VIII 162 until 1960. Acquired by JAZU from remains of Jerko Gršković of Vrbnik.<ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| missal
|
| 1300s/1400s
| Fragm. glag. 69
| Arhiv HAZU
| Zadar region?
| 2
| 28 x 19.6&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 32 ro
| Dvolist misala. Mentions Vicent and Krsogon, whose cult centre was Zadar. Parchment.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
| missal
|
| 1300s/1400s
| Fragm. glag. 66
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 2
| 26 x 17.3&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 34 ro
| Dva lista misala. Once used as cover of Glagolitic manuscript of ''Regula Sv. Benedikta'' with sign. I a 74, purchased by Kukuljević 1853 in Rogovo, who removed these folia. On f. 2 there is an 18th century note by don Ive Torić of Vrgada while he was a monk on Tkon and a date 1726 mentioned. Earlier don Jive Gaćina wrote a note 24 June 1722 upon his entry into the monastery on Tkon. Folio 1 also features a 1710? note. And there are notes by a young hand practicing writing.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| missal
|
| 1300s/1400s
| Fragm. glag. 49
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 1
| 22 x 14.5&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 28 ro
| List misala. Text is Matthew 27:40-66 and corresponding mass. Includes note by pop Matij Repčić. Once used as the cover of Glagolitic manuscript of Antun Franki of Omišalj sign. III a 5. Parchment.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| 31.7 x 21.5 cm

| Svätoantonský zlomok (Báčský zlomok, Fragment iz Svetoga Antona).<ref name="Pacnerova 2008" /> Used as cover for a 17th century book. Discovered by Gajdoš in the Franciscan monastery in Sv. Anton (today Báč).<ref name="Gajdoš 1944">{{cite journal |first=Vševlad Jozef |last=Gajdoš |title=Staroslovanské pamiatky vo františkánskych knižniciach |language=sk |journal=Kultúra |date=1944 |volume=16 |pages=420–432}}</ref><ref name="Matejko 2000">{{cite journal |first=Ľubor |last=Matejko |title=Hlaholika na Slovensku. | Fragm. glag. 13 (old 13, 76)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 2
| 15.5 x 19&nbsp;cm, 16 x 20.8&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Riječki odlomak glagoljskog brevijara. Contains parts of Jeremiah, Cry of Jeremiah and John and a homily of saint Augustine. Acquired by Kukuljević at Capuchin Monastery in Rijeka. Parchment.<ref name="Ekl 1956">{{cite journal |first=Vanda |last=Ekl |title=Dvije nove glagoljske isprave iz Rijeke |journal=Jadranski zbornik |volume=I |location=Rijeka |date=1956 |pages=219–230}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1960 Rijeka">{{cite journal |first=Vjekoslav |last=Štefanić |title=Riječki fragmenti |journal=Zbornik Historijskog instituta Jugoslavenske akademije znanosti i umjetnosti |volume=3 |date=1960 |pages=215–287 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=181342}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

| abecedary
| [[Codex Gigas|AbGig]]
| 1300s/1400s (Glagolitic part)

| [[National Library of Sweden]]
| Bohemia
| 1
|
|
| Stokholm Abecedarium (Divišova abeceda, Azbukva Ogromne knjige).<ref name="Čermak 2012">{{cite book |first=Václav |last=Čermák |title=Cesty slov - Ústav pro jazyk český Akademie věd ČR |language=cs |contribution=Hlaholská abecedaria v českém prostředí |date=2012 |pages=36–42 |url=https://www.academia.edu/2961826}}</ref> Glagolitic abecedary in Codex Gigas. Folio 1 only. Abecedary written by a certain abbot Divišъ.<ref name="Baecklund 1942">{{cite journal |first=Astrid |last=Baecklund |title=Das Stockholmer Abecedarium |language=de |trans-title=The Stockholm Abecedary |journal=Språkvetenskapliga Sällskapets i Uppsala Förhandlingar |date=1942 |pages=115–149}}</ref><ref name="Marti 1991" />

==1400–1499==

| valuation
|
| 1400 (March 21)
|
| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| Dobrinj
| 1
|
| 1 co
| ''Pribko iz Senja daje procijeniti vrijednost svojeg trsja u Dobrinjskoj drazi, a koje mu je na ime duga uzeo prokurator Petar Sila.'' A Cyrillic transcription by Lopašić is kept in Arhiv HAZU.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" /><ref name="Strohal 1910">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |date=1910 |title=Glagoljski spomenici u Kr. zemaljskom arhivu |journal=Vjesnik Kr. Hrvatsko-slavonsko-dalmatinskoga Zemaljskog Arhiva |language=hr |issue=XII}}</ref> Parchment.<ref name="Kolanović 1983" />
|
|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
| missal
| Fg(M)I-3
| 1400 (about)
| Glagolitica I-3
| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| Croatia
| 4+1
| 20 x 7&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Fragmenti misala s kraja 14. ili početka 15. st. Fragments had served as cover to a copy of a 1586 book. Includes Matthew 2, 4, 8, Ezekiel 34, Sirach 24, Saint Augustine. and Latin abecedary. Donated by Vanja Radauš to HDA in 1968. Nahtigal compared it to the Ljubljana missal 162a/2.<ref name="Kolanović 1983" />
|
|-
| missal
| MBrl
| 1402
| Ms. Ham. 444
| [[Berlin State Library|SBB]]
| Krbava
| 218
| 31.5 x 21.5&nbsp;cm
| 2 co x 31 ro
| Berlinski misal (Berlin missal). Written and illuminated by Bartol Krbavac. Housed in Rome 1738-1742, and in London, and from 1822 in Berlin. Possibly catalogued in Rome 1771 but rediscovered by scholars in 1956.<ref name="Pantelić 1964">{{cite journal |first=Marija |last=Pantelić |title=Glagoljski kodeksi Bartola Krbavca |journal=Radovi Staroslavenskog Instituta |language=hr |volume=5 |date=1964 |pages=5–98 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/clanak/21463}}</ref><ref name="OSU 1981" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://digital.staatsbibliothek-berlin.de/werkansicht?PPN=PPN833354353&PHYSID=PHYS_0001&DMDID= SBB], [https://digitalna.nsk.hr/pb/?object=info&id=19335 NSK]

| miscellany
| CHva
| 1404
| I.359 (3575B)
| Biblioteca Universitaria di Bologna
| Bosnia
| 359
| 17 x 11&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Hval miscellany (Hvalov zbornik). Written by a scribe named Hval. Cyrillic with Glagolitic Dzělo in index to John.<ref name="Miltenov 2009" /><ref name="ANU BiH" />

| missal
| MHrv<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1404 (about)
| ?
| [[Topkapı Palace]]
|
| 247
| 30.6 x 22.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Misal Hrvoja Vukčića Hrvatinića (Missal of Hrvoje Vukčić Hrvatinić). Written by a scribe named Butko. Contains 94 miniatures and 380 initials.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> It is not known how it came to its present location. Facsimile published 1973 in Zagreb-Ljubljana-Graz as ''Missale Hervoiae ducis Spalatensis croato-glagoliticum.''.<ref name="Grabar et al. 1973">{{cite book |first1=Biserka |first2=Anica |first3=Marija |last1=Grabar |last2=Nazor |last3=Pantelić |title=Hrvatskoglagoljski misal Hrvoja Vukčića Hrvatinića |date=1973}}</ref><ref name="OSU 1981" />
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://digitalna.nsk.hr/pb/?object=info&id=19404 NSK], [https://glagoljica.hr/?pr=i&id=19404 GHR]
|-
| breviary
| BrDrg (BrDrag)<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1407
| III b 25
| [[Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts|Arhiv HAZU]]
| Croatia
| 196
| 29.3 x 20.6&nbsp;cm
| 2 co x 40-42 ro
| Dragućki brevijar (Draguć breviary). Written by 3-4 hands: A on f. 1-44, B on f. 44-127 and 133-156, C on f. 22 and 127d-132d, and maybe f. 190-195 (the calensar), D on 157-189 (which differs little from C but is less symmetrical and sometimes slanted). Written 1407 or maybe 1408 in an ikavian area (east of Istria), possibly with the same fate as MNov: being brought to Istria after the Battle of Krbava, where the ekavian notes were made. The calendar focuses on Zadar saints and was likely written by Pavlini, with the saints of other orders added later when it was brought to [[Draguć]]. A later note from 1566 attests to its presence in Hum. It is unknown where Kukuljević obtained it.<ref name="Jagić 1866" /><ref name="Vajs 1910" /><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1952 Draguć">{{cite journal |last=Štefanić |first=Vjekoslav |date=1952 |title=Glagoljski notarski protokol iz Draguća u Istri (1595.-1639) s uvodom o Draguću i njegovim glagoljskim spomenicima |journal=Radovi Staroslavenskog Instituta |language=hr |volume=1 |pages=73–174 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/clanak/21511}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Photograph of one page published in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| grant
|
| 1413 (April 11)
| GL. II.1.
| Arhiv HAZU
| [[Baška, Croatia|Baška]]
| 1
| 23.5 x 10.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Ivanola, sin Petra Prvošića, daruje samostanu sv. Nikole zemlju u Bašci. Acquired by Kukuljević, then by JAZU. First published by Šafarik 1853.<ref name="Šafarik 1853" /><ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Črnčić 1867">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Črnčić |date=1867 |location=Rome |title=Najstarija povijest o krčkoj, osorskoj, rabskoj, senjskoj i krbavskoj biskupiji}}</ref><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
|

| legal
|
| 1414
| Sign. Gl. II.2
| Arhiv HAZU
| [[Baška, Croatia|Baška]]
|
|
|
| Zela, žena Kablovićeva, daruje samostanu sv. Spasa zemlju u Bašci. Acquired by Kukuljević.<ref name="Šafarik 1853" /><ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

|-
| Comestor<ref name="Pacnerova 2008" />
| FgKrt
| 1400s (early)
| J 4118
| Prague (Emmaus Monastery)
| Slovak National Library
| 1
| 36.5 x 25 cm
| 2 co
| Krtíški odlomak. Part of the Czech Glagolitic translation of the Comestor of Peter of Troyes.<ref name="Pacnerova 2002">{{cite book |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerová |title=Staročeský Hlaholský Comestor |language=cs |trans-title=The Old Czech Glagolitic Comestor |date=2002 |location=Prague}}</ref> Thought by Jagić to have been brought to Slovakia following the Battle of the White Mountain of 1620. Once used as cover of a translation of Luther's Pastoral owned by a priest Ezekiel dated 1633. Discovered by Samuel Zoch in the library of the Kalmár family in Velky Krtíš.<ref name="Zoch 1907">{{cite journal |first=Ivan Branislav |last=Zoch |title=Krtíšsky glagolský pergament |journal=Slovenské pohĺady |language=sk |date=1907 |pages=19–26}}</ref><ref name="Ryšanek 1932">{{cite journal |first=F. |last=Ryšánek |date=1932 |title=Krtíšský hlaholský zlomek |language=cs |journal=Bratislava |volume=6 |pages=584–597}}</ref> After 1918 it entered the archives of the Muzej slovenskej spoločnosti in Martin, having been donated by Zoch's son-in-law Jozef Dohnány. In 1930 the archivist Mária Jeršová-Opočenská lent it to professor František Ryšánek. It was lost until Milan Vároš unsuccessfully searched for it in 2007, but Leon Sokolovský joined the search and found it and in 2008 it was given to the Slovak National Library.<ref name="Brinckova 2012" /><ref name="Ivanič and Kralčak 2016" />
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://www.wdl.org/en/item/14214/#languages=chu WDL]

| Zbytky ze "Všeobecného dějepisu".<ref name="Vašica and Vajs 1957" /><ref name="Pacnerova 1963" /><ref name="NM 2022" /> Part of the Staročeský glagolský Comestor. Its existence was first noted by F. Ryšánek.<ref name="Pacnerova 2008" />

|-
| Comestor
|
| 1400s (early)
| 1 D c 1/18 (1 sklo)
| Prague (National Museum)
| Prague (Emmaus Monastery)
| 2
|
|
| Zlomky české hlaholsky psané bible.<ref name="Vašica and Vajs 1957" /><ref name="Pacnerova 1963" /><ref name="NM 2022" /> Incorrectly identified as part of the Czech Glagolitic Bible. Actually part of the of the Staročeský glagolský Comestor. Its existence was first noted by J. Izvěkov.<ref name="Pacnerova 2008" /> Part published 1905.<ref name="Izvekov 1905" />
|
|-
| Comestor
|
| 1400s (early)
| inv. č. 4613
| Státní oblastní archiv v Třeboni
| Prague (Emmaus Monastery)
| 8
|
|
| Třeboňské zlomky I. 4 fragments all of the same manuscript. Discovered by A. Kalný at the end of 1959 in the bindings of the Buquoy fund of Nová Hrad in the Statní oblastní archiv in Třeboň. One of them was taken from the receipts and expenditures book of the Chapel of the Seven Sorrows of Virgin Mary in Herrnlesbrunn (in the village of Rožmberk on the Vltava).<ref name="Pacnerova 1962">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerová |title=Třeboňské zlomky staročeského hlaholského komestora |trans-title=Třeboň Fragments of the Old Czech Glagolitic Comestor |journal=Listy filologické |volume=85 |issue=2 |date=1962 |pages=256-272, I-XVI |jstor=23463316 |url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/23463316}}</ref><ref name="Pacnerova 2008" />
|
|-
| Comestor
|
| 1400s (early)
| inv. č. 4613
| Státní oblastní archiv v Třeboni
| Prague (Emmaus Monastery)
| 12
|
|
| Třeboňské zlomky II. 6 bifolia. Discovered in the bindings of orphan registers from the 17th and 18th centuries from the collections of the Rožmberk Great Estate, discovered there by Adolf Kalný in 1964.<ref name="Pacnerova 1964">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerová |title=Nález dalších zlomků staročeského hlaholského Komestora |language=cs |journal=Slavia |issn=0037-6736 |date=1965 |volume=34 |issue=1 |pages=333–334 |url=https://www.digitalniknihovna.cz/knav/view/uuid:59dd12da-02f4-4d8f-acd4-8f59e1957607?page=uuid:d62f9eab-e6fd-4be9-9ec0-ab3857da994f}}</ref><ref name="Pacnerova 1971">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerová |title=Třeboňské zlomky staročeského hlaholského Komestora II |language=cs |trans-title=Třeboň Fragments of the Old Czech Glagolitic Comestor II |journal=Listy filologické |volume=94 |issue=1 |date=1971 |pages=64–68 |jstor=23466455 |url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/23466455}}</ref><ref name="Pacnerova 2008" /> Text of the fragments published by Pacnerová 1969.<ref name="Pacnerova 1969">{{cite book |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerová |title=Staročeský hlaholský Komestor |language=cs |trans-title=Old Czech Glagolitic Comestor |location=Brno |date=1969}}</ref> They are important in the study of Glagolitic higher numerals.<ref name="Pacnerova 1968">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerová |title=Číselné značky pro tisíce ve staročeském hlaholském Komestoru |language=cs |journal=Slavia |issn=0037-6736 |volume=37 |date=1968 |pages=587–589 |url=https://kramerius.lib.cas.cz/view/uuid:4b11d773-518b-11e1-1027-001143e3f55c?page=uuid:4b11d9d1-518b-11e1-1027-001143e3f55c}}</ref>

|
| Zlomek archivní školy.<ref name="Vašica and Vajs 1957" /><ref name="Pacnerova 1963" /> Discovered on the cover of a farm book of a South Bohemian patrimony on the Rožmberk estate, which was kept in the State archive in Prague and later in the library there. Published 1948.<ref name="Ryšanek 1948">{{cite journal |first=František |last=Ryšánek |title=Dalši zlomek českého hlaholského Komestora |language=cs |journal=Slovanské studie |location=Prague |date=1948 |pages=207–225}}</ref> It is now missing.<ref name="Pacnerova 2008" />

| Vyšebrod Bible (Czech Glagolitic Bible, Emmaus Bible, Bible Vyšebrodská, Bible Emauzská).<ref name="Kolar 1866">{{cite journal |first=J. |last=Kolář |title=Zpráva o II. dílu české bible Hlaholské, podaná dne 3. 12. 1866. v Královské české společnosti nauk |language=cs |journal=Sitzungsberichte der königlichen böhmischen Gesellschaft der Wissenschaften in Prag |location=Prague |date=1866}}</ref><ref name="Vajs 1908 cs">{{cite journal |first=Josef |last=Vajs |title=Česká bible hlaholská |language=cs |journal=VKČSN, třída filos.-histor.-jazykozpytná |volume=13 |date=1908}}</ref><ref name="Kyas 1956">{{cite journal |first=Vladimír |last=Kyas |title=Česká Hlaholská bible v poměry k ostatním českým biblickým rukopisům |language=cs |journal=Slavia |volume=25 |issn=0037-6736 |pages=328–341 |url=https://kramerius.lib.cas.cz/view/uuid:423e2ae3-518b-11e1-1121-001143e3f55c?page=uuid:423e2c35-518b-11e1-1121-001143e3f55c}}</ref> Parchment.<ref name="Pacnerova 2008" />

| bible

| 1416 (about)
| 1 D c 1/1 (5 sklo)
| Prague (National Museum)
| Prague (Emmaus Monastery)

|
|
| Zlomek z knihy Zachariášovy a Ezechielovy.<ref name="Pacnerova 2008" /><ref name="NM 2022" /> 3 folia discovered by Ant. Schmid in Dobřichovice and Slivenec parishes on 25 March 1868 as covers for a manuscript from 1617. He took them to Prague and showed them to Kolář. Kolář determined 2 of them were Czech Glagolitic (bible fragments) but 1 was 14th century Croatian Glagolitic (a psalter fragment) 1 D c 1/1 B-C published by Kolář in 1870 (first read 21 June 1869 in at the meeting of the kr. české společnosti nauk).<ref name="Kolar 1870">{{cite journal |first=Josef |last=Kolář |title=O hlaholských zlomcích Dobřichovckých XIV. a XV. stoleti |language=cs |trans-title=On the Glagolitic Fragments from Dobřichov of the XIV. and XV. Centuries |journal=Časopis Musea království Českého |volume=44 |date=1870 |issn=1210-9746 |issue=4 |pages=391–399 |url=https://www.digitalniknihovna.cz/nm/view/uuid:a498e770-1d44-11df-9b94-000d606f5dc6?page=uuid:148b21d0-1c53-11df-a39b-000d606f5dc6}}</ref> 1 D c 1/1 D published by Pacnerová in 1979.<ref name="Pacnerova 1979">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerová |title=Miscellanea Brunensia |language=cs |journal=Kabinet cizích jazyků ČSAV |date=1979 |location=Prague |pages=115–126}}</ref><ref name="Pacnerova 1986" /> The 4th folio is not Glagolitic.<ref name="Vašica and Vajs 1957" /><ref name="Pacnerova 1963" />
|
|-
| passional, bible
|
|
| 1 D c 1/17<ref name="Vašica and Vajs 1957" /> (3 sklo)
| Prague (National Museum)
|
|
|
|
| Zlomky Skutků apoštolských a Leviticu.<ref name="Izvekov 1905">{{cite journal |first=Jiří |last=Izvěkov |title=Zbytky hlaholského písemnictví v Praze |language=cs |trans-title=Remains of Glagolitic Literature in Prague |journal=Časopis Musea království Českého |date=1905 |pages=60–64 |issn=1210-9746 |volume=79 |issue=1 |url=https://www.digitalniknihovna.cz/nm/view/uuid:d38aedd0-72b5-11e1-a224-000d606f5dc6?page=uuid:bf23ef90-72a1-11e1-8142-000d606f5dc6}}</ref><ref name="Pacnerova 1986" /><ref name="NM 2022" /> The part 1 D c 1/17 AB belongs not to the bible but to the ''Staročesky hlaholský Pasionál a Zlatá legenda'' alongside fragments 1 D c 1/19 and 1/20. The remaining part is of the Czech Glagolitic Bible (Leviticus 13,1-17).<ref name="Vašica and Vajs 1957" /><ref name="Pacnerova 1963" /> The complete text of the passional has been published in multiple works.<ref name="Hrabak 1964">{{cite book |first=J. |last=Hrabák |title=Starši česká literatura |language=cs |trans-title=Old Czech Literature |date=1964}}</ref><ref name="Pacnerova 1976">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerová |title=Staročeský hlaholský Pasionál |language=cs |trans-title=Old Czech Glagolitic Passional |journal=Listy filologické |volume=99}}</ref><ref name="Hadek 2005">{{cite book |first=Karol |last=Hádek |contribution=Vývoj slovní zasoby ve staročeském Pasionálu |language=cs |title=Verba et historia: Igoru Němcovi k 80. narozeninám |pages=105–110}}</ref>
|
|-
| bible<ref name="Pacnerova 2008" />
|
|
| 1 D c 1/21 (5 sklo)
| Prague (National Museum)
|
|
|
|
| 1 Dc 1/21.<ref name="Vašica and Vajs 1957" /> Glagolitic fragment from the black and white photo folder (Hlaholský zlomek ve složce čb fotografie).<ref name="Pacnerova 1986" /><ref name="NM 2022" /> It contains the Acts of the Apostles (1,2-28). A different Glagolitic fragment of the Acts of the Apostles was discovered in 1817 in Hanover but may have been lost.<ref name="Ryšanek 1932" /><ref name="Pacnerova 1963" />

| bible<ref name="Vašica and Vajs 1957" /><ref name="Pacnerova 1963" />
| Fg(Bib)Spiš (ZSNV)<ref name="Ivanič and Kralčak 2016" />
| 1416 (about or after)<ref name="Stankovska 2015" />
|
|
| Prague (Emmaus Monastery)
| 1
| 37.3 x 27.5 cm
| 2 co 37 ro
| Zlomok zo Spišskej Novej Vsi (Spiš fragment).<ref name="Pacnerova 1986">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerova |title=Staročeské hlaholské zlomky (kritické vydáni) |language=cs |journal=Rozpravy ČSAV, řada společenských věd |date=1986 |volume=96 |issue=4 |location=Prague |publisher=Academia}}</ref><ref name="Pacnerova 2008" /> Once used as cover of book published in Germany in the 16th century. The original manuscript was probably disassembled after the 1611 destruction of the Emmaus Monastery. Discovered by Štefan Kramár and published 1931.<ref name="Kramar 1931">{{cite journal |first=Štefan |last=Kramár |title=Zlomok z českej glagolskej biblie |language=sk |trans-title=Fragment from the Czech Glagolitic Bible |journal=Kultúra |volume=3 |pages=114–116}}</ref><ref name="Ivanič 2016">{{cite journal |first=Peter |last=Ivanič |title=Hlaholské zlomky: pamiatky napísané hlaholským písmom v slovenských archívoch |language=sk |trans-title=Glagolitic Fragments: Monuments Written in Glagolitic in Slovak Archives |journal=Historická revue: Vedecko-populárny časopis o dejinách |volume=27 |pages=72–73}}</ref><ref name="Ivanič and Kralčak 2016">{{cite journal |first1=Peter |last1=Ivanič |first2=Ľubomír |last2=Kralčák |title=Hlaholské pamiatky v slovenských archívoch |language=sk |trans-title=Glagolitic Monuments in Slovak Archives |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |volume=66 |location=Zagreb |date=2016 |pages=165–184}}</ref> Once lost but a fragment was found and confirmed to belong to it.<ref name="Pacnerova 2000">{{cite book |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerova |title=Česká bible Hlaholská (bible Vyšebrodská) |language=cs |trans-title=The Czech Glagolitic Bible (Vyšebrod Bible) |date=2000 |location=Prague}}</ref><ref name="Stankovska 2013">{{cite journal |first=P. |last=Stankovska |title=Fragment České bible hlaholské nalezený v Košicích |language=sk |trans-title=Fragment of the Czech Glagolitic Bible Discovered in Košice |journal=Slavica Slovaca |date=2013 |volume=48 |pages=125–129}}</ref><ref name="Stankovska 2015">{{cite journal |first=P. |last=Stankovska |title=Znovunalezený Spišský zlomek České bible hlaholské |language=cs |trans-title=On the Newly Discovered Spiš Fragment of the Czech Glagolitic Bible |journal=Listy filologické |date=2015 |volume=138 |pages=65–118}}</ref>

| psalter
|
| 1400s (beginning)
| 1 D c 1/22 (2)
| Prague (National Museum)
| Croatia
| 1
| 15 x 11.8 cm
|
| Zlomek chorvatsko-hlaholského žaltáře z emauzského kláštera + Vašicův rukopisný rozbor. Kurz believed it was written in Croatia then brought to Prague. The manuscript was discovered during the repair work done at the beginning of January 1952 in the Emmaus Monastery. Examined by professor Kadeřavek. Parchment.<ref name="NM 2022" />

| passional<ref name="Pacnerova 2008" />
|
| 1400s
| 1 D c 1/19<ref name="Vašica and Vajs 1957" /> (1 sklo; also written 1 Dc 1, č. 19; old Frag. Limelie bibl. vitr. Č. 26)
| Prague (National Museum)
| Prague (Emmaus Monastery)

|
|
| List z pasionálu.<ref name="Pacnerova 1963">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerová |title=České hlaholské památky |language=cs |trans-title=Czech Glagolitic Monuments |journal=Slavia |issn=0037-6736 |volume=32 |date=1963 |pages=452–457 |url=https://kramerius.lib.cas.cz/view/uuid:47dff873-518b-11e1-1586-001143e3f55c?page=uuid:47dffa3f-518b-11e1-1586-001143e3f55c}}</ref><ref name="NM 2022" /> Fragment of the Staročesky hlaholský Pasionál a Zlatá legenda alongside 1 D c 1/20 and 1 D c 1/17 AB. This fragment 1/19 was found in the library of the Dominican Monastery of St. Jiljí in Prague, having been used as a cover for a book from 1618.<ref name="Pacnerova 2008" /> It was published first in 1882<ref name="Patera 1882">{{cite journal |first=Adolf |last=Patera |title=Nově nalezené zbytky stč. pasionalů ze XIV. stol. |language=cs |journal=Časopis Musea království Českého |volume=56 |issue=3 |pages=514–527 |issn=1210-9746 |url=https://www.digitalniknihovna.cz/nm/view/uuid:08efddd0-8196-11e0-a969-000d606f5dc6?page=uuid:cf0a5b40-80a0-11e0-a256-000d606f5dc6}}</ref> then in 1929<ref name="Jakubec 1929">{{cite book |first=Jan |last=Jakubec |title=Dějiny literatury české 1. |language=cs |location=Prague |publisher=Jan Laichter |date=1929 |url=https://kramerius5.nkp.cz/view/uuid:8c753cc0-e939-11e6-8010-005056827e51?page=uuid:63fa3680-0642-11e7-91c5-001018b5eb5c}}</ref> and has been published several times since.<ref name="Vilikovsky 1948">{{cite book |first=Jan |last=Vilikovský |chapter=Staročeský Pasionál a Život Krista Pána |language=cs |title=Písemnictví českého středověku |date=1948 |location=Prague}}</ref><ref name="Pacnerova 1990 1/19">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerová |title=Staročeský hlaholský zlomek Pasionálu sign. 1 Dc 1/19 z KNM v Praze |language=cs |journal=Listy filologické |volume=113}}</ref> But part was first published 1897.<ref name="Patera 1897">{{cite journal |first=Adolf |last=Patera |title=Zbytek staročeského "Vidění Mikulášova" |language=cs |journal=Časopis Musea království Českého |issn=1210-9746 |date=1897 |volume=71 |issue=5 |pages=537–540 |url=https://www.digitalniknihovna.cz/nm/view/uuid:d1bb87b0-73f7-11e1-b819-000d606f5dc6?page=uuid:86f27e30-7273-11e1-9971-000d606f5dc6}}</ref>

| Zbytek českého Vidění Mikulášova.<ref name="Pacnerova 1963" /><ref name="NM 2022" /> Part of the ''Staročesky hlaholský Pasionál a Zlatá legenda'' alongside 1 D c 1/19 and 1/17 AB.<ref name="Pacnerova 2008" /> It was first published 1958<ref name="Kyas 1958">{{cite book |first=Vladimír |last=Kyas |contribution=K staročeskému Pasionálu |title=Příspěvky k dějinám starší české literatury |language=cs |publisher=ČSAV |location=Prague |pages=141–155}}</ref> and 1959<ref name="Kyas 1959">{{cite book |first=Vladimír |last=Kyas |title=Dějiny české literatury I |language=cs |location=Prague |publisher=ČSAV |date=1959}}</ref> and has been published several times since.<ref name="Vidmanova 1984">{{cite book |first=Anežka |last=Vidmanová |title=Legenda Aurea |language=cs |location=Vyšehrad |date=1984}}</ref><ref name="Vidmanova 1985">{{cite journal |first=Anežka |last=Vidmanová |title=K původní podobě a textové tradici staročeského Pasionálu |language=cs |journal=Listy filologické |volume=108}}</ref><ref name="Pacnerova 1990 1/20">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerova |title=Staročeský hlaholský zlomek Zlaté legendy sign. 1 Dc 1/20 z Knihovny Národního muzea v Praze |language=cs |journal=Listy filologické |volume=113}}</ref>

| missal
|
| 1425<ref>According to Štefanić not 1485 as read by Milčetić and Jagić. Urban was dead by 1443, the Easter date given by Urban does not match 1485, the indiction does not match 1485. But 1425 does match (possibly 1426). Still in Barban in 1640. Acquired by Kukuljević as gift from pop Andrija Marotti on 27 May 1866.</ref> (or earlier)
| Fragm. glag. 5
| Arhiv HAZU
| Barban
| 1
| 35.7 x 24.5&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 30 ro
| Barban Missal Folio (List barbanskog misala). Includes note by parish priest Urban dated 28 January 1425 in hand that may be different from main hand only by passage of time. Jagić published photograph 1911.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Jagić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Photograph of one page published in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| matricula
|
| 1425
|

| Baška

| Matrikula bratovštine sv. Marije na Gorici (Baška). Parchment. | 1428 (January 4)
| Pavlinski samostan u Crikvenici, br. 2
| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| Novi Vinodolski
| 1
| 30 x 16+6.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Lord [[Nikola IV Frankopan|Mikula Frankapan]] Permits the Crikvenica Monastery to Build a Saw in the Crikvenica Valley (Knez Mikula Frankapan dozvoljuje crikveničkim fratrom, da načine pilu u crikveničkoj drazi).<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Written in same hand as other document from 4 January 1428. Once kept in Budapest as M.O.D.L. 37098. An Latinic transcription attached to a document from 1480 also exists.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" /><ref name="Kolanović 1983" />

| confirmation of rights
|
| 1433 (after)
| ''Neoregistrata acta'' (Fasc. 1650. br. 3)
| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| [[Ozalj]]
| 1
| 32 x 13&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Knez Bartol Frankapan potvrdjuje list svoga ozaljskoga grašćaka, kojim su podieljene njeke koristi njegovim kmetom ozaljskoga vladanja, a po imenu Ježkovljanom.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Was located in Budapest under D.M.D.L. 34340. Despite its written date 10 August 1433, Ivšić determined it to be a falsificate written in a younger script.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

|-bgcolor="LightGray"
| legal
|
| 1437 (May 3)
| sv. 1650, br. 4
| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| [[Ozalj]]
|
|
|
| Knez Bartol Frankapan naznačuje Ozaljskim purgarom žirovno izpasišće uz kmete svoje u Mirkovu polju. Survives only in Latinic transliteration.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Lopašić 1894">{{cite book |first=Lopašić |last=Radoslav |date=1894 |location=Zagreb |title=''Urbaria lingua croatica conscripta.'' Hrvatski urbari. |series=Monumenta historico-juridica slavorum meridionalium |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=pXIoRAAACAAJ}}</ref><ref name="Lopašić 1895">{{cite book |first1= Radoslav |last1=Lopašić |first2=Emilij |last2=Laszowski |title=Oko Kupe i Korane. Mjestopisne i povjestne crtice. |location=Zagreb |date=1895 |publisher=Naklada "Matice hrvatske" |others=Printer: Press of Karl Albrecht |url=https://archive.org/details/okokupeikoranem00lopagoog}}</ref><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Though Lopašić stated that the Glagolitic original was housed at the obćina in Trg (Ozalj), it has not been found there; in Trg there is only a 17th century Latinic transcription. The Croatian State Archives possesses a second 17th century Latinic transcription, acquired from the Budapest archive (M.O.D.L. 34.341), acquired from the Hrvatski zemaljski arhiv.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

|
| 1439-1688
| IV b 93
| Arhiv HAZU
| Trsat
| 89
| 27.2 x 20.4&nbsp;cm
|
| Knjiga bratovštine sv. Jurja na Trsatu. Glagolitic to 1599 then Latinic then Italian. Not chronological. There is a Glagolitic entry from 1439 followed chronologically by a 1530 Italian note on f. 7v (likely a later transcription however), but with regular Glagolitic use beginning in 1566.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| legal
|
| 1439 (July 28)
| Strohal br. 3
| Zagreb (Kr. zemaljski arhiv)
|
|
|
|
| Knez Štefan Frankopan uzvisuje svoga vjernoga slugu Frana Batišića na čast vlastelina. Last seen 1910 as of 1983. It was the only legal document on Strohal's list that remained missing.<ref>According to Kolanović this is the same as the incorrectly dated 28 August 1539 document from the ''Izložbena zbirka''.</ref><ref name="Kolanović 1983" />

| BrMet
| 1442
| MR₁₆₁
| Metropolitan Library of the [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Zagreb]]
| Croatia
| 469
| 19.5 x 13&nbsp;cm
| 2 co x 27 ro
| Brevijar Metropolitanski knjižnice (Breviary of the Metropolitan library).<ref name="Vajs 1910" /><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Nazor 1978">{{cite book |last=Nazor |first=Anica |date=1978 |title=Zagreb - Riznica glagoljice: katalog izložbe |trans-title=Zagreb - Treasury of Glagolitic: Exhibit Catalogue |language=hr |location=Zagreb |publisher=[[National and University Library in Zagreb|National and University Library]]}}</ref><ref name="OSU 1981" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://digitalna.nsk.hr/pb/?object=info&id=576392 NSK], [https://glagoljica.hr/?rukopisi=iiif.v.a&id=576392 GHR]
|-
| breviary
| BrMsc (BrMosk)<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1442-1443 (about)
| F.270. II No.51A+B
| [[Russian State Library]]
| Lika
| 245+250
|
|
| Moskovski brevijar (Moscow breviary). Kept in Vrbnik in 1481 and 1533, sent to Rome about 1627, where it was used by M. Karaman and M. Sović and where it remained until the end of the 18th century. [[Vatroslav Jagić]] found it in or brought it to Moscow in 1864. Cronia disputes that the Moscow breviary is the same as the one used in Rome.<ref name="Berčić 1881">{{cite journal |last=Berčić |first=Ivan |date=1881 |title=Njekoliko staroslavenskih i hrvatskih knjiga što pisanih što tiskanih glagoljicom kojim se u skorašnje doba u trag ušlo |trans-title=Certain Old Slavonic and Croatian Books Handwritten and Printed in Glagolitic Recently Discovered |language=hr |journal=Rad Jugoslavenske Akademije Znanosti i Umjetnosti |volume=59 |pages=158–185 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=169324}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1916">{{cite journal |first=Ivan |last=Milčetić |title=Matije Sovića predgovor "Slavenskoj gramatici" |journal=Starine |volume=XXXV |location=Zagreb |date=1916}}</ref><ref name="Vajs 1929">{{cite journal |first=Josef |last=Vajs |title=Sborník staroslov. literárníh památek o sv. Václavu a sv. Ludmile |location=Prague |date=1929}}</ref><ref name="Jurić pokušaj">{{cite journal |first=J. |last=Jurić |title=Pokušaj zbora za širenje vjere god. 1627 |language=hr |journal=Croatia Sacra |volume=IV}}</ref><ref name="Cronia 1954">{{cite journal |first=Arturo |last=Cronia |title=Glagolitica Vaticana |journal=Slavistična revija |number=V-VII |location=Ljubljana |date=1954}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="OSU 1981" /><ref name="Zaradija Kiš 1997">{{cite book |last=Zaradija Kiš |first=Vesna |date=1997 |title=Knjiga o Jobu u hrvatskoglagoljskoj književnosti |trans-title=The Book of Job in Croato-Glagolitic Literature |language=hr |location=Zagreb |publisher=Hrvatsko filološko društvo}}</ref><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://lib-fond.ru/lib-rgb/270/f-270-ii-51a/ STSL A], [https://lib-fond.ru/lib-rgb/270/f-270-ii-51b/ STSL B]
|-bgcolor="MistyRose"
| abecedary
|
| 1442
| Prague Metropolitan Chapter Collection, M 125
| Prague (Archiv Pražského hradu)
| Prague
| 192
| 22 x 14.8 cm
|
| Latin with Glagolitic abecedary.<ref name="Patera and Podlaha 1922">{{cite book |first1=Adolf |first2=Antonín |last1=Patera |last2=Podlaha |title=Soupis rukopisů Knihovny Metropolini kapitoly pražské |language=cs |trans-title=List of Manuscripts of the Metropolitan Capitol Library of Prague |volume=2 |date=1922 |url=https://kramerius.lib.cas.cz/view/uuid:4c4b7380-2852-11e4-8e0d-005056827e51?page=uuid:fbd7b3da-aa59-11ea-8604-005056a2b051}}</ref><ref name="Pacnerova 1989">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerová |title=Hlaholice v české písařské praxi |language=cs |trans-title=Glagolitic in Czech Scribal Practice |journal=Listy filologické |date=1989}}</ref><ref name="Pacnerova 1996">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerova |title=Česká varianta charvátské hranaté hlaholice |language=cs |trans-title=The Czech Variety of Croatian Angular Glagolitic |date=1996 |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |location=Zagreb |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/file/22740}}</ref><ref name="Pacnerova 2008">{{cite journal |first=Ludmila |last=Pacnerova |title=Staročeské literární památky a charvátská hranatá hlaholice |language=cs |trans-title=Old Czech Literary Monuments and Croatian Angular Glagolitic |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |date=2008 |location=Zagreb |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/file/35204}}</ref> One of three such abecedaries in Prague.<ref name="Marti 1991" />

|-bgcolor="MistyRose"
| miscellany
| CRad
| 1444-1461
| Borgiano illirico 12
| [[Vatican Library]]
| Bosnia
| 60
|
|
| Zbornik Krstjanina Radosava (Miscellany of Krstjanin Radoslav). Cyrillic but with Glagolitic abecedary below Očenaš (f. 56-57) and copyist's note on 59r, repeated by a different writer.<ref name="Štefanić 1959" /><ref name="Miltenov 2009" /><ref name="ANU BiH" />

| legal
|
| 1444 (August 11)
| monastery of sv. Jelena kod Senja collection br. 4
| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| Otočac
| 1
| 31 x 12&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Knez Žigmunt Frankapan daruje samostanu sv. Jelene kod Senja zapušteno mlinište na Švici.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Once housed in Budapest under sg. M.O.D.L. 35580.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" /><ref name="Kolanović 1983" />

| SpVat
| 1445
| Borgiano illirico 9
| [[Vatican Library]]
| Vrbnik
| 95
| 14 x 10.5&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Zrcalo vrbničko (Vrbnik mirror, Specchio). Scribe: žakan Luka. Received by the Vatican in 1772. Transferred by [[Pope Leo XIII]] to the Vatican Library in 1900.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Horvat 1911" /><ref name="Ivšić 1922-1923">{{cite journal |first=Stjepan |last=Ivšić |title=Dosad nepoznati hrvatski glagoljski prijevod iz staročeškog jezika |journal=Slavia |volume=I |location=Prague |issn=0037-6736 |date=1923 |pages=38-56, 285-301 |url=https://kramerius.lib.cas.cz/view/uuid:33a45fe3-518b-11e1-1090-001143e3f55c?page=uuid:33a4600f-518b-11e1-1090-001143e3f55c}}</ref><ref name="OSU 1981" />

|-
| judgement
|
| 1449 (December 1)
|
| Arhiv HAZU
| Belgrad (Vinodol)
|
|
|
| Upravitelji knezova Frankapana zajedno sa sucima, plovanima i satnicima donose presudu u korist Grižanaca i Belgradaca vezano uz njihov spor s Driveničanima.<ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Original in Grižane lost but copy, first mentioned in a Grižane list dated 1620, was contemporary with original. The Arhiv HAZU also has a younger Glagolitic copy from 1583 by priest Luka Mavrić. Two later Latinic copies also exist.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| XVI G 27 (3749)
| Prague (National Museum)
| Prague
| 260
| 9 x 6.5 cm
|
| Latin with Glagolitic note on f. 210'. From the library of Ant. Burd. Parchment.<ref name="Bartoš 1927">{{cite book |first=František Michálek |title=Soupis rukopisů Národního musea v Praze I a II |date=1926–1927 |language=cs |trans-title=Catalogue of Manuscripts of the National Museum in Prague I and II |last=Bartoš |publisher=Melantrich}}</ref><ref name="Brodsky 2000">{{cite book |first=Pavel |last=Brodský |title=Katalog iluminovanych rukopisu Knihovny Národního Muzea v Praze |language=cs |trans-title=Catalogue of Illuminated Manuscripts of the Library of the National Museum in Prague |date=2000}}</ref><ref name="NM 2022" />

|
|-
| miscellany
|
| 1400s (beginning or first half)
| III a 15 (Kuk. 351)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 65
| 17.5 x 13.3&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Vinodolski zbornik.<ref name="Jagić 1866" /><ref name="Jagić 1868">{{cite book |first=Vatroslav |last=Jagić |contribution=Prilozi k historiji književnosti naroda hrvatskoga i srbskoga |language=hr |pages=65–151 |date=1868 |title=Arkiv za povjestnicu Jugoslavensku |volume=IX |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=q0ZKAQAAMAAJ}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1916 Cvet">{{cite book |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Cvět vsake mudrosti, najstarije hrvatsko umjetno sačuvano književno djelo iz 14. vijeka |language=hr |location=Zagreb |date=1916}}</ref><ref name="Gršković 1916">{{cite journal |first=Jerko |last=Gršković |title=Difficile est satyram non scribere |journal=Novine |volume=III |location=Zagreb |date=1916 |number=177 |pages=3–4}}</ref><ref name="Kolendić 1923">{{cite journal |first=Petar |last=Kolendić |title=Fiore di virtù u našem prevodu XIV veka |language=sr |journal=Prilozi za književnost, istoriju, jezik i folklor |volume=III |location=Beograd |date=1923}}</ref><ref name="Rešetar 1933">{{cite book |first=Milan |last=Rešetar |title=Дубровачки зборник од год. 1520 |year=1933 |language=sr |publisher=Српска краљевска академија |location=Beograd |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=rlQYAQAAMAAJ}}</ref> Scribes: hand A f. 1-16 and maybe 39-47, hand B f. 17-25v, alternating A and B f. 27-30, hand C f. 48-49, 61-62, hand D f. 50-60, possible hand alternating with D f. 31-36, hand E f. 62v-64 and maybe elsewhere. All hands worked in the same period and place. Written on Čakavian-Kajkavian border. Includes many historically significant notes. In the 15th century through the beginning of the 17th century it was in Vinodol, then in Dobrinj and Vrbnik. Acquired by Kukuljević in Vrbnik. Kukuljević loaned it to Šafarik for a time. Acquired by JAZU with Šafarik library.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1913 proza">{{cite book |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Najstarija hrvatska umjetna proza i prof. I. Milčetić |language=hr |location=Zagreb Ždate=17 April 1913}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Strohal 1917" /><ref name="Handrovics 1955">{{cite journal |first=L. |last=Handrovics |title=Der südslavische Trojaroman und seine ungarische Vorlage |language=de |journal=Studia Slavica |volume=I |location=Budapest |date=1995 |pages=49–135}}</ref><ref name="Hamm Slovo 9-10">{{cite journal |first=Josip |last=Hamm |title=Apokalipsa bosanskih krstjana |language=hr |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |number=9–10 |date=1960 |pages=43–104 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/clanak/21111}}</ref><ref name="Marinković 1962">{{cite journal |first=Radovan |last=Marinković |title=Јужнословенски роман о Троји |language=sr |journal=Анали Филолошког факултета |volume=I |location=Beograd |date=1962}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Two photographs in Štefanić 1970.

| missal
| Fg(M)Var<sub>1</sub>
| 1400s (by first half)
|
| Varaždin (Capuchin Monastery)
|
| 2
| 28 x 18.7 cm
| 2 co 33 ro
| First Varaždin Fragment (Prvi varaždinski fragment). The monastery it was found in was founded 25 April 1701. At one point owned by Petro Czuetkj, who gave it to a certain Casimir. Separated in 1986 by Anica Nazor from cover of IX c. 5 (a book printed 1712), which had been known to brother Bono Zvonimir Šagi who had shown it to Anica Vlašić-Anić in 1984.<ref name="Vlašić-Anić 2004">{{cite book |first=Anica |last=Vlašić-Anić |contribution=Glagoljica u knjižnicama kapucinskih samostana |language=hr |title=Glagoljica i hrvatski glagolizam: zbornik radova s međunarodnoga znanstvenog skupa povodom 100. obljetnice Staroslavenske akademije i 50. obljetnice Staroslavenskog instituta |location=Zagreb |date=2004 |pages=341–354 |url=https://glagoljica.hr/?pr=i&id=577923}}</ref><ref name="Vlašić-Anić 2014" />

|-
| missal
|
| 1400s (first half)
| IV
| Krk (arhiv samostana trećoredaca)
| Krk
| 1
| 18 x 14&nbsp;cm
|
| List misala. Parchment.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />
|
|-
| missal
| MBrb (MBrib
| 1400s (first half)<ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
| III b 3
| [[Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts|Arhiv HAZU]]
| Western Croatia?<ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
| 103
| 18 x 25&nbsp;cm
|
| Bribirski misal (Bribir missal). Includes younger note ''Kušah pero kako piše''. Written by several hands from the same school: hand A (f. 1-16), hand B (f. 17-33), hand C (f. 34-36), hand D (f. 37-57), hand F (f. 78-103) with uncertainties for hand on f. 92-96, 97-103. The name of scribe D was Juraj (f. 51d). From the 16th century on, it was used in [[Bribir, Primorje-Gorski Kotar County|Bribir]], where it stayed until [[Ivan Kukuljević Sakcinski]] moved it to [[Zagreb]], purchased by JAZU in 1868. The earliest dated note in Bribir is from 3 January 1566 (f. 55). Nikola Tolentinski was pronounced a saint in 1447 but the name was entered by a hand in perhaps the first half of the 16th century. Language includes many ekavisms. 3 saints are characteristic of Istria but without sufficient attention to counteract the weight of the argument for a more western origin on the grounds of 5 Hungarian/Czech saints (though Emerik is surprisingly missing). There are 4 Dalmatian saints but Dunat and Ivan Trogirski and Zoil zadarski are missing. Parchment.<ref name="Šafarik 1853" /><ref name="Jagić 1866" /><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Vajs 1932" /><ref name="Vajs 1948" /><ref name="Štefanić 1952" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| missal
|
| 1400s (first half)
| III b 2 (Kuk. 328)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 8
| 25 x 17&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 31 ro
| Kvaterna misala. Includes ''Proprium de tempore''. Very similar to III b 3 but not from that codex. The 8 November 1321 grant was once together with it, removed by Kukuljević.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
| breviary
|
| 1400s (first half)
|
| Krk (arhiv bivšeg Staroslavenskog instituta)
|
| 2
| 21.8 x 8&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 33 ro
| Dvolist brevijara. Includes ''Proprium de tempore'' with Ecclesiastes 3:2-7:18. Originally at Drivenik, acquired by an archive in Fužina, brought from mainland to Krk. On f. 1 there is a marginal note in Latinic about Zvane Felice Gerlici (who became captain of Bakar in 1741).<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

| 1
| 25.7 x 18&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| List brevijara. Includes note by the Juraj Feretić who was accepted into the Vrbnik clergy 1719, whose father was from Dobrinj, still mentioned in 1765. Once cover of Krćanski nauk (sign. VII 163) written by žakan Mikula Lukarić of Dobrinj in 1723 acquired by JAZU in 1959 from the remains of Jerko Gršković in Vrbnik. Hand identical to that of Fragm. glag. 129. | legal
|
| 1450 (February 16)
| Kukuljević collection
| Arhiv HAZU
| Baška
| 1
|
| 1 co
| Mirša Majšićević sells part of vineyard to the monastery of sv. Spas. Acquired by Kukuljević.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Alongside the original there is a 16th century copy.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" /> Includes the first known full title of a kancelar and notar carskom oblašću for scribe priest Matko son of Vid.<ref name="Kolanović 1983" />

|-
| legal
|
| 1450 (October 26)
| Pavlinski samostan u Crikvenici, br. 8
| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| Novi Vinodolski
| 1
| 22 x 12&nbsp;cm, 23.5 x 21.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Knez Martin Frankapan zapovieda, da Markovići služe kao i ostali kmeti samostana sv. Marije u Crikvenici.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Parchment and paper glued together already in 15th century. Possible falsificate from the 15th century. Once housed in Budapest under sg. M.O.D.L. 37106.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" /> Paper.<ref name="Kolanović 1983" />

| missal
| MVb₁<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1456
| n/a
| [[Vrbnik]] parish library
| Senj
| 256
| 28.7 x 22&nbsp;cm
| 2 co x 29 ro
| Prvi vrbnički misal (First Vrbnik missal). Written by the priest and vicar Thomas, [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Gospić-Senj|Archdeacon of Senj]].<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Jagić 1911" /><ref name="Vajs 1908" /><ref name="Vajs 1932" /><ref name="Kukalj 1936">{{cite journal |first=D. |last=Kukalj |title=Glagolski misal Tome, arhiđakona senjskoga |language=hr |journal=Croatia Sacra |volume=VI |location=Zagreb |date=1936 |pages=112–173}}</ref><ref name="Vajs 1948" /><ref name="Bakmaz 2010">{{cite journal |first=Ivan |last=Bakmaz |title=Biblijska čitanja u hrvatskoglagoljskim misalima |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |number=60 |date=2010 |pages=73–100 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/en/clanak/98528}}</ref><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Parchment.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

| 1457 (July 10)
|
|
| Modruš
|
|
|
| Knez Štefan Frankapan daruje Martinu Oštreheriću više pravah i posjedovanjah. Published by Georgije I. Petrović in Cyrillic transcription in volume 4 of ''Novi Serbski Lětopis za god. 1841'' in addition to a small photograph. Abridged transcription acquired by Kukuljević collection as br. 65.<ref name="Petrović 1841">{{cite journal |first=Georgije I. |last=Petrović |title=Съ глаголитическогъ оригинала кирилский писмены преписана диплома, коіомъ є Князъ Стефанъ Франгепанъ год. 1457. Мартину Оштраховићу пустару са црквомъ Модрушскомъ даровао |journal=Новый сербский лѣтопис |date=1841 |volume=XV |issue=55 |pages=114–117, 143–144 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=iWxlAAAAcAAJ}}</ref><ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Original lost as of Ivšić.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| legal
|
| 1457 (November 26)
| No 6644
| Graz (Štajerski zemaljski arhiv)
| Modruš<ref>According to Ivšić the "na Grobniku" of Šurmin is incorrect (Bratulić 2017).</ref>
| 1
| 26.3 x 13.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Knez Štefan III Frankapan oslobađa grobničkoga potknežina Žigmunda i njegove nasljednike, zbog njegove vjerne i dugogodišnje službe, od svih dužnosti i podavanja od kuće i vrta koje posjeduje u Grobniku.<ref name="Preis 1843">{{cite journal |first=Petar |last=Ivanović Preis |title=Starinski otvoreni list od god. 1457 |journal=Kolo |issue=II |date=1843 |pages=87–88 |url=http://dnc.nsk.hr/journals/LibraryTitle.aspx?id=df884079-cc5d-4055-98a3-153e7f880518#}}</ref><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| legal
|
| 1458 (September 5)
| Pavlinski samostan u Crikvenici, br. 10
| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
|
| 1
| 34 x 17.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Martin Frankapan oslobadja mlin Jurše Ričanina pod Trsatom od svakoga tereta. A transcription on paper also exists, possibly also from the 15th century.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Both original and contemporary (15th century) copy survive. Housed at the Crikvenica monastery after the Franciscans purchased Jurša's mill. Once housed in Budapest under sg. M.O.D.L. 37108.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" /> Parchment.<ref name="Kolanović 1983" />
|
|-
| breviary
| BrN₁<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1459
| n/a, ?, Glagolitica I-1
| [[Novi Vinodolski]] parish library, Arhiv HAZU, [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| Novi Vinodolski
| 462+5+6
| 36 x 28&nbsp;cm
|
| Prvi novljanski brevijar (First Novi breviary). The first half, to folio 374, was written by a scribe named Juraj (who wrote the postscript dating the codex to 1459), and the rest was written by a different hand. It was written for the church of [[Saints Cosmas and Damian]] in Novi Vinodolski, in Novi Vinodolski, on the order of Jakov Potočnjak and others.<ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Vajs 1910" /><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Nazor 1995">{{cite book |last=Nazor |first=Anica |date=1995 |title=Glagoljski rukopisi s Vinodolskog područja |trans-title=Glagolitic Manuscripts of the Vinodol Area |language=hr}}</ref><ref name="Badurina Stipčević 2004b">{{cite journal |last=Badurina Stipčević |first=Vesna |date=2004 |title=Legenda de Patras (Legenda o sv. Antunu Opatu) u hrvatskoglagoljskim brevijarima |trans-title=Legenda de Patras (The Legend of St. Anthony the Abbot) in Croato-Glagolitic Breviaries |language=hr |journal=Ricerche Slavistiche |volume=2/48 |pages=5–28}}</ref><ref name="Badurina Stipčević 2008" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> 6 folia in HDA belong to its calendar. Arhiv HAZU has 5 folia. In 1835 the HDA fragment belonged to Antun Mažuranić, later given by Portuguese-Brazilian ambassador in Zagreb Aleksandar Eherman to HDA in 1945. Arhiv HAZU fragments also once part of Antun and Ivan Mažuranić library.<ref name="Kolanović 1983">{{cite journal |first=Josip |last=Kolanović |title=Glagoljski rukopisi i isprave u Arhivu hrvatske |location=Zagreb |date=1983 |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |issue=32–33 |pages=131–187 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/14512}}</ref>
|

|
| 1459
| Fragm. glag. 97
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 5
| 36 x 28&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 37 ro
| Pet listova I Novljanskog brevijara. Includes notes. Once stood at the end of BrN<sub>1</sub>. Acquired by Ivan Mažuranić (1814-1890), given to JAZU around 1911 by his son Vladimir.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| 2 co 40 ro

| 1 co

|-
| breviary
| {{interlanguage link|Mavro's Breviary|lt=BrMav|hr|Mavrov brevijar}}<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1460
| R 7822 (RI-16º-1a)
| [[National and University Library in Zagreb|NSK]]
| Vrbnik
| 417
| 16 x 11.7&nbsp;cm
| 2 co x 30 ro
| Breviary of priest Mavro (Mavrov brevijar, Brevijar popa Mavra). Written by deacon [[Blaž Baromić]] for Mavro, the priest of [[Vrbnik]], and finished by a priest named Jure from [[Baška]]. Mavro took the breviary with him to [[Konavle]]. The codex was in the hands of the Pezzoli family in Rome until 1981, when it was purchased by its current owners.<ref>{{cite journal |last=Pantelić |first=Marija |date=1965 |title=Glagoljski brevijar popa Mavra iz godine 1460 |trans-title=The Glagolitic Breviary of Priest Mauro from 1460 |language=hr |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |volume=15-16 |pages=94–149}}</ref><ref name="Kosić 2004">{{cite book |last=Kosić |first=Ivan |date=2004 |title=Glagoljični rukopisi u Nacionalnoj i sveučilišnoj knjižnici |trans-title=Glagolitic Manuscripts in the National and University Library |language=hr |location=Zagreb, Krk |publisher=Staroslavenski institut i Krčka biskupija}}</ref><ref name="Šimić 2004">{{cite journal |last=Šimić |first=Marinka |date=2004 |title=Leksički postupak Blaža Baromića, pisca i tiskara glagoljskih knjiga |trans-title=The Lexical Approach of Blaž Baromić, Writer and Printer of Glagolitic Books |language=hr |journal=Filologija |volume=42 |pages=65–86}}</ref><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Formerly housed in Rome by the family U. Pezzoli.<ref name="OSU 1981" />

| psalter with commentary
| {{interlanguage link|Fraščić psalter|lt=PsFr|hr|Fraščićev psaltir}}
| 1463
| Codex slave 77
| [[Austrian National Library]]
| Lindari, Istria
| 132
| 20 x 13.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Fraščićev psaltir (Fraščić psalter, ''Psalterium Vindobonense''). Written by a priest named Fraščić. The commentary is of Byzantine type.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Jagić 1911" /><ref name="Jagić 1913">{{cite book |first=Vatroslav |last=Jagić |contribution=Hrvatska glag. književnost |title=Povijest hrvatske književnosti |location=Zagreb |publisher=Matica hrvatska |date=1913 |language=hr |url=https://glagoljica.hr/?knjige=i&id=578028}}</ref><ref name="Vajs 1923">{{cite journal |first=Josef |last=Vajs |title=Žaltař Frašćićův I |journal=Slavia |language=cs |date=1922–1923 |pages=269–284 |issn=0037-6736 |url=https://kramerius.lib.cas.cz/view/uuid:33a45fe3-518b-11e1-1090-001143e3f55c?page=uuid:33a460f6-518b-11e1-1090-001143e3f55c}}</ref><ref name="Vajs 1924">{{cite journal |first=Josef |last=Vajs |title=Žaltař Frašćićův II |journal=Slavia |language=cs |date=1923–1924 |pages=304–309 |issn=0037-6736 |url=https://kramerius.lib.cas.cz/view/uuid:34789fd3-518b-11e1-1589-001143e3f55c?page=uuid:3478a10b-518b-11e1-1589-001143e3f55c}}</ref><ref name="Vajs 1932" /><ref name="Hamm 1952" /><ref name="Hamm 1967">{{cite book |first=Josip |last=Hamm |title=Psalterium Vindobonense: Der kommentierte glagolitische Psalter der Österreischischen Nationalbibliothek |series=Schriften der Balkankommission |location=Vienna |date=1967}}</ref><ref name="OSU 1981" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />

|
| 1463 (August 4)
|
|
| Modruš
|
|
|
| Apaj Liković načinja se s modruškim kaptolom za njeke dužnosti, što ih je imao prama crkvi stoga kaptola i prama crkvi sv. Mikule na Gvozdu. Survives only in Latinic transcription, acquired by Kukuljević.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" />

|-
| legal
|
| 1464 (March 21)
| Novljanski samostan collection, sv. 1. br. 5
| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| Novi Vinodolski.

Vaticano Slavo 19 |trans-title=The Glagolitic Breviary from 1465 Vaticano Slavo 19 |language=hr |journal=Radovi Staroslavenskog Instituta |volume=2 |pages=155–191}}</ref><ref name="Džurova et al. 1985" /><ref name="Putanec 1988">{{cite journal |first=Valentin |last=Putanec |title=Prilog proučavanja hrvatske inkunabule fragmenta kalendara iz 1491. | Senj

| 21.5 x 17&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Knezovi Frankapani, Štefan, Dujam, Martin, Juraj, Bartol, Anž i Mikula, potvrdjuju remetam sv. Jelene i sv. Spasa mline i zemljišta. A Latin transcription was also made, on 5 March 1660.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Klaić 1901">{{cite book |first=Vjekoslav |last=Klaić |date=1901 |title=Krčki knezovi Frankapani |location=Zagreb |publisher=Matica hrvatska |others=Printer: Tisak K. Albrechta (Jos. Wittasek) |url=https://archive.org/details/krckiknezovifran00klaiuoft}}</ref><ref name="Klen 1981">{{cite journal |first=Danilo |last=Klen |date=1981 |title=Glagoljske isprave crikveničkog samostana pavlina |journal=Vjesnik Historijskih Arhiva U Rijeci I Pazinu |language=hr |volume=XXIV |location=Rijeka |pages=269–286}}</ref> Once housed in Budapest under sg. | 1469 (September 9)

| Lika
| 1
| 31.7 x 13&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Knez Juraj Tomašić i suci kraljevskog stola u Lici potvrđuju vjerodostojnost oporuke plemića Matijca Utištenića.<ref name="Vončina 1955" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
|
|-
| breviary
| BrBrb (BrBrib)<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1470 (September–October)
| III b 6 (Kuk 2)
| [[Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts|Arhiv HAZU]]
| Vinodol, Croatia
| 199
| 26 x 19&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 33 ro
| Bribirski brevijar (Bribir breviary). Written by a single hand including dates 7 September and 10 October 1470 in the temporal. Name of scribe unknown but near Hoteš (near Bužan in the Buška župa), perhaps written for the crkva sv. Marije there. There is a note about the marriage of Ferenc Berislavić and Barbara daughter of Sigismund Frankopan that must have been written 1493 but it is unknown whether in Buže or in Gacka (where Barbara had property) or Modruše. The codex ended up in Modruš as attested by a note ''To je brv(ija)l modriški'' where there was also a crkva sv. Marije. From 1548 there is a note about the death of Margareta of Poduljin, a village near Bribir. All later notes reference surnames of Bribir. Includes a child's drawings (i.e f. 4v, 40v, 157v) and writing practice, including by Mikula Draganić, Mikula Šušić, Mikula Ugrin, Mikula Ivanov. Obtained by [[Ivan Kukuljević Sakcinski]] in [[Bribir, Primorje-Gorski Kotar County|Bribir]]. Kukuljević sent it to Prague to Šafarik on 19 February 1857 as a loan.<ref name="Vajs 1910" /><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Nazor 1995" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|

| GscMld
| 1471

| [[National Library of Russia]]
| [[Moldova]]
| 299 + 8
| 29.5 x 20.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co

|-bgcolor="LightGray"
| legal
|
| 1471 (April 2)
|
| [[Dobrinj]]
| Omišalj
|
|
|
| Knez Ivan Frankapan daruje Ivanu Sršiću zemlje na Sužanu. Original located in Dobrinj, Italian translation in Sužan.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Original lost. Survived in Latin translation of Žan Juraj Sabljić corrected by Žan Frančeska Bonmartini, translated back into Glagolitic by Petar Petriš in 1723-1724 (page 262-264 of his book in Dobrinj). Also survives in Italian translation in Sužan.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

|-
| Gospel of Thomas
|
| 1400s (middle)
| Fragm. glag. 99
| Arhiv HAZU
| Kajkavian territory?
| 1
| 18 x 12&nbsp;cm
|
| Fragment of Gospel of Thomas (Odlomak Tomina evanđelja (apokrif)). Paper. Possibly written in Kajkavian territory as evidenced by ekavisms and the word ''črka''. It was attached to the 1508 ''Korizmenjak'' with signature I b 44 but separated 12 December 1932 by Stjepan Ivšić.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| missal
|
| 1400s (middle)
| Fragm. glag. 133
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 2
| 22.5 x 15.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Dvolist misala. Acquired by Milčetić on Krk. It was in use as a cover of a school practice book for Italian and Latin from 1807 (Arhiv HAZU VII 119).<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
| missal
|
| 1400s (middle)
| Fragm. glag. 21 d/I
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 1
| 6.5 x 12.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Ostrižak iz misala. Contains ''Proprium de sanctorum''. Parchment.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| 1400s (middle)

| 2 co 34 ro
| Krnji dvolist misala. There is a note from a likely 18th century hand referring to a certain Šime Šokota. The surname Šokota may point to an island of the Zadar archipelago.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| will

| 1474 (October), 1485 (January 7)
|
| Mošćenice (župna kasa)
| Mošćenice, Kožljak
| 1
| 39.5 x 12&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Wills of Martin Malković and Martin Mojsijević (''Brevijar'' Martina Malkovića). Includes a 1485 confirmation by Martin Mojsijević of Kožljak with transcription of will of Martin Mojsijević by notary Grgur Gomilac.<ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Milčetić 1905" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

|-
| breviary
| BrVin (BrKuk)<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1485
| I d 34 (Kuk 1)
| [[Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts|Arhiv HAZU]]
| Zadar?
| 165
| 39.5 x 28.7&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 33 ro
| Vinodolski (Kukuljevićev) brevijar. Vinodol (Kukuljević) breviary. First hand wrote f. 1-79, f. 146-165. Second hand similar to first hand, responsible for middle of codex. Probably Franciscan in origin. Ikavisms point to the Krbava-Zadar area and the office of sv. Krsogon/Krševan points to Zadar. Obtained by [[Ivan Kukuljević Sakcinski]] in [[Vinodol, Croatia]].<ref name="Jagić 1866" /><ref name="Vajs 1910" /><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Nazor 1995" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Photograph of two pages published in Štefanić 1970.
|

|
| 1485? (or beginning of 1400s)
| Fragm. glag. 53/a-d
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 3
|
|
| Tri lista brevijara. Obtained by Kukuljević from cover of a book he acquired in Bribir. Scribe may have been same as BrVin (I d 34). May have belonged to same codex.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| 1 (2)

| 1 co
| Knez Anž VIII Frankapan odgovara na pismo kneza Benedikta Ratkaja te ga moli za odgodu nekog duga koji mu zbog trenutne nevolje ne može vratiti i nudi mu jednu utvrdu u zamjenu do povratka duga.<ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> In the hand of Ivan Frankapan himself. |-
| breviary
| {{interlanguage link|Dabar breviary|lt=BrDab|hr|Dabarski brevijar}}<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1486
| III c 21
| [[Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts|Arhiv HAZU]]
| Croatia
| 306
| 33 x 23.5&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 36-37 ro
| Dabarski brevijar (Dabar breviary).<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /> Marginal corrections numerous throughout codex from hand similar to that of main text. Codex written by several alternating hands. Conservative hand more discrete for especially ''z, g, h, a ž''. Ikavo-ekavian reflexes prevalent especially in second part. Text is oriented towards Franciscans and the Kingdom of Hungary as opposed to Pavlikani and Venetian territory. Later notes only on f. 159v, beginning 1515 in Dabar. Acquired by Kukuljević in Istria from Urban Golmajer of Grimalda. There is a Latin note ''Codex Nr. DCCCXXIV''. Original name during preparation for Šurmin 1898 was ''Humski brevijar'' so it is possible Golmajer found it in Hum<ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Badurina Stpčević et al. 2012">{{cite book |last1=Badurina Stipčević |first1=Vesna |last2=Mihaljević |first2=Milan |last3=Šimić |first3=Marinka |date=2012 |title=Gacka u srednjem vijeku |trans-title=Gacka in the Middle Ages |chapter=Mjesto ''Dabarskoga brevijara'' među hrvatskoglagoljskim kodeksima |trans-chapter=The Place of the ''Dabar Breviary'' among Croato-Glagolitic Codices |editor1-last=Gračanin |editor1-first=Hrvoje |editor2-last=Holjevac |editor2-first=Željko |language=hr |location=Zagreb, Otočac |publisher=Institut društvenih znanosti Ivo Pilar, Područni centar Gospić |pages=255–282}}</ref><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| miscellany
| COxf₁
| 1486
| Ms. Canon. Lit. 412
| [[Bodleian Library]]
| Croatia
|
|
|
| Prvi oxfordski zbornik (First Oxford miscellany). Or the Confessional of St. Anthony. Acquired by the Bodleian with the Canonici collection purchase in 1817. Canonici acquired them in Italy.<ref name="Syrku 1907" /><ref name="Jagić 1911" /><ref name="Vajs 1915b"/><ref name="Tadin 1953" /><ref name="Tadin 1954" /><ref name="OSU 1981" /><ref name="Bakmaz 2010" /> At least 3 scribes unless Michal changed his style often, so the date 1486 of the colophon on f. 158 should be taken as the starting point.<ref name="du Feu 1971" />

Hrvatski glagolski rukopis od godine 1486 |language=hr |journal=Djela JAZU |volume=XII |location=Zagreb |date=1892}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1910-1911 Bernardin">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Knjige sv. Bernardina u hrv. glagolskoj literaturi |language=hr |journal=Kršćanska škola |date=1910–1911 |page=344}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Klaić 1935">{{cite journal |first=Vjekoslav |last=Klaić |title=Županija Pset (Pesenta) i pleme Kolunić |language=hr |journal=Vjesnik Hrvatskog arheološkog društva NS |volume=XV |location=Zagreb |page=11}}</ref><ref name="Kolendić 1935">{{cite journal |first=Petar |last=Kolendić |title="Somme le Roi" kod naših glagoljaša |language=hr |journal=Južni pregled |volume=XI |location=1935 |pages=396–400}}</ref> Discovered by Kukuljević on Krk.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> In 1892 a Latinic transcription ([https://glagoljica.hr/?knjige=iiif.v.a&id=577522 GHR]) was published. One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| Vrbnik
|
| 27 x 21&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Will of priest Tomaš Sedmak (Oporuka popa Tomaša Sedmaka). Acquired by Kukuljević. Dated April 1487<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Original lost, but this is a contemporary transcript, missing end. | Skurina
| 1
| 39 x 20.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Juraj Račić prodaje pred ličkim stolom svoju plemenštinu u Dolnjem Zažićnu Mateju Draškoviću. | 1
| 21.5 x 15&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Štefan knez Blagajski moli kneza Petra Zrinjskoga, da pusti Šimuna Mehanovića i da učini, da se tomu Šimunu svi dugovi izplate.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> The letter is addressed to Petar II Zrinski who died 9 September 1493 at the [[Battle of Krbava Field|Battle of Krbava]], so it must date to before then. | quadresimal
| [[Interpretation of the Passion of our Lord Jesus Christ|ComGre]], QdGre, [[Quaresimal|QrGre]]
| 1493, 1493, 1498
| R 4002
| [[National and University Library in Zagreb|NSK]]
| Croatia
| 158
| 20.2 x 14.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Greblov kvaresimal i tumačenje muke. The Tlmačenie od muki was finished in 1493, the Kvadriga duhovnim zakonom was finished in 1493, the Kvaresimal was finished in 1498. Once part of Petris collection.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Štefanić 1960" /> Bought by NSK between 1960 and 1970 from the Petris Monastery of Krk.<ref name="Jurić 1980" /><ref name="OSU 1981" />

|
|-
| miscellany
| CAc
| 1400s (end, by 1496)
| IV a 48
| Arhiv HAZU
| Croatia
| 94
| 20.2 x 14&nbsp;cm
|
| Zbornik duhovnoga štiva. On f. 94v there is a note saying Jurko wrote "it", dated it 1496, and a similar note for priest Mihovil. The hand that wrote that about Jurko was not the scribe of the main text. It was written in an area where ekavian reflex of the jat was more frequent than ikavian. At least by the beginning of the 18th century it was in Omišalj. Acquired by Kukuljević somewhere. Acquired by JAZU 1890-1891 from his remains.<ref name="JAZU Ljetopis 6">{{cite journal |journal=Ljetopis Jugoslavenske akademije |publisher=Jugoslavenska akademija znanosti i umjetnosti |language=hr |volume=VI |date=1891 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=173086}}</ref><ref name="Tkalčić vještice">{{cite journal |first=Ivan Krstitelj |last=Tkalčić |title=Izprave o progonu vješticah u Hrvatskoj |language=hr |journal=Starine JAZU |volume=XXV}}</ref><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Strohal 1926 Cvet">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title="Cvět vsake mudrosti", II. dio |language=hr |journal=Nastavni Vjesnik |volume=XXXV |date=1926 |pages=92–102}}</ref> Scribes: hand A f. 1-90, hand B f. 90v-94v.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1913 Antonin">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Hrvatski glagolski Antonin i g. prof. Ivan Milčetić |journal=Hrvatska |date=22 March 1913}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Strohal 1917">{{cite book |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Stare hrvatske apokrifne priče i legende |location=Bjelovar |date=1917}}</ref><ref name="Strohal čitanka">{{cite book |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Čitanka iz književnih djela |language=hr}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| 1499 (June 10)

| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| Skurina/Skurinja (Lika)
|
|
|
| Juraj Malić daje fratrom sv. Marije u Zažićnu njeke zemlje, koje im je ostavio u oporuci njegov sin Petar.<ref name="Kukuljević 1852" /><ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" /> Parchment.<ref name="Kolanović 1983" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1490s, 1515-1517, 1531-1557, 1566-1569
| VIII 273
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 146
| 32.5 x 21.2&nbsp;cm
|
| Notarski protokol Franca Sparožića 1515-1517 i 1531-1557 te Matija Sparožića 1566-1569. There are also prilozi A, B, C, which may or may not have originally been part of the protocol. A dates to the 1490s, B to the middle of 1513 to 1517, C to 1553. It entered the archive of the krčki sud. Given to Štefanić in 1931 by Mate Oršić parish priest of Vrh near Krk who had owned it for a long time. Given by Štefanić to Arhiv JAZU in 1958.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-bgcolor="MistyRose"
| abecedary
|
| 1400s (second half)
| Ms. quart 1810
| Munich (University Library)
|
|
|
|
| Die Gotzkircher Abecedarien. Jahrhundert |language=de |journal=Erforschung des Mittelalters |volume=III |location=Stuttgart |date=1960 |pages=247–287}}</ref><ref name="Bischoff 1981" /><ref name="Marti 1991" />

| missal
| MOxf₁
| 1400s (second half)
| Ms. Canon. Lit. 373
| [[Bodleian Library]]
|
| 176+4
| 32.5 x 22.5&nbsp;cm
| 2 co x 31 ro
| Prvi oksfordski misal (First Oxford missal). Folio 84r has a possibly Cyrillic initial, similar to BrOxf.<ref name="Syrku 1907" /><ref name="Jagić 1911" /><ref name="Vajs 1915b"/><ref name="Vajs 1948" /><ref name="Tadin 1953" /><ref name="Tadin 1954" /><ref name="du Feu 1971" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Acquired with Canonici collection in 1817. Canonici acquired them in Italy.<ref name="OSU 1981" />

| missal
| MOxf₂
| 1400s (second half)
| Ms. Canon. Lit. 349
| [[Bodleian Library]]
|
| 239
| 25 x 18&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Drugi oksfordski misal (Second Oxford missal). The first folio recto has the proper for St. Florian added in a different hand, probably later.<ref name="Syrku 1907" /><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Jagić 1911" /><ref name="Vajs 1915b"/><ref name="Vajs 1948" /><ref name="Tadin 1953" /><ref name="Tadin 1954" /><ref name="du Feu 1971" /><ref name="Bakmaz 2010" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Acquired with Canonici collection in 1817. Canonici acquired them in Italy.<ref name="OSU 1981" /><ref name="du Feu 1971">{{cite journal |first=Veronica M. |last=du Feu |title=The Glagolitic MSS in the Bodley Library |location=Zagreb |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |language=en |date=1971 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/file/21589}}</ref>

| Fg(M)Var<sub>2</sub>
| 1400s (second half)

| Varaždin (Capuchin Monastery)
