| 1
| 35 x 25 cm
| 2 co 28 ro
| Second Varaždin Fragment (Drugi varaždinski fragment). Separated in 1986 by Anica Nazor from cover of IX c. 6 (a book printed 1705), which had been known to brother Bono Zvonimir Šagi who had shown it to Anica Vlašić-Anić in 1984.ref name="Vlašić-Anić 2004" /><ref name="Vlašić-Anić 2011">{{cite journal |first=Anica |last=Vlašić-Anić |title=Varaždinski list hrvatskoglagoljskoga misala (FgVar2) |language=hr |trans-title=The Varaždin Leaf of a Croatian Glagolitic Missal (FgVar₂) |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |date=2011 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/file/114620}}</ref><ref name="Vlašić-Anić 2014">{{cite book |first=Anica |last=Vlašić-Anić |contribution=Najnovija otkrića glagoljice u biblioteci Kapucinskoga samostana u Karlobagu |language=hr |title=Franjevci kapucini u Karlobagu : zbornik radova s Međunarodnoga znanstvenoga skupa o 300. obljetnici djelovanja franjevaca kapucina u Lici i Krbavi (1713. – 2013.) |publisher=Kršćanska sadašnjost |location=Zagreb |date=2014 |pages=215–250 |url=https://digitalna.nsk.hr/?pr=i&id=577927}}</ref>

| 1400s (second half)
| Fragm. glag. 113
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 1
| 26 x 19.3&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 32 ro
| List misala. Once owned by pop Paval Sindičić who left a note 1684. He was ''prokurator'' of the clergy in Baška 1664. Brought from Dubašnica to JAZU by Milčetić as a gift near the end of his life. Parchment.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

|-
| confessional
|
| 1400s (last quarter)
| VII 23
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 67
| 16 x 11&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 29-40 ro
| Antoninov konfesional. Likely written by a single scribe with varied handwriting. Language ikavo-ekavian and with /a/ as reflex of *ę behind palatal, so possibly from West Chakavian territory. But it ended up in Istria by 1719. Acquired by Milčetić in Dobrinj from priest Variola who found it on the ''napa'' of his kitchen, explaining the smoke and condensation damage. Acquired by JAZU upon the death of Milčetić. Parchment.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1913">{{cite book |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Hrvatski glagolski spomenici i prof. I. Milčetić |language=hr |location=Zagreb |date=1913}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| breviary
| BrBrt (BrBrit)<ref name="Šimić and Vela 2021" />
| 1400s (late)
| Ms. Add. 31.951
| [[British Library]]
| Croatia
| 71
| 30.5 x 22&nbsp;cm
|
| Britanski brevijar (British breviary). Written by a certain Ivan Križanić. It was kept in the [[British Museum]] until 1882, when it was moved to the British Library.<ref name="Vajs 1915a">{{cite journal |last=Vajs |first=Josef |date=1915 |title=Charvatsko-hlaholský kodex a hlaholský zlomek v Britském museu v Londýně |trans-title=The Croato-Glagolitic Codex and Glagolitic odlomak of the London Museum |language=cs |journal=Sborník filologický |volume=5 |pages=192–197}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |last=Badurina Stipčević |first=Vesna |date=2009 |title=Odlomak Protoevanđelja Jakovljeva u hrvatskoglagoljskom Brevijaru Britanske knjižnice |trans-title=A odlomak of the Protevangelium of James in the Croato-Glagolitic Breviary of the British Library |language=hr |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |volume=78 |pages=222–234}}</ref> It was described by Vajs in ''Charvatsko-hlaholský kodex a hlaholský zlomek v Britském museu v Londýně'' (Sborník filologický 5: 191-197).<ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />

| CLab
| 1400s (late)
| Slav. Sammlung, futural 3, br. 368
| [[National and University Library of Slovenia]]

| Ljubljanski zbornik (Ljubljana miscellany).<ref name="Glavan 1992" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" />
|
|-
| miscellany
|
| 1400s (end)
| IV a 92
| Arhiv HAZU
| Vrbnik?
| 155
| 14.5 x 10.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Zbornik duhovnog štiva: Antoninov konfesional, Plač Gospin i drugo. Scribes: hand A f. 1-40, hand B f. 41-42, hand C f. 42v-44v, hand D f. 44v-48v, alternating hands f.49-56v (but mostly E), hand E f. 57-76, hand F f. 77-130v and 134-155v, hand H f. 132-132v, hand G f. 131-11v and 133-133v. All hands are similar so likely from the same school. Hand F is similar to A but with notable differences. Hand H also wrote the parchment dvolist at the end of the codex.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1916 pjesama">{{cite book |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Zbirka starih hrvatskih pjesama |location=Zagreb |date=1916 |language=hr}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1917" /><ref name="Fancev 1938">{{cite journal |first=Franjo |last=Fancev |title=Plač blažene dive Marije |language=hr |journal=Građa za hrvatsku književnost |volume=XIII |location=Zagreb |date=1938 |pages=193–212}}</ref><ref name="Ivšić 1939">{{cite journal |first=Stjepan |last=Ivšić |title=O tobožnoj "najstarijoj sačuvanoj hrvatskoj pjesmi prije god. 1320." |language=hr |journal=Građa za hrvatsku književnost |volume=XIV |location=Zagreb |date=1939 |pages=1–24}}</ref> Likely written on Krk, especially Vrbnik or Omišalj. Later owned by Franciscans on Krk, including fra Ivan Caković and fra Jure Buić. Acquired by Kukuljević on 14 November 1848 from a certain Lovričić, student of the III order of Saint Francis.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| Homilijar na Matejevo evanđelje. Čakavian with some kajkavisms. Text translated from Czech. In 1779 it belonged to doge Peter Paul Renier. Acquired by Fran Volarić (1851-1908).<ref name="Milčetić biblija">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Milčetić |title=Hrvatska glagolska biblija}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

| Odlomak homilijara. Donated to Staroslavenska akademija by Fran Volarić (died 1908) but it was not found there in preparation for Milčetić 1955 or Štefanić 1960.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

| Ljubljana (Narodna in univerzitetna knjižnica)
|
| 2
|
|
| Glagolski misal. Parchment. Discovered at [[Strahov, Prague|Strahov]] in the Canon library, being used as a cover of Keppler's Astronomy. First reported by Vajs in 1910.<ref name="Vajs 1910 Gesang">{{cite journal |first=Josef |last=Vajs |title=Über den liturgischen Gesang der Glagoliten II |language=de |journal=Archiv für slav. Philologie |volume=31 |pages=430–442}}</ref> Studied by multiple authors.<ref name="Hunaček 1975">{{cite book |first=V. |last=Huňáček |contribution=Klášter Na Slovanech a počátky východoslovanských studií u nás |language=cs |title=Z tradic slovanské kultury v Čechách: Sázava a Emauzy v dějinách české kultury |location=Prague |date=1975}}</ref><ref name="Snižkova 1982?">{{cite journal |first=J. |last=Snížková |title=Hudba v hlaholském zlomku |language=cs |journal=LD}}</ref><ref name="Snižkova 1985">{{cite journal |first=J. |last=Snížková |title=Staroslověnské hudební stopy v Čechách |language=cs |journal=LD |date=6 July 1985}}</ref> Transferred to Ljubljana.<ref name="Damjanović 2000">{{cite book |first=Stjepan |last=Damjanović |chapter=Hrvatska glagoljica u Pragu |language=hr |title=Filološki razgovori |date=2000 |pages=45–51}}</ref><ref name="Žubrinić 2003">{{cite web |first=Darko |last=Žubrinić |title=Hrvatska glagoljica u Češkoj |language=hr |trans-title=Croatian Glagolitic in Czechia |date=February 2003 |url=https://www.croatianhistory.net/etf/ceska.html}}</ref>

|
| 1
| 28 x 21.6&nbsp;cm
|
| List brevijara. Acquired by Kukuljević from S. Kocijančić on 6 January 1867. Kocijančić likely acquired it from Dobrinj from a Josip Gržetić (1837-1894). | Arhiv HAZU

| 10
| 12.7 x 9.7&nbsp;cm

| Magijski zapisi i recepti. Once belonged to Mate Benković and was bound to IV d 56 (which was written earlier). Inherited by Andrija Benković and later Ivan Benković. From Grižane where the Benkovići lived it somehow got to JAZU.<ref name="Strohal 1910 čaranja">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Različni zapisi i čaranja |language=hr |trans-title=Various Notes and Incantations |journal=Zbornik za narodni život i običaje |volume=XV |location=Zagreb |date=1910 |pages=120–132 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=177652}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Two photographs in Štefanić 1970.

|-
| breviary
|
| 1400s
| Fragm. glag. 11 (Kuk. 554)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 5
| 25 x 18&nbsp;cm
|
| Dodatak brevijaru i misalu: Službe na pohođenje Marijino. Includes notes, among which several abecedaries from the 15th-16th and in 2 cases maybe 17th centuries. The middle abecedary on f. 1v and the first on f. 2v are especially notable for their similarity to the abecedary in the Radosav Miscellany. Eventually it came to Rome. Kukuljević acquired it from Rome.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| miscellany
| COxf₂
| 1400s
| Ms. Canon. Lit. 414
| [[Bodleian Library]]
| Croatia
| 68
|
|
| Drugi oxfordski zbornik (Second Oxford miscellany). There is a date 1480 given in the text. Tadin deciphered 1448 on the first page but du Feu could not find it.<ref name="Syrku 1907" /><ref name="Jagić 1911" /><ref name="Vajs 1915b"/><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /><ref name="Ivšić 1948">{{cite journal |first=Stjepan |last=Ivšić |title="Čistilište sv. Patricija" u hrvatskom glagoljskom kontekstu 15. stoljeća / Stjepan Ivšić |journal=Starine JAZU |volume=41 |date=1948 |pages=111–118 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=177200}}</ref><ref name="Tadin 1953" /><ref name="Tadin 1954" /><ref name="Hercigojna 1967">{{cite journal |first=Eduard |last=Hercigojna |title=Glagoljska verzija pune redakcije Pavlove apokalipse iz Oksfordskog kodeksa Ms Can. lit. 414 |language=hr |journal=Radovi Staroslavenskog Instituta |volume=6 |location=Zagreb |date=1967}}</ref> In the possession of archdeacon Matija Sović of Osor, who gave it to A. Fortis. In Italy, Canonici acquired it, and the British Library acquired the Canonici collection in 1817.<ref name="du Feu 1971" /><ref name="OSU 1981" />

| legal
|
| 1400s

| Arhiv HAZU
| [[Dobrinj]]
| 1
| 20 x 19&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Ambroz plovan Dobrinjski zida i daruje crkvu Sv. Ambroza u Dobrinju, na otoku Krku. Acquired by Kukuljević Sakcinski.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> A 15th century transcript of the original dated 8 November 1321 (written by Dobrinj općina scribe Rumin, the first name known in such a role).<ref name="Kolanović 1983" /> Original may have survived as late as Kukuljević but Bratulić did not find it.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

|-
| dialogue
|
| 1400s/1500s
| II b 106 (Kuk. 327)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 23
| 26 x 16.4&nbsp;cm
|
| Dijalog Grgura pape (kožljački). On paper from the period 1472-1485. Fol. 1-4 probably written in the last years of the 15th century and f. 6-23 somewhat afterwards. Includes a ledger in one hand and then notes from 1491 in another hand, then in a third hand from 1513 on by a priest Andrija who likely also wrote the main text of the chronicle. But before the text was written the book had been a ledger belonging to Jurg who was probably the son of lord Martin Mojsejević but when his father Martin died the note was left empty, followed by the 1491 note. The resulting chronicle is of historical significance. The main text was also written, at some time in the late 15th or early 16th century, and in the 16th century it arrived in Vrbnik where it remained until the visit of Kukuljević in 1854, who received the manuscript from Josip Anton Petriš. Paper.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Fučić 1960" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Two photographs in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
|
|
| 1400s/1500s (or early 1500s)
| III a 19 (Kuk. 447)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 130
| 19.5 x 14&nbsp;cm
|
| Korizmenjak ("Knjige svetago Brnardina"). Scribe: mostly hand A, also hand B f. 24 and 26, hand C ff. 37-38, hand D f. 45v and 51, hand E on f. 77. Dialect Čakavian with some Kajkavisms. Precise path of acquisition debated.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Valjavac">Valjavac in his work on Kolunićev zbornik.</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| ''[[Planctus|Planctus Mariae]]''
|
| 1400s/1500s
| VII 160
| Arhiv HAZU
| Croatia
| 27
| 15 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| Plač majke božje.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> In Vrbnik from the early 17th century. Given by will of 20 November 1672 from Ivan Stašić to his son Anton Stašić. Entered JAZU in 1959 through archive of Jerko Gršković.<ref name="OSU 1981" /><ref>Štrkalj Despot, Kristina. ''Vrbnički marijinski plač s konca 15. stoljeća'', Zagreb 2010.</ref> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
|
|
| 1400s/1500s
|
| Krk (arhiv bivšeg Staroslavenskog instituta)
|
| 88
| 20 x 13.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Antoninov konfesional (''Summula confessionis'') by bishop Antonin (1389-1459). One type of paper used includes watermark dated 1452-1453. Paper.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1400s/1500s
|
| Krk (arhiv bivšeg Staroslavenskog instituta)
|
| 110
| 23.3 x 17&nbsp;cm
|
| Kvadriga duhovnim zakonom. Paper. One hand for text. Paratext includes notes by other hands: knez Paval Kovačić on f. 95v, Matiaš Poserniak in 1561 on f. 62v, domin Juraj Malčinić on f. 86 and f. 89v in 1577, unknown on f. 92v. Inside the book is a paper written 18 June 1642 by santiz Petar Starčić.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Premuda 1913">{{cite journal |first=Vinko |last=Premuda |title=Osvrt na djela o glagolici |language=hr |trans-title=Review of Works on Glagolitic |journal=Vjesnik Staroslavenske Akademije U Krku |volume=I |location=Krk |date=1913 |url=https://archive.org/details/vjesnikstaroslav02star}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

|-
| legal
|
| 1500 (about)
|
| Arhiv HAZU
| Senj
|
|
|
| Knez Bartol Frankapan daje senjskom kaptolu selo Župan hlm, a kaptol se zato obvezuje, da će svake nedjelje služiti po tri mise za kneza Bartola i za njegove rodjake. Survives only in transcription.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> A Glagolitic transcription made around 1500 (possibly around 1575) from an original dated 3 June 1488. Once housed in arhiv senjskoga kaptola.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
|
|-
| legal
|
| 1500 (January 19)
| Novljanski samostan collection Fasc. 1, br. 21
| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| Brinje
| 1
| 29 x 19&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Knez Anž Frankapan daruje fratrom u Zažićnu polovicu gračćine u Velikih Psivićih i njeke sjenokoše. A Latinic transcription also survives.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /> Moved from Hrv.-slav. zem. arkiv to Budapest as sign. 37123 then returned.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" /><ref name="Kolanović 1983" />

| 1 co

| 1
| Pred Pavlom Pučićem, sucem Bovićana, Domjan Turčinić prodaje neke zemljišne posjede Valentu Puciću, a koji također kupuje zemljoposjede i od nekih drugih osoba u bovićkom kotaru. Once kept at Budapest in M.D.A. as sign. M.O.D.L. 37124.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" /><ref name="Kolanović 1983" />

|
|-
|
|
| 1506 (28 August 1506)
| IV a 99
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 103
| 20.6 x 15.6&nbsp;cm
|
| Peregrinov blagdanar, rukopis popa Andrija. Scribe: Andrij of Novi Vinodolski. He finished on 28 August 1506. Cinnabar of f. 31 on added by fra Stipan of the island of Krk. Book intended for Ivan Pažanin prior of the pavlinski samostan sv. Marije na Ospu by Novi Vinodolski. Possibly from among those Pavlini expelled from the Glavotok monastery sv. Marije on Krk in 1481. The transcription was from a book by his contemporary Filip of Novi Vinodlski.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1912 blagdanar">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Blagdanar popa Andrija iz Novoga |language=hr |journal=Kršćanska škola |volume=XVI |location=Zagreb |date=1912 |pages=198–202}}</ref><ref name="Strohal pop Filip">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Hrvatski glagolski književnik pop Filip iz Novoga u Vinodolu |language=hr |journal=Nast. Vjesnik |volume=XXI |pages=234–236}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Vrana blagdanar">{{cite journal |first=Josip |last=Vrana |title=Hrvatski glagoljski blagdanar |language=hr |journal=Rad JAZU |volume=285 |pages=95–179}}</ref><ref name="Hamm 1952 Vrana">{{cite journal |first=Josip |last=Hamm |title=Josip Vrana, Hrvatskoglagoljski blagdanar. Studija o pravopisu, jeziku i podrijetlu novljanskog rukopisa iz godine 1506. |language=hr |journal=Slovo |issn=0583-6255 |volume=1 |date=1952 |pages=59–63 |url=https://digitalna.nsk.hr/?pr=i&id=578308}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

|
|-
| legal
|
| 1510 (April 22)
|
| Senj (arhiv senjskoga kaptola)
| Lika<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
| 1
|
| 1 co
| Povjerenik senjskoga kaptola Barak dolazi s kraljevim čovjekom Juretom Piščićem, da slušaju porotnike u parni Petra Daroića s Nemanići i Škvarići. Ovi posljednji neće da dadu porotnikah; zato Petar poziva svoje porotnike pred kraljevski sud. Survives in contemporary transcription.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| legal
|
| 1511 (August 4)
|
| Senj (arhiv senjskoga kaptola)
| Novo selo (Lika)
| 1
|
| 1 co
| Povjerenik senjskoga kaptola svjedoči, kako je pred njim i pred kraljevim čovjekom a na sudu bužkom Vitko Andrijašević Jurju Piščiću vratio ono, u čem se je bio mienjao Vitkov stric s Jurjem. Nemogavši pako Juraj naplatiti Vitka, dobi ovaj Jurjevu plemenštinu u zalog. Survives in transcription.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| 1512 (January 26, 27)<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
|
| Senj (arhiv senjskoga kaptola)
| Strijane (Sinj)
| 1
|
| 3 co
| Povjerenik senjskoga kaptola kazuje, kako su rotnici pred njim i pred kraljevim čovjekom izpovjedili, da su sudci proti zakonu uveli Pednića u Novakovićevu plemenštinu. Survives in transcription contemporary with original.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| legal
|
| 1512 (26, 27)
|
|
| Strijane (Sinj)
| 1
|
|
| Povjerenik senjskog kaptola ponovo piše o protuzakonitom uvođenju Pednića u Novakovićev plemićki posjed. Survives in transcription contemporary with original. Same scribe as other Strijane document from this year.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| legal
|
| 1512
|
| pismohrana senjskoga kaptola
| Srijane
|
|
|
| Povjerenik senjskoga kaptola kazuje, kako su plemeniti ljudi pred njim i pred kraljevim čovjekom zabacili odluku sudacah, koju su ovi bili učinili u parni Pednića s Novakovićem. Survives in transcription. Srav. listinu od 1512. 26. siečnja.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" />

| 1513 (May 2)

| Ljubljana (knjižnica franjevačke provincije sv. Križa)
| Senj
| 1
| 39.5 x 23.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Senjski kaptol kao vjerodostojno mjesto prepisuje, na zamolbu franjevca Ivana Vranića, nekoliko isprava koje sadrže presude sudaca i rotnika ličkog stola u nekim sporovima.<ref name="Vončina 1955" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| ritual
|
| 1514 (12 September)
| Berčićevo sobranje br. 1
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
| 72
| 14.6 x 9.5&nbsp;cm
| Sali
| Obrednik iz 1514. Once owned by the parish church in Sali, acquired by Berčić through a student from Sali. Probably written by the same Klimantović who wrote the ritual kept at Sv. Ksaver in Zagreb and the ritual br. 2 of the Berčić collection.<ref name="Berčić 1883">{{cite journal |first=Ivan |last=Berčić |title=Njekoliko staroslavenskih i hrvatskih knjiga što pisanih, što tiskanih glagoljicom, kojim se u skorašnje doba u trag ušlo |language=hr |journal=Rad JAZU |date=1883 |volume=59 |pages=158–185 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=169324}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Milčetić 1955" />
|
|-
| legal
|
| 1514 (October 28)
|
| Senj (arhiv senjskoga kaptola)
| Bužani
| 2
|
|
| Članovi ličkog i buškog rotnog stola svjedoče pod zakletvom da su dobit od najma mlinova za mljevenje žita u Plusišću popola dijelili Perušić i knez Ivan Cetinski, i da je Perušićeva samo jedna obala vode.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
|
|-
| legal
|
| 1514 (November 8)
|
| collection of I. Črnčić
| Sužan
|

|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
| ledger
|
| 1520-1642
| VII 89
| Arhiv HAZU
| Zabrežec ([[San Dorligo della Valle|Dolina]])
| 102
| 21.5 x 15.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Kvadirna bratovštine sv. Antuna u Zabrešcu (Dolina kraj Trsta). Glagolitic to 1610 then Latinic from 1611. Kept in the parish Dolina as late as 1910, but once examined by Jakov Volčić. Acquired by JAZU im 1930, likely sent by Božo Milanović.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Botica et al. 2017">{{cite book |first1=Ivan |last1=Botica |first2=Danijela |last2=Doblanović |first3=Marta |last3=Jašo |title=Kvadirna ili ligištar bratovštine sv. Antona opata iz Zabrešca u Dolini |series=Glagoljski rukopisi |publisher=Historijski arhiv Pazin |date=2017}}</ref>

|-
|
|
| 1524-1526
| III d 1 (Kuk. 1016)
| Arhiv HAZU
| Šćitarjevo
| 14
| 29.5 x 11&nbsp;cm
|
| Bilježnica šćitarjevačkog župnika. Parchment cover is a bifolium from a Latin missal. Scribe was a parish priest in Šćitarjevo. It is the northernmost completely Glagolitic manuscript by place of origin with certainty with the exception of the work of the Czech Glagolitic monks. Acquired by Kukuljević.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| legal
|
| 1525 (December 20)
| N. R. A. Fasc. 1650. No. 11
| [[Croatian State Archives|HDA]]
| Modruš
|
|
|
| Knez Brnardin Frankapan izkupljuje grad Dubovac od Grgura Štefkovića, komu ga bješe dao za miraz sa kćerju svojom Veronikom, te mu daje selo Vinicu.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /> Parchment.<ref name="Kolanović 1983" />

|-
| protocol
|
| 1526-1527
|
|
| Baška
| 10
|
|
| Fragmenat notarskog protokola Ivana Mantakovića 1526-1527. Scribe: Ivan Mantaković. Last possessed by parish priest Mate Oršić in Vrh by Krk. Not seen since. Attached was a folio with two legal acts (31 October and 5 November 1527), now Arhiv HAZU sign. fragm. glag. 130.<ref name="Štefanić 1934">{{cite journal |first=Vjekoslav |last=Štefanić |title=Fragmenat glagolske notarske knjige Ivana Mantakovića |language=hr |trans-title=A Fragment of the Glagolitic Notary Book of Ivan Mantaković |journal=Vjesnik Državnog arkiva u Zagrebu |date=1934 |volume=VI |pages=1–35}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1960" />
|
|-
| ledger
|
| 1526-1611, 1566-1628
| II c 56 (Kuk. 838)
| Arhiv HAZU
| Roč
| 284
| 30.5 x 10.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Knjiga računa bratovštine (crkve) i općine Roč. Mostly Glagolitic with some Italian in the late 16th and early 17th centuries, but last Glagolitic entry in 1610 and Italian only from 1611 on. Divided into book A (f. 1-173, 1526-1611) and book B (f. 174-276, 1566-1628). Acquired by Kukuljević.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1911 Istra" /><ref name="Strohal 1919">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Iz starine |language=hr |trans-title=From Antiquities |journal=Zbornik za narodni život i običaje |volume=24 |location=Zagreb |date=April 1919 |pages=295–307 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=177801}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| Senj (arhiv kaptola senjskoga)
| Senj
| 1
| 27 x 22&nbsp;cm
|
| Senjski kaptol prima u svoje knjige ugovor kneza Grgura Orlovčića i kneza Petra Kružića, kojim se ustanovljuje, da u slučaju izumrtja obitelji jednoga izmedju njih preostala obitelj nasliedi sve imanje izumrle. Survives in transcription.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

|
|-
| legal
|
| 1527 (14 July)
|
| Senj (arhiv senjskoga kaptola)
| Posedarje
| 4
|
|
| Povjerenik senjskogu kaptola i kraljev čovjek slušaju svjedoke, koji svjedoče, da knez Juraj Posedarski nije predao Turkom grada Obrovca. Survives in transcription.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /> Text includes tanscription of a 13 August 1526 letter written by lord Ivan Karlović of Krbava in Mutnica (Lika) to Jurah Posedarski commander of Obrovac to not abandon the city.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| Tabor by Ivanić

| Knez Krištofor Frankapan piše senjskomu biskupu Franji Jožefiću, što bi valjalo činiti, da se Hrvatska predobije za Zapolju.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" />

|-
| will
|
| 1527 (November 20)
|
| Vrbnik (župni arhiv)
| Senj
| 1
| 28 x 21&nbsp;cm
|
| Will of priest Matija Baromić (Oporuka popa Matija Baromića). Survives in Glagolitic transcription by Papić contemporary with original or at least from 16th century. Matija Baromić was related to [[Blaž Baromić]]. Discovered by Stjepan Ivšić in the fragment of a book in Vrbnik.<ref name="Štefanić 1933">{{cite journal |last=Štefanić |first=Vjekoslav |title=Fragmenat glagoljske notarske knjige Ivana Mantakovića bašćanskog notara iz godine 1526 i 1527 |location=Zagreb |publisher=Zaklada tiskare Narodnih novina |date=1933}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1954 isprave">{{cite journal |last=Štefanić |first=Vjekoslav |title=Još tri glagoljske isprave baščanskog notara Mantakovića iz g. 1514 i 1527 |language=hr |journal=Zbornik Odsjeka za povijesne znanosti Zavoda za povijesne i društvene znanosti Hrvatske akademije znanosti i umjetnosti |volume=1 |date=1954 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/clanak/124580}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1955 oporuka">{{cite journal |last=Štefanić |first=Vjekoslav |title=Oporuka Matija Baromića od god. 1527 |journal=Radovi Staroslavenskog Instituta |language=hr |issue=2 |date=1955}}</ref><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
| [https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=iiif.v.a&id=181318&tify=%7B%22pages%22:%5B6%5D,%22view%22:%22thumbnails%22%7D 1954] <nowiki>[partial]</nowiki>

| kotar gradački

|-
| miscellany
|
| 1529-1557
| I a 25 (Kuk. 329)
| Arhiv HAZU
| Galevac, Zadar
| 87
| 13.8 x 9.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Zbornik Šimuna Glavića.<ref name="Kukuljević 1856">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Kukuljević Sakcinski |title=Pjesnici hrvatski XV vieka |language=hr |trans-title=Croatian Poets of the XV Century |location=Zagreb |date=1856}}</ref><ref name="Kukuljević 1857">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Kukuljević Sakcinski |contribution=Ljetopisi fratra Šimuna Glavića |language=hr |trans-title=Chronicles of Brother Šimun Glavić |title=Politička povjestnica |series=Arkiv za povjestnicu jugoslavensku |volume=IV |location=Zagreb |date=1857 |pages=36–84 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=dJ5OAQAAIAAJ}}</ref><ref name="Kukuljević 1857-1">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Kukuljević Sakcinski |title=Politička povjestnica |language=hr |trans-title=Political History |series=Arkiv za povjestnicu jugoslavensku |year=1859 |volume=V |publisher=Ljudevit Gaj |url=https://archive.org/details/arkiv_za_povjestnicu_jugoslavensku_knjiga_v-ivan_kukuljevic_sakcinski}}</ref><ref name="Ivančić 1910">{{cite book |first=S. |last=Ivančić |title=Povjesne crte o samostanskom III redu sv. o. Franje po Dalmaciji, Kvarneru i Istri |language=hr |trans-title=Historical Notes about the Monastic III Order of St. Francis in Dalmatia, Kvarner and Istra |location=Zadar |date=1910}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Strohal Glavić">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Hrvatski glagolski književnik fra Šimun Glavić |journal=Vienac |volume=III}}</ref><ref name="Fancev 1938" /> Scribe was Šimun Glavić for f. 8-43v, 46-62, 66-74, 76-84. The rest was written in a younger hand. Glavić was not a scribe by profession but was a notable Franciscan, three times the head of the dalmatinsko-istarska provincija. He died after 1564. He wrote most of it by 1529 when he finished the main part of the text, and the rest later. He carried the chronicle down to 1557. It was written on Galevac and in Zadar, then carried from monastery to monastery, including Koper, Dubašnica and Omišalj. Acquired by Kukuljević by 1856.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| legal
|
| 1500s (beginning)
|
| Senj (arhiv senjskoga kaptola)
| Brinje<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
|
|
|
| Senjski kaptol prepisuje jedan list kneza Jurja Kosinjskoga, koji je ovomu dan od kneza Anža Frankapana rad posudbe grada Kosina.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> 1489 original lost, but survives in early 16th century transcript by the same scribe responsible for the transcript of the 13 February 1499 document, likewise commissioned by Ivan Lacković.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
|
|-
| legal
|
| 1500s (beginning)
|
| Senj (arhiv senjskoga katpola)
| Senj
|
|
|
| Senjski kaptol prepisuje na prošnju kneza Ivana Lackovića, sina Jurja Kosinskoga, jednu listinu, u kojoj knez Anž Frankapan govori, kako se je mienjao s Jurjem Kosinskim, davši mu za Kosin Zahumlje. Survives only in transcription.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Original dated 13 February 1499. Survives only in transcript from beginning of 16th century made at request of Ivan Lacković.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| miscellany
| {{interlanguage link|Tkon miscellany|lt=CTk|hr|Tkonski zbornik}}
| 1500s (first decades)
| IV a 120
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 171
| 14 x 10.3&nbsp;cm
|
| Tkonski zbornik (Tkon miscellany).<ref name="Strohal 1910 poučni">{{cite book |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Poučni članci iz starohrvatske glagolske knjige |language=hr |location=Zagreb |date=1910}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1910-1911 upute">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |journal=Kršćanska škola g. 1910-1911 |language=hr |pages=38–42}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1910-1911 molitva">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |date=1911 |language=hr |journal=Kršćanska škola 1910-1911 |pages=42–43}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1916 Cvet" /><ref name="Strohal 1917" /><ref name="Kolumbić 1962">{{cite journal |first=Nikica |last=Kolumbić |title=Jedna pjesma protiv žena iz XV stoljeća |journal=Radovi - Razdio lingvističko filološki |volume=3 |location=Zadar |date=1962 |pages=199–217}}</ref><ref name="Grabar 1967">{{cite journal |first=Biserka |last=Grabar |title=Apokrifna Djela apostolska u hrvatskoglagoljskoj literaturi 1. Djela Andrije i mateja u gradu ljudoždera 2. Djela apostola Petra i Andrije |language=hr |journal=Radovi Staroslavenskog Instituta |volume=6 |location=Zagreb |date=1967 |pages=109–208 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/clanak/21457}}</ref> Possibly written by a single scribe with varied handwriting over time.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1911 prikazanja" /><ref name="Fancev 1925">{{cite journal |first=Franjo |last=Fancev |title=Prilozi za povijest hrvatske crkvene drame |journal=Nastavni Vjesnik |language=hr |volume=XXXIII |date=1925 |page=190}}</ref><ref name="Fancev drame">{{cite journal |first=Franjo |last=Fancev |title=Građa za povijest hrvatske crkvene drame |language=hr |journal=Građa za povijest književnosti hrvatske |volume=XI |pages=13–14}}</ref> Written somewhere from Vinodol to Ozalj by a single scribe with the possible exception of f. 67-98 and f. 162-169. Certainly at least by scribes of the same school.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /><ref name="Strohal čitanka" /><ref name="Fancev muka">{{cite journal |first=Franjo |last=Fancev |title=Muka Spasitelja i Uskrsnuće Isukrstovo |journal=Građa za povijest književnosti hrvatske |volume=XIV |pages=241–287}}</ref> Two photographs in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| deed confirmation
|
| 1500s (first decades)
|
| Arhiv HAZU
| Tržić
|
|
|
| Bužki stol daje list Jurju Pedniću iz Marinacah, koji je kao bližnji kupio njeku zemlju Antuna Ratkovića, koju je ovaj bio izgubio za osud. Original dated 18 February 1450 lost. Survives in transcription from first decades of 16th century. Formerly in the pismohrana senjskoga kaptola.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| Blagajnička knjiga "brašćine" crkve sv. Marije u Grobniku. Completely Glagolitic with Latin only for some later notes from the 18th century. But there are also Glagolitic notes, the latest dated 1771 by fra Šime Lapčić on f. 111v.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| Knjige "Disipula". Written by same scribe as sign. VIII 126, thus Mihovil parish priest of Belgrad (in Vinodol). Acquired by Ivan Berčić in 1852. | Odlomak disipula. Similar handwriting to CTk. Hand that left the note from 1542 (priest Mihovil son of Anton Burić in Poljane) similar to but not identical to that of the main text.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-bgcolor="MistyRose"
| missal
| {{ill|Klimpuh Missal|lt=MKlimp|hr|Klimpuški rukopis}}
| 1543-1563 (Glagolitic part)
| R. V. 28
| Győr (Seminary Library)
| [[Klingenbach]]
|
|
|
| Klimpeh Missal (Klimpeški misal).<ref name="Romer 1861">{{cite journal |first=Flóris |last=Rómer |title=Klempai Ájtatos Alapítványok |language=hu |journal=Győri történelmi és régészeti füzetek |date=1861 |volume=1 |pages=60–64 |url=http://real-j.mtak.hu/15029/}}</ref><ref name="Tyran 2010">{{cite book |first=Katharina |last=Tyran |title=Das Klingenbacher handschriftliche Fragment |publisher=ZIGH |language=de |location=Trausdorf |date=2010}}</ref> Printed 1501 in Latin but with handwritten Cyrillic marginal notes and a 3 word colophon in Glagolitic. Scribe: Cyrillic by Juraj Vuković of Jastrebarsko, Glagolitic by unknown hand after Vuković. Last dated entry by Vuković from 1564, the first from 1561; as late as 1518 notes were written in the book by German speaking clergy, so the Croat priests are thought to have arrived later. These are the only known examples of either Glagolitic or Cyrillic in pre-modern Burgenland. The Latin book had been acquired by the church in Klimpeh (Klingenbach) in 1504. Already in Győr/Raab by the time it was first described in 1861, though it is unknown exactly when it reached there.<ref name="Verdenich 1932">{{cite journal |first=Andras |last=Verdenich |title=A kelenpataki régi misekönyv horvátnyelvu feljegyzései |language=hu |journal=Győri Szemle |volume=17-19 |location=Győr |date=1932}}</ref><ref name="Meršić 1935">{{cite journal |first=Martin |last=Meršić |title=Ćirilske i glagolske zabilješke klimpuških starih mašnih knjig |language=hr |journal=Naša domovina |date=1935 |location=Eisenstadt}}</ref><ref name="Jembrih 2011">{{cite journal |first=Alojz |last=Jembrih |title=Hrvatski zapis (1564.) Jurja Vukovića iz Jastrebarskoga u latinskom misalu župe Klimpuh |language=hr |journal=Kroatologija |date=2011 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/file/119610}}</ref> Used in many studies on the [[Burgenland Croats]].<ref name="Ujević 1934">{{cite book |first=Mate |last=Ujević |title=Gradišćanski Hrvati |language=hr |trans-title=Burgenland Croats |date=1934 |location=Zagreb}}</ref><ref name="Ivšić 1971">{{cite journal |first=Stjepan |last=Ivšić |title=Hrvatska dijaspora u 16. stoljeću i jezik Hrvata Gradišćanaca |language=hr |trans-title=Croatian Diaspora in the 16. Century and the Language of Burgenland Croats |journal=Slavische Propyläen |volume=96 |location=Munich |date=1971}}</ref><ref name="Biricz 1949">{{cite book |first=Eugen |last=Biricz |title=Geschichte der Einwanderung der burgenländischen Kroaten |language=de |location=Vienna}}</ref><ref name="Rittsteuer 1953">{{cite journal |first=Josef |last=Rittsteuer |title=Ueber die konfessionelle Zugehörigkeit unserer Kroaten zur Zeit der Reformation und Gegenreformation |language=de |journal=Burgenländische Heimatblätter |volume=15 |date=1953 |location=Eisenstadt}}</ref><ref name="Burgenland Landesregierung 1963">{{cite encyclopedia |title=Allgemeine Landestopographie des Burgenlandes |volume=2.1 |publisher=Burgenland Landesregierung |contribution=Klingenbach |pages=665–666 |date=1963}}</ref><ref name="Meršić 1970">{{cite journal |first=Martin |last=Meršić |title=Naša najstarija crikvena jačka |language=hr |journal=Crikveni glasnik Gradišća |volume=23 |location=Eisenstadt |date=19 June 1970}}</ref><ref name="Meršić 1974">{{cite book |first=Martin |last=Meršić |title=Znameniti i zaslužni gradišćanski Hrvati |language=hr |trans-title=Notable and Worthy Burgenland Croats |location=Zagreb |date=1974}}</ref><ref name="Hadrovics 1974">{{cite book |first=László |last=Hadrovics |title=Schrifttum und Sprache der Burgenländischen Kroaten im 18. und 19. Jahrhundert |language=de |location=Budapest |date=1974}}</ref><ref name="Schreiner 1983">{{cite book |first=Bela |last=Schreiner |title=Das Schicksal der Burgenländischen Kroaten |language=de |date=1983}}</ref><ref name="Vlasitz 1986">{{cite book |first=Josef |last=Vlasits |contribution=Die Sprache der burgenländischen Kroaten |language=de |title=Die burgenländischen Kroaten im Wandel der Zeit |location=Vienna |date=1986}}</ref><ref name="Ritig-Beljak 1995">{{cite book |first=Nives |last=Ritig-Beljak |contribution=Pregled usmene književnosti |language=hr |title=Povijest i kultura gradišćanskih Hrvata |date=1995 |location=Zagreb}}</ref><ref name="Benčić 1995">{{cite book |first=Nikola |last=Benčić |contribution=Pismo i književnost |language=hr |title=Povijest i kultura gradišćanskih Hrvata |location=Zagreb |date=1995}}</ref><ref name="Benčić 1998">{{cite book |first=Nikola |last=Benčić |title=Književnost gradišćanskih Hrvata od XVI. stoljeća do 1921 |language=hr |trans-title=Literature of the Burgenland Croats from the XVI. Century to 1921 |location=Zagreb |date=1998}}</ref><ref name="HN 1999">{{cite news |date=1999 |volume=44 |issue=7 |work=Hrvatske novine |location=Eisenstadt}}</ref><ref name="Vranješ-Šoljan 2005">{{cite book |first=Božena |last=Vranješ-Šoljan |title=Gradišćanski Hrvati između tradicije i suvremenosti |language=hr |trans-title=Burgenland Croats Between Tradition and Modernity |date=2005}}</ref><ref name="NG 2007">{{cite journal |title=Klimpuški rukopisni fragment |language=hr |trans-title=The Klimpuh Manuscript Fragment |publisher=Hrvatski akademski klub |journal=Novi Glas |volume=2 |location=Vienna |date=2007 |page=27}}</ref><ref name="HN 2009">{{cite news |first=Đ. |last=Franković |work=Hrvatske novine |volume=100 |number=15 |date=10 April 2009 |page=24}}</ref><ref name="Stipić 2021">{{cite book |first=Nives |last=Stipić |title=Višejezičnost gradišćanskih Hrvata u Beču i srednjem Gradišću–formalno i neformalno učenje jezika i kulture |language=hr |location=Zagreb |date=2021}}</ref>

| 1549
|
|
| Strilči
|

| 1500s (first half)

| SBB (Staatsbibliothek Bamberg)
|
| 77
| 21.5 x 14.2 cm
| 1 co
| Medical Abecedary (das Medizinische Abecedarium). Italian and Latin book with Glagolitic abecedary on 73v. Paper.<ref name="Leitschuh and Fischer 1899">{{cite book |first1=Friedrich |last1=Leitschuh |first2=Hans |last2=Fischer |title=Katalog der Handschriften der Königlichen Bibliothek zu Bamberg |language=de |trans-title=Catalogue of Manuscripts of the Royal Library of Bamberg |date=1899 |location=Bamberg |url=https://nbn-resolving.org/urn:nbn:de:bvb:22-dtl-0000025172#0038}}</ref><ref name="Marti 1991" /><ref name="Kempgen 2022">{{cite book |first=Sebastian |last=Kempgen |contribution=Das Bamberger glagolitische Alphabet – digital ediert |language=de |title=Verbunden mit den Slaven |date=2022 |url=https://www.academia.edu/38244501}}</ref>
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://www.academia.edu/38244501 2022]
|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
|
|
| 1550, 1590-1784, 1831
| II a 79 (Kuk. Cod. glag. No VIII)
| Arhiv HAZU
| Belgrad (Vinodol)
| 19+12+12
| 28.3 x 10.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Zemljišna knjiga crkve (braće) sv. Marije u Belgradu. Glagolitic to mixed Glagolitic and Latinic then only Latinic from 1673 on. In 1790 the parish of Belgrad was united with the parish of Grižane. Acquired by Kukuljević in Grižane.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

Includes notes of importance to historians.<ref name="Valjavac 1893">{{cite journal |first=Matija |last=Valjavec |title=Crkvena prikazanja starohrvatska XVI i XVII vijeka |journal=Stari Pisci Hrvatski |volume=XX |location=Zagreb |language=hr |date=1893 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=185858}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1911 prikazanja">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Starohrvatska glagolska prikazanja |language=hr |journal=Nastavni Vjesnik |volume=XIX |location=Zagreb |date=1911 |pages=348–352 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=L3IpAQAAMAAJ}}</ref><ref name="Roić 1914">{{cite journal |first=J. |last=Roić |title=Starohrvatska crkvena prikazanja |language=hr |journal=Nastavni Vjesnik |date=1914 |pages=1–18, 176–181}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1917 dodaci">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Dodaci i ispravci k izdanju Crkvenih prikazanja starih hrvatskih XVI i XVII vijeka |journal=Rad JAZU |page=216 |date=1917 |language=hr |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=169827}}</ref><ref name="Fancev 1932">{{cite journal |first=Franjo |last=Fancev |title=Hrvatska crkvena prikazanja |language=hr |journal=Narodna Starina |volume=XI |location=Zagreb |date=1932 |pages=143–168}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Three photographs in Štefanić 1970.

| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
| Glavotok
| 34
| 12.5 x 9.9&nbsp;cm
|
| Epistola o nedjelji fra Petra Milutinića. Discovered by Berčić 1864 on Krk (probably in Glavotok monastery). Parchment.<ref name="Berčić 1883" /><ref name="Karinski 1908">{{cite book |last=Karinski |title=Образцы глаголицы |location=Saint Petersburg |date=1908}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Milčetić 1955" /><ref name="Štefanić 1960" />
|
|-
| homiliary
|
| 1558
| VIII 126
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 240
| 28 x 19.8&nbsp;cm
| 2 co 32 ro
| Knjige "Disipula". Written by a single hand over the course of at least 2 years (1556-1558): scribe Mihovil parish priest of Belgrad (in Vinodol). Owned by Andrija Benković of Grižane in 1668, and by Andrija Ilijić of Omišalj in 1767. A later Glagolitic note was also written on Krk. Discovered by Milčetić in Omišalj at the house of the parish priest Nikola Albanež. Reached JAZU through Milčetić archive. Paper.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Milčetić Beitrag">{{cite journal |first=Ivan |last=Milčetić |title=Ein Beitrag zur kroatisch-glagolitischen Bibliographie |language=de |journal=Archiv für slav. Philologie |volume=VIII |pages=247–256}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

|
|-
| rule
|
| 1559 (November 25)
| IV a 122 (IV a 142)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 20
| 15 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| Mare magnum Franjevačkih indulgencija i privilegija. Scribe: Petar Milutinić of Rab, in a hand that imitates the original by fra Šimun Klimantović. Acquired by Ivan Berčić in Sutomišćica on Ugljan. Acquired by Arhiv JAZU 1895 so Berčić probably loaned it to Kukuljević.<ref name="Berčić 1881" />{<ref name="Berčić 1881" /><ref name="Strohal 1911 o bulama">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Dvije glagolske hrvatske knjige o raznim papinskim bulama |journal=Prosvjeta |language=hr |date=1911 |pages=358–359}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Milčetić 1955" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

| Arhiv HAZU
| Draguć
| 96
| 33.5 x 22.8&nbsp;cm
|
| Christenings 1579-1685, marriages 1584-1722 and confirmations 1659. Glagolitic to 1650 (by parish priest Andreja Matković) then Italian. Some Italian already in 1640 from Matteo Juretich.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| christenings, confirmations, marriages, deaths
|
| 1579-1650
|
| Molat (župni ured)
| [[Molat]], [[Zapuntel]]
| 261 p
| 20.1 x 10.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Oldest parish register in Zadar bishopric. Contains christenings in Zapuntel 1630-1650 then in Molat 1613-1650, then confirmations 1618-1643, then marriages in Zapuntel 1614-1650, then marriages 1613-1650, then marriages 1584 and 1579, then deaths 1612-1650, then marriages 1579-1580, then christenings 1579-1588.<ref name="Cvitanović 1949" />
|
|-
| christenings, marriages
|
| 1579-1650
|
|
| Draguć
|

| deed
|
| 1579

|
| Nuvsići
|
|
|
| Sale of land by Benko Crnković to Antun Iškičić. Discovered in [[Ortaháza]]. Latinic transcription published by Janko Šafarik in ''Danica'' 1840 br. 26.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" />
|
|-
| homiliary
|
| 1500s (middle)
|
| Krk (arhiv bivšeg Staroslavenskog instituta)
|
| 165
| 29 x 20&nbsp;cm
|
| Sermoni disipula (po Herlotu) by Johann Herlot (''Sermones Discipuli de tempore et de sanctis''). Discovered by Ivan Črnčić in Dobrinj, who sold it 1853 to Stjepan Kocijančić professor at Gorica. Acquired from Kocijančić by Ivan Kukuljević who rebound it. Črnčić borrowed it from Kukuljević and never returned it. Upon his death it was taken by Dragutin Parčić 1928 to the Bogoslovska akademija in Zagreb. Then Orlić sent it to Vinko Premuda who transcribed part of it into Latinic in a manuscript housed on Košljun.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

| Belgrad (Vinodol)

|
|
| Upravitelji knezova Frankapana zajedno sa sucima, plovanima i satnicima donose presudu u korist Grižanaca i Belgradaca vezano uz njihov spor s Driveničanima.<ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Original dated 1449 in Grižane lost but copy, first mentioned in a Grižane list dated 1620, was contemporary with original. This document is a younger copy by priest Luka Mavrić.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| <ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Galović 2003" />

|-
| protocol
|
| 1586-1616
|
|
| Veli Lošinj
| 103
| 34 x 11.5 cm
| 1 co
| Krstinić Protocol (Krstinićev protokol).<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Klen 1984">{{cite journal |first=Danilo |last=Klen |title=Glagoljicom pisani izvori Lošinja i Cresa |language=hr |trans-title=Glagolitic Written Sources of Lošinj and Cres |journal=Otočki ljetopis Cres-Lošinj |volume=5 |location=Mali Lošinj |date=1984}}</ref> Scribes: Mikula Krstinić and his nephew Žuvan Krstinić. The earliest date to 1564 but they are copied. Acquired 1746 by notary Vintura Botterini. First noted 1791 in the chronicle of Lošinj notary Martin (Bonaventura) Botterini. At the time it was in the archive of the Botterini family.<ref name="Košuta 1988">{{cite journal |first=Leo |last=Košuta |title=Glagoljski lošinjski protokoli notara Mikule Krstinića i Ivana Božičevića (1564-1636) |language=hr |trans-title=Glagolitic Protocols from Lošinj of the Notary Mikula Krstinić and Ivan Božičević (1564-1636) |journal=Radovi Staroslavenskog Zavoda |volume=9 |date=1988 |location=Zagreb |isbn=86-81149-03-2 |issn=0514-5058}}</ref> Botterini's note was relayed by Lošinj historians Bonicelli and Nicolich.<ref name="Bonicelli 1869">{{cite book |first=Gaspare |last=Bonicelli |title=Storia dell'isola dei Lossini |language=it |trans-title=History of the Island of Lošinj |location=Trieste |date=1869}}</ref><ref name="Nicolich 1871">{{cite book |first=Matteo |last=Nicolich |title=Storia documentata dei Lussini |language=it |location=Rovinj |date=1871}}</ref> In 1865 it was owned by Silvestar Busanić of Lošinj.<ref name="Ljubić 1881">{{cite journal |first=Šime |last=Ljubić |title=Borba za glagoljicu na Lošinju |language=hr |trans-title=Battle for Glagolitic on Lošinj |journal=Rad JAZU |volume=57 |location=Zagreb |date=1881 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=169309}}</ref> In 1900 it was owned by H. Bussanich of Trieste.<ref name="Karasek 1900">{{cite journal |first=Josef |last=Karásek |title=Vorläufige Berichte der Balkan-Commission VII. Über eine Studienreise zur Erforschung des kroatischen Dialektes in Lussin Piccolo und der Literaturdenkmäler in Ragusa |language=de |journal=Anzeiger der Wiener Akademie der Wissenschaft, Phil. Hist. Classe |volume=XVIII |location=Vienna |date=1900 |pages=1–24}}</ref> Milčetić was prevented from seeing it by the war.<ref name="Milčetić 1915">{{cite journal |first=Ivan |last=Milčetić |title=Della storia civile e cronologica della terra sive castello di Lossin Grande nella Dalmazia, ventilata nell'anno 1791. Napisao lošinjski bilježnik Martin Botterini |language=hr |journal=Ljetopis JAZU |volume=30 |location=Zagreb |date=1915}}</ref> Found in possession of Silvija Bussanich in 1951, and a microfilm was made for Arhiv JAZU with sign. I/34. Photographs of pages published in Košuta 1988.<ref name="Košuta 1988" /> Used by Josip Hamm in his studies of the [[Susak]] dialect conducted from 1953 on.<ref name="Hamm et al. 1956">{{cite journal |first1=Josip |last1=Hamm |first2=Mate |last2=Hraste |first3=Petar |last3=Guberina |title=Govor otoka Suska |language=hr |trans-title=Speech of the Island of Susak |journal=Hrvatski dijalektološki zbornik |volume=I |location=Zagreb |date=1956 |pages=17–43}}</ref><ref name="Hamm 1957 Susak">{{cite journal |first=Josip |last=Hamm |title=Iz problematike čakavskih govora I |language=hr |journal=Radovi Instituta JAZU U Zadru |volume=III |location=Zagreb |date=1957 |pages=21–38}}</ref><ref name="Hamm 1960">{{cite journal |first=Josip |last=Hamm |title=Iz problematike čakavskih govora II |language=hr |journal=Radovi Instituta JAZU U Zadru |volume=VI-VII |location=Zagreb |date=1960 |pages=65–80}}</ref> And in the dialectal studies of Eduard Hercigojna.<ref name="Hercigojna 1983a">{{cite journal |first=Eduard |last=Hercigojna |title=Tendencije dijakronijskog razvitka fleksije pridjeva i zamjenica u jeziku hrvatskoglagoljskih zborničkih tekstova 15. stoljeća |language=hr |journal=Filologija |volume=11 |location=Zagreb |date=1983}}</ref><ref name="Hercigojna 1983b">{{cite journal |first=Eduard |last=Hercigojna |title=Prilog istraživanju ikavsko-ekavske zakonitosti u čakavštini 15. stoljeća |language=hr |journal=Radovi Zavoda za slavensku filologiju Filozovskog fakulteta u Zagrebu |volume=18 |location=Zagreb |date=1983}}</ref> It has also been used in scholarly works on the geography and history of Lošinj.<ref name="Putanec 1962">{{cite journal |first=Valentin |last=Putanec |title=Prilozi za proučavanje hrvatskih antroponima: 1. Barom, Baromov, Barum, Baromić, 2. Zuvela, Žuvela, Zuvelić |language=hr |journal=Filologija |volume=3 |location=Zagreb |date=1962}}</ref><ref name="Vlahović 1968">{{cite book |first=Josip |last=Vlahović |title=La communità di Cherso e Ossero |language=it |location=Rijeka |date=1968}}</ref><ref name="Stražičić 1981">{{cite journal |first=Nikola |last=Stražičić |title=Otok Cres. Prilog poznavanju geografije naših otoka |language=hr |journal=Otočki ljetopis Cres-Lošinj |volume=4 |location=Mali Lošinj |date=1981}}</ref>

| Računi (Kvaderna) "Od dot crekvenih". Glagolitic to 1657 then Italian from 1659. Scribes: mostly priest Vicenc Frlanić to 1612 then mostly parish priest Bernardin Velijan 1620-1657.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1910" /><ref name="Strohal 1910/1911 Frlanić">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Anali ili kronika boljunskoga plovana Vincenca Frlanića i njegova nastavljača Ivana Križmanića |language=hr |trans-title=Annals or Chronicle of Boljun Parish Priest Vincenc Frhlanić and His Continuer Ivan Križmanić |journal=Kršćanska škola |date=1910–1911 |pages=23–28}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1911 Istra">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Nešto o pravnom životu hrvatskog naroda u austrijskoj Istri u 16. i 17. vijeku |language=hr |trans-title=Ought About the Legal Life of the Croatian Nation in Austrian Istria in the 16th and 17th Centuries |journal=Mjesečnik pravničkog društva za g. 1911. |date=1911 |pages=77–794}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1918">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Mjesto Boljun u Istri koncem 16. i početkom 17. vijeka |language=hr |trans-title=The Place Boljun in Istria at the End of the 16th and Beginning of the 17th Century |journal=Zbornik za narodni život i običaje |issue=XXIII |pages=215–231}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1970">{{cite book |first=Vjekoslav |last=Štefanić |title=Glagoljski rukopisi Jugoslavenske Akademije |language=hr |trans-title=Glagolitic Manuscripts of the Yugoslav Academy |volume=2 |location=Zagreb |date=1970}}</ref><ref name="Badurina 1992" />

| Grškovićev zbornik (Gršković miscellany).<ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Written by a single hand. Once belonged to a priest. Purchased for Arhiv JAZU in 1934 from Ivan Gršković parish priest of Vrbnik. Includes Glagolitic note by Vinko Premuda.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| 2 co

Formerly attached to the cover of the Vrgada christenings register.<ref name="Jurišić 1962">{{cite journal |last=Jurišić |first=Blaž |date=1949 |title=Glagoljski spomenici otoka Vrgade |trans-title=Glagolitic Monuments of the Island of Vrgada |language=hr |journal=Rad |volume=327 |pages=85–184 |editor=Petar Guberina |publisher=JAZU |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=171854}}</ref>

| breviary

|
| Vrgada (župni ured)

| 2
| 20.2 x 16.6&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Fragment Traktata o sedam smrtnih grijeha (Vrgada fragment of ''Tractate on the Seven Deadly Sins''). Text is closer to that of CIv than CKol. Formerly attached to the cover of the Vrgada christenings register.<ref name="Jurišić 1962" />

| miscellany
| CŽg
| 1500s
| VII 30
| Arhiv HAZU
| East Istria<ref name="Štefanić 1970" />
| 125
| 19.2 x 13.4&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Žgombićev zbornik (Žgombić miscellany).<ref name="Milčetić lucidar">{{cite journal |first=Ivan |last=Milčetić |title=Prilozi za literaturu hrvatskih glagolskih spomenika III. Hrvatski Lucidar |language=hr |journal=Starine |volume=XXX |pages=257–312}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Ivšić 1931">{{cite journal |first=Stjepan |last=Ivšić |title=Iz hrvatske glagoljske književnosti |language=hr |journal=Prilozi za književnosti, jezik, istoriju i folklor |volume=XI |location=Beograd |date=1931 |pages=59–82}}</ref><ref name="Ivšić 1949">{{cite journal |first=Stjepan |last=Ivšić |title=Prijevod "Lucidara" Honorija Augustodunensisa |language=hr |journal=Starine |volume=42 |location=Zagreb |date=1949 |pages=105–260}}</ref><ref name="Grabar 1967" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969 Rim">{{cite book |first=Vjekoslav |last=Štefanić |contribution=Hrvatska književnost srednjega vijeka |language=hr |title=Pet stoljeća hrvatske književnosti |volume=1 |location=Zagreb |date=1969 |pages=154–158}}</ref> Scribes: hand A f. 1-10v (later addition to codex), hand B f. 11-23v, hand C f. 24-123v. Hand A also made notes dated 1582 and 1583 on f. 124. The paper of hand B dates to the period 1547-1561, whereas the paper of hand C dates to 1519 and 1523. Hand C wrote around 1520-1530 and is the oldest in the codex. Hand A likely wrote in Mošćenice. It remained in Mošćenice in the 17th century but ended up in among the Franciscans on Krk. Codex is named after Benko Žgombić, guardian of the monastery sv. Madije Magdalene in Porta, who gave it to Milčetić. Milčetić left it in his will to Arhiv HAZU where it has been located since 1923.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Digitisation in process, previews released by [https://stin.hr/zgombicev-zbornik/ Staroslavenski Institut].<ref name="Galović 2003" /><ref name="Ceković 2020">{{cite web |first=Blanka |last=Ceković |title=Žgombićev zbornik |date=2020 |url=https://stin.hr/zgombicev-zbornik}}</ref> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|

M. |last=Evreinova |title=Статутъ острова Кръка 1380 |location=Saint Petersburg |date=1870}}</ref><ref name="Evreinova 1888">{{cite journal |first=A. M. |last=Evreinova |title=Статутъ острова Крка 1380-го года |location=Saint Petersburg |date=1888}}</ref><ref name="Črnčić and Rački 1890">{{cite book |first1=Ivan |first2=Franjo |last1=Črnčić |last2=Rački |contribution=Statut Vrbanski a donekle i svega Krčkoga otoka (god. 1362-1599) |title=Politička povjestnica |language=hr |trans-title=Political History |series=Monumenta historico-juridica Slavorum Meridionalium |volume=IV |location=Zagreb |date=1890 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=dJ5OAQAAIAAJ}}</ref><ref name="Ivan Strohal 1911">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Strohal |title=Statuti primorskih gradova i općina |location=Zagreb |date=1911}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Meyer 1928">{{cite book |first=Karl A. |last=Meyer |title=Untersuchungen zur Čakavština der Insel Krk (Veglia) |location=Leipzig |date=1928}}</ref><ref name="Žič 1937">{{cite journal |first=Nikola |last=Žič |title=O nekadašnjem suđenju na otoku Krku |journal=Napredak |location=Sarajevo |date=1937 |number=5}}</ref><ref name="Žič 1939">{{cite journal |first=Nikola |last=Žič |title=Naša stara pravda |journal=Krčki kalendar |location=Zagreb |date=1939 |pages=24–30}}</ref><ref name="Šepić 1953">{{cite journal |first=Ante |last=Šepić |title=Jezik hrvatskih općinskih statuta istarskih i primorskih |journal=Rad JAZU |location=Zagreb |date=1953 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=171813}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1960" /> Bought by NSK between 1960 and 1970 from the Petris Monastery of Krk.<ref name="Jurić 1980" /><ref name="OSU 1981" />

| Državni arhiv Zagreb
| Belgrad (Vinodol)
| 1
| 24 x 21.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| ''Popis zemljišnih posjeda kotorske, grižanske i belgradske općine u Sopaljskom polju''. First published by Šurmin, who mistook it for the 1323 original as discovered by Ivšić. There was also a Glagolitic transcription made 1635 by Ivan Mužinić, transcribed by Radoslav Lopašić, which Bratulić could not locate.<ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" /> Paper.<ref name="Kolanović 1983" />

==1600–1699==

{{collapse top|bg=#e54da5|fc=#FFFFFF|List of 17th century Glagolitic manuscripts}}

| miscellany
| CVra
| 1600 (May 13)
| III a 33 (Kuk. 4)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 216
| 19.5 x 14.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Vranićev zbornik.<ref name="Kukuljević 1869">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Kukuljević Sakcinski |title=Arkiv za povjestnicu jugoslavensku |language=hr |trans-title=Archive for Yugoslav History |volume=X |date=1869 |location=Zagreb |url=https://archive.org/details/arkiv_za_povjestnicu_jugoslavensku_knjiga_10_1869/arkiv_za_povjestnicu_jugoslavensku_knjiga_10_1869}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /> Written by a single hand with some variation. Finished 13 May 1600, written mostly or entirely that year or immediately before. Includes note by a different hand in 1632: that of Ivan Vranić of Bakar. Acquired by Kukuljević.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|

| homiliary
|
| 1600
| III b 13 (Kuk. 5)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 233
| 28 x 19.8&nbsp;cm
|
| Knjiga "Disipula". Scribe: priest Ivan Brozović of Selci in either Selci or Bribir, for lord Anton Županić. Owned by priest Ivan Kršulja of Bribir in 1682. Acquired by Kukuljević, probably in Bribir.<ref name="Kukuljević 1869-2">{{cite book |first=Ivan |last=Kukuljević Sakcinski |title=Književnici u Hrvatah iz prve polovine XVII. vieka s ove strane Velebita |volume=XVII|language=hr |location=Zagreb |date=1869}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

|-
| protocol
|
| 1601-1636
|
|
| Veli Lošinj
| 192
| 30.5 x 20.7 cm
| 1 co
| Božićević Protocol (Božićevićev protokol).<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Klen 1984" /> Scribes: Ivan Božićević, his nephew Matij Božićević, Žuvan Krstinić. The earliest date to 1593 but they are transcriptions. Acquired 1746 by notary Vintura Botterini. First noted 1791 in the chronicle of Lošinj notary Martin (Bonaventura) Botterini. At the time it was in the archive of the Botterini family.<ref name="Košuta 1988" /> Botterini's note was relayed by Lošinj historians Bonicelli and Nicolich.<ref name="Bonicelli 1869" /><ref name="Nicolich 1871" /> In 1900 it was still in Veli Lošinj (in the župni ured).<ref name="Karasek 1900" /> Milčetić was prevented from seeing it by the war.<ref name="Milčetić 1915" /> Found on Lošinj by Leo Košuta 1951, and a microfilm was made for Arhiv JAZU with sign. I/33. Photographs of pages published in Košuta 1988.<ref name="Košuta 1988" /> Used by Josip Hamm in his studies of the [[Susak]] dialect conducted from 1953 on.<ref name="Hamm et al. 1956" /><ref name="Hamm 1957 Susak" /><ref name="Hamm 1960" /> And in the dialectal studies of Eduard Hercigojna.<ref name="Hercigojna 1983a" /><ref name="Hercigojna 1983b" /> It has also been used in scholarly works on the geography and history of Lošinj.<ref name="Putanec 1962" /><ref name="Vlahović 1968" /><ref name="Stražičić 1981" />
|
|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
|
|
| 1601-1722
| HR–DAZD–359 (Obitelj Lantana collection) kut. 67 sign. 1083
| DaZd
|
| 49
|
|
| Nagodba između braće Zloić iz Ždrelca i braće Bonicelli s nacrtom terena Bonicellijevih. Latinic with some Glagolitic folia (ff. 12, 15, 18, 21, 32, 38). Part of Lantana family archive. Acquired by Državni arhiv u Zadru 1945.<ref name="Kolić 2007" /><ref name="Kolanović 2014" />

| register
|
| 1609-1727
| Glagolitica I-6
| [[Croatian State Archives]]
| [[Vranja]]
| 95
| 32.5 x 11&nbsp;cm
|
| Zapisnik primitaka i izdataka računa bratovštine oltara sv. Fabijana i Sebastijana i bratovštine sv. Fabijana i Sebastijana te sv. Duha i sv. Monike u Vranji. Matica krštenih, umrlih i vjenčanih župe Vranja u Istri. Glagolitic then Latinic and Italian. Originally part of Kukuljević library.<ref name="Kolanović 1983" /><ref name="Vlahov 1996">{{cite book |first=Dražen |last=Vlahov |title=Glagoljski rukopis iz Vranje u Istri (1609-1633) |publisher=Povijesni arhiv Pazin |series=Glagoljski rukopisi |date=1996 |issn=1331-0208}}</ref>

| law
|
| 1610 (about)
| Mažuranićeva zbirka
| Arhiv HAZU
| [[Grižane]]<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />
| 1
| 19.5 x 28&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| ''Sopaljska općina (Drivenčani, Grižanci, Belgraci i Kotorani) potvrđuje stare općinske odredbe i kazne''. Original dated 8 September 1395 in Grižane. Survives in copy around 1610 by the hand of Ivan Mužinić. First published in Šurmin 1898 in transcription by Radoslav Lopašić, with location incorrectly stated to be Novi.<ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Jelić 1906" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| br. 1338
| DaZd
| Tkon
| 188 p
| 30 x 10&nbsp;cm

| 4 bindings. 1st binding contains christenings from 3 May 1613 to 15 May 1650;<ref name="Kero 2013 Tkon">{{cite book |first1=Pavao |last1=Kero |first2=Pavao |last2=Galić |first3=Grozdana |last3=Franov Živković |first4=Marija |last4=Kero |title=Tri glagoljske matice krštenih župe sv. tome u Tkonu 1613. - 1821. |language=hr |series=Monumenta glagolitica archidioecesis Iadertinae |location=Zadar |date=2012}}</ref> 2nd binding confirmations 1618-1645; 3rd binding marriages 16 January 1612 to 20 June 1649; 4th binding deaths 13 January 1612 to 15 March 1650.<ref name="Vlasanović 1951">{{cite journal |last=Vlasanović |first=Petar |date=1951 |title=Popis glagoljskih kodeksa u zadarskoj biskupiji |trans-title=List of Glagolitic Codices in the Zadar Bishopric |language=hr |journal=Starine |volume=43 |pages=276–279 |publisher=JAZU |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=177210}}</ref><ref name="Burić and Modrinić 2014" />

|-bgcolor="MistyRose"
| christenings, marriages
|
| 1612-1614, 1630-1693
| IX 40
| Arhiv HAZU
| Labinci (sv. Nedilja, s. Domenica)
| 125
| 29.5 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| Christenings (1612-1614, 1630-1693) and marriages (1681-1692). Italian with only 2 Glaglitic entries: 20 March 1651 from one hand and on f. 55 from a hand that wrote mainly Latinic, Antonio Rossich. On textual evidence, Glagolitic was used for parish registers in Labinci until 1613, and then in 1614 the book was flipped upside down and Italian was used.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

|
| 2.III.1614-20.VI.1617
| F.V.6
| [[Biblioteca Comunale degli Intronati]]
| Vrbnik
| 160
| 23 x 17&nbsp;cm
|
| Scribe Mikula Hodanić of Vrbnik began writing on 2 March 1614 and finished on 20 June 1617. Donated to the ''Biblioteca Comunale'' of Siena by Adalbert Fortis around 1771. Leo Košuta made a microfilm in 1975, housed in the Staroslavenski institut "Svetozar Ritig" in Zagreb.<ref>Nazor, Anica. ''Još jedna glagoljska verzija legende o svetom Nikoli'', "Croatica" XVIII (1987).</ref><ref name="OSU 1981" />

| christenings, marriages, deaths, souls

| 1614-1794
| br. 807, 808
| DaZd
| Petrčane
| 539 p
| 29 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| Contains christenings 1614-1685 (pp.&nbsp;1–111), 1736-1769 (pp.&nbsp;184–259) marriages 1656-1686 (pp.&nbsp;112–143), deaths 1652-1686 (pp.&nbsp;160–183), 1691-1794 (pp.&nbsp;422–539), souls 1656-1686 (pp.&nbsp;260–331), 1689-1709 (pp.&nbsp;332–411), 1715-1719 (pp.&nbsp;412–422). 8 bindings with common pagination. Glagolitic with 1 Latinic entry and 1 Italian entry, and 1 Cyrillic note on page 63. Majuscule notes on cover.<ref name="Filipi 1951" /><ref name="Burić and Modrinić 2014" />

| miscellany
| CFat
| 1617
| IV a 124 (old IV a 141)
| [[Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts|Arhiv HAZU]]
|
| 80
| 20.7 x 15.4&nbsp;cm
|
| Fatevićev zbornik duhovnoga štiva (Fatević spiritual miscellany).<ref name="Strohal 1917" /><ref name="Strohal prilike" /><ref name="Gadžijeva et al. 2014" /> Written by a single hand: Mikula Fatević chaplain on Rava. He left a date 15 February 1617 on f. 44 and a date 1617 at the end of the book. Probably begun 1616 or early 1617. Fatević also wrote register entries 1613-1628 in Rava and Luka. Later notes in the book were written in Cyrillic by Tome Bungurov and in Glagolitic and Cyrillic by Mikula Pilicarić/Juričić of Pakoštane in 1636.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| Scribes: don Matij Fatović as chaplain (1601-1631) then parish priest (1631-1650). Found in Split seminary library in 1948 and returned to Ugljan along with 4 other codices.<ref name="Filipi 1951" /><ref name="Burić and Modrinić 2014" />

| dialogue
|
| 1623
| I b 139
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 98
| 25 x 18&nbsp;cm
|
| Dijalog Grgura pape (Martešićev). Scribe: Martin Martešić in Grižane, in script similar to the script of the 1588 ''Disipula'' (sign. VIII 126) but with differences in ''a, v, t, i''. Once part of library of doctor Nikola Gržetić from Dobrinj at least on 13 June 1901 (in Zagreb). Purchased from Gržetić by JAZU in 1905.<ref name="JAZU Ljetopis 21">{{cite journal |journal=Ljetopis Jugoslavenske akademije |language=hr |volume=21 |date=1907 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=173179}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Two photographs in Štefanić 1970.

|-
| confirmations
|
| 1624-1669
| br. 43
| Vrbnik (župni ured)
| Vrbnik
| 8
| 30.2 x 21&nbsp;cm
|
| <ref name="Štefanić 1960" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1660-1670?
| VII 42
| Arhiv HAZU
| Žman?
| 371
| 20.8 x 15&nbsp;cm
|
| Biblijska povijest. One hand for entire codex despite variations. Contains a translation from Italian of the New and Old Testaments in retold form with exerpts from Flavius Josephus. Italian original titled ''Compendio della vita di Gesù Christo''. Purchased by JAZU with Petar Karlić collection in 1950. Likely written on a Dalmatian island. Two unrelated folia found inside codex point to Žman. One has a note in Italian "Io Zuane Guerini / Adi Primo 8bre 1679 in Salle li eredi de q.m Zuane Bruncico da Zman ano sotisfato". One is undated but written in Glagolitic of the 17th-18th centuries in addition to "Alle mani di sinor Remundo Ve mando poccho bouili agnette don Bozicho Didou da Azmano Vi saluto da tuti dal uostro parlaço". Handwriting of codex matches that of don Stipan Fatović of Žman who wrote himself in two registers 13/19 September 1668 to 1679, then mostly others wrote in his name to 19 March 1684.<ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| miscellany
|
| 1625-1630
| I a 45 (Kuk. 330)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 183
| 14.7 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| Fra Antona Depope prijepisi iz Divkovićeva ''Nauka krstjanskog''.<ref name="Đorđević 1898">{{cite journal |first=Đ. S. |last=Đorđević |title=Matija Divković |language=sr |journal=Glas SRP. Kr. Akademije |volume=LIII |location=Beograd |date=1898 |pages=88–109}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /> Main scribe Franciscan friar Anton Depope born in Brzac (Dubašnica). He wrote the first half in the Porozina monastery on Cres, dated 1625, and the second half in the Glavotok monastery on Krk, dated 1630. Somewhat later hand B f. 170-177v and hand C f. 178-182v continued. Owned 1677 by fra Marko Kremenić (of Krk, priest in the Porat monastery 1683). Acquired by Kukuljević from Josip Benedikt Turčić of Dubašnica.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| Kučice-Vinišće (Viganj)

| Cyrillic except numbers of 2 years on 2 pages (f. 17r, 125r). Covers 1636 (July 15) - 1747 (December 17). Oldest parish register of Split archbishopric and only one with Glagolitic inclusions. |-
| matricula
|
| 1638-1818
| VIII 154
| Arhiv HAZU
| Sukošan
| 58
| 26.2 x 20.3&nbsp;cm
|
| Matrikula bratovštine Gospe od Karmena u Sutkošanu. Completely Glagolitic with 2 Cyrillic notes: one 1716 by priest Jerolim Vergada and one on back cover. Acquired by JAZU in February 1958 with the purchase of the Antikvarijat Poljoprivrednog nakladnog zavoda in Zagreb.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| 27 x 20&nbsp;cm

| Postila Jurja Črnića. Written by same hand as the Ljubljana copy (II C. 166) and the copy in the Sveučilišna biblioteka (R 3348). Dialect ikavo-ekavian. Given to Mije Sabljar by kanonik Juraj Čor in Bribir, who gave it to Kukuljević.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Two photographs in Štefanić 1970.

|-
| miscellany
|
| 1600s (end)
| IV a 21 (IV a 121)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 42
| 20 x 15&nbsp;cm
|
| Zbornik duhovne građe (iz Divkovića, Kašića i drugo).<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1916" /> Hand A f. 2-22 used a North Dalmatian cursive. Hand B belonged to the same school but was much younger and later, probably the middle 18th century. Manuscript once in Sukošan.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

| homiliary
|
| 1600s (end)
| IV a 140
| Arhiv HAZU
| North Dalmatia
| 124
| 21 x 14.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Zbirka propovijedi. Hand similar to that of Ivan Oštarić (who wrote IV a 98, IV a 125, IV a 136) but with notable differences. Notes at end written 1692-1693 in Lukoran on Ugljan.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Strohal prilike" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| 1623-1808
| Glagolitica 16 + 17 + 18
| [[Croatian State Archives]]
| Vrbnik
|
|
|
| Kutija 5: Notarijat Vrbnika. Includes multiple manuscripts. Divided into 1,<ref>Fragment notarske knjige vrbničkih notara Ivana i Matija Stašića (14 January 1649 - 1659)</ref> 2,<ref>Notarska knjiga Vrbnika (3 May 1657 - 12 November 1659. Index on f. 90v-91.</ref> 3,<ref>Fragment notarske knjige notara Antona Petriša iz Vrbnika (2 July 1769 - 10 February 1771), 28 folia.</ref> 4<ref>Italian language Repertorij notarskih spisa (1808-1815).</ref> 5,<ref>Italian language Repertorij notarskih spisa (1812-1813).</ref> 6,<ref>Italian language Repertorij notarskih spisa (1815-1817).</ref> 7,<ref>Index of Glagolitic Notary Book (Kazalo glagoljske notarske knjige), 2 folia.</ref> 8,<ref>Izdane isprave vrbničkih notara (1623-1795). Scribes were Andrija Tolenić (1623, 1637), Matija Stašić (1636), Ivan Stašić (1649), Matij Stašić (1660, 1662, 1664, 1689, 1696, 1697).</ref> 9.<ref>Isprave notara Ivana Družnica (17th century?) with Rodoslovlje obitelji Volarić, Bolonić, Fugošić.</ref><ref name="Kolanović 1983" />

| christenings, marriages
|
| 1667-1699
| IX 39
| Arhiv HAZU
| Kastav, Volosko
| 241
| 29.5 x 21&nbsp;cm
|
| Matica krštenih (1672-1699) i vjenčanih (1673-1699) župe Kastav i matica krštenih Voloskoga (1667-1674).<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /> Mixed Glagolitic and Latinic until the April 1678 command to stop from the bishop Bernardin Corneaneo of Pula then Latin but with Glagolitic entries continuing from parish priest Juraj Marot, Lovre Tonko and Jakov Pehanić, with the last Slavic Glagolitic entry on 17 January 1688. Unusually there was a 9 December 1696 Glagolitic entry in the Latin language.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

|-
| homiliary
|
| 1681-1684
| IV a 97
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 149
| 21 x 14.8&nbsp;cm
|
| Košćičićeva zbirka propovijedi. Scribe: Bene Košćičić/Košćić of Kukljica, a monk in the Benedictine monastery of sv. Kuzma i Damijan on Pašman (where he was later prior 1687-1703). Inherited by don Šime Koštić who made notes in 1730. Owned 1764 by don Josip Vukušić chaplain in Galovac/Galovci by Zadar. As a student Martin Košćica/Koštica brought it to Zadar where he made a note 1812. Acquired by Kukuljević.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1912 Koščić">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Hrvatski glagolski književnik Benedikt Koščić |language=hr |journal=Vienac |volume=III |date=1912 |pages=278–279}}</ref><ref name="Strohal prilike" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Strohal 1917" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| 1600s
| Osor collection IX
| Krk
| Osor
| ~350
|
|
| ''Miscellanea''. Latinic with 24 Glagolitic testimonies in the 3rd binding.<ref name="Štefanić and Košuta 1951" />
|
|-
| [[Pope Gregory I#Writings|Dialogues of Gregory]]
|
| 1600s<ref name="OSU 1981" />
| Glagolitica I-14
| [[Croatian State Archives]]
| Croatia
| 111
| 12.5 x 17.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Dialogues of Gregory (Dijalog Grgura pape Fanfonjin). The Glagolitic "Dialogues of Gregory" are not to be confused with the true [[Dialogues (Pope Gregory I)|Dialogues of Gregory]]. It actually contains treatises of Christian dogma and morals. The characters are not Gregorius and Petrus, but Teacher and Master. Once in Vrbnik. Purchesed 1911 by State Archives from Fanfoni family in Trogir.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915">{{cite book |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Hrvatska glagolska knjiga |date=1915}}</ref><ref name="Fučić 1960">{{cite journal |first=Branko |last=Fučić |title=Gospodin v Kožlaki |language=hr |journal=Bulletin Odjela VII. Za Likovne Umjetnosti JAZU |issue=VIII |date=1960}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Kolanović 1983" />
|

|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
| miscellany
|
| 1600s/1700s
| IV a 141 (IV a 153)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 53
| 19.4 x 14&nbsp;cm
|
| Bilanovićev zbornik.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Fancev 1928" >{{cite journal |first=Franjo |last=Fancev |title=Novi prilozi za povijest hrvatske crkvene drame |language=hr |journal=Nast. Vjesnik |volume=XXXVI |location=Zagreb |date=1928 |pages=1–20}}</ref> Latinic to f. 27v then Glagolitic. Scribes: Latinic by Miho Bilanović in Zadar around 1661, hand A f. 29-37, 38v-39, 51-48v (upside down pages), hand B f. 48-46, hand C f. 45-42v, 41-40. Glagolitic parts likely written after 1661, with hand A probably still in the 17th century but hands B and C in the 18th century. To the 18th century also belong some later notes by students in the Benedictine monastery sv. Kuzme i Damjana in Tkon (by Ive "Huhiha", a childish farce by the scribe). Manuscript once in Zemunik.</ref> Ćulina Pere Meštrić).<ref name="Štefanić 1970" />
|
|-
| prayer book
|
| 1600s/1700s
| III a 1 (Kuk. 502)
| Arhiv HAZU
| Vrbnik?, Draga Bašćanska?, Porat
| 113
| 11.2 x 8.3&nbsp;cm
|
| Prayer book of brother Ivan Čeperić (Molitvenik fra Ivana Čeperića). Scribes: 3 anonymous hands (A f. 9v-11 youngest; B f. 20-25v, 67-74b, 83-88, 99-100 similar to A; C f. 26-65 oldest) in Glagolitic and Latinic by Ivan Čeperić f. 1-3. Hand C wrote in Vrbnik dialect. Hands A and B probably from Draga Bašćanska. Includes notes on f. 113v and the back cover as well as 2 loose leaves of paper. Ivan Čeperić was born in Draga Bašćanska and became a Franciscan 1739 in Dubašnica (Porta). One of the free leaves mentioned fra Gašpar of Glavotok (possibly Gašpar Milčetić guardian of Dubašnica mentioned 1683 and 1705). Acquired by Kukuljević from Josip Benedikt Turlić of Dubašnica who found it there.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Galović 2003" />
|
|-
| prayer book
|
| 1600s/1700s
| IV a 80/50
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 2
| 18.5 x 13.8&nbsp;cm
|
| Odlomci molitava. Written in štokavskoikavski. Written by an educated scribe, possibly Jesuit.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| Sabljićev zbornik (Sabljić miscellany). By a certain Sabljić. It was located in the archive of the Franciscan monastery of the third order in Zadar, and then taken to the archive of the Franciscan monastery of the third order of Saint Francis Xavier in Zagreb, but it has not been seen since then as of 2003.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1960"/><ref name="Galović 2003" />

| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://www.dazd.hr/hr/pregled/invbr1040/invbr1040sestrunjmkm1700-1802 DaZd], [https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/3:1:3QSQ-G99X-XGV6 FS]

| legal
|
| 1700 (about)
|
| Bogović (dubašljanski župni arhiv)
| Krk (town)
| 1
| 27 x 29&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Po zapovijedi kneza Ivana VII. Frankapana određuju se granice posjeda crkve Sv. Andrije u Dubašnici koje je knez Ivan daje na upravu nekom Juriću uz obvezu godišnjih podavanja.<ref name="Milčetić 1884" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Original dated 11 April 1454 lost. Survives in transcription from about 1700, possibly a translation from Italian according to Ivšić. An Italian translation does exist, dated 1717.<ref name="Galović 2003" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| notes
|
| 1707-1829
|
| Vrgada (župni ured)
| Vrgada
|
|
|
| Inside a copy of the 1707 ''Misse za umervšie'' there are several Glagolitic notes. Parish priest Martin Mihić wrote a Latinic note of purchase in 1829 from Šime Jurin. The surname Jurin is synonymous with Krpetić, a family from which several priests came on Vrgada.<ref name="Jurišić 1962" />

| homiliary
|
| 1707?-
| Ante Marija Strgačić collection (HR–DAZD–373)
| DaZd
| Brbinj
| 86 p
| 20.3 x 14.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Propovijedi popa Antona Šegote, parohijana brbinjskoga. Two joined notebooks bound in a fragment of a Glagolitic missal from the 14th-15th century written in 2 columns of 31 rows. Scribe: Anton Šegota (župnik in Brbinj 1708-1724, 1762-1763). Found in house of Ivan Bubica Zelenko in Luka. Acquired by Ante Marija Strgačić.<ref name="Strgačić 1951" /><ref name="Ivančev 1995">{{cite book |first=Ante |last=Ivančev |contribution=Svećenici glagoljaši Brbinjci i župnici Brbinja |language=hr |title=Brbinj kroz povijest |pages=23–38 |date=1995 |location=Brbinj}}</ref><ref name="Mijoč 2016">{{cite book |first=Marina |last=Mijoč |title=Jezične značajke glagoljskoh rukopisa "Propovijedi popa Antona Šegote": prilog istraživanju rukopisne ostavštine Ante Marije Strgačića |location=Rijeka |date=2016 |url=https://urn.nsk.hr/urn:nbn:hr:186:119960}}</ref>

| matricula

| Zavičajni muzej u Biogradu
| Polača
|
|

| Madrikula bratovštine ss. Kuzme i Damjana u Polači. Brotherhood founded 11 January 1711. Glagolitic and Latinic. |
|
| 1715
| I a 34
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 229
| 14.5 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| Priručnik moralne teologije (skripta) Barića Mandića. Scribes: one hand f. 2-57, the varied hand of Barić Mandić of Baška (1693-1762) everything else. Note on f. 299v not by either hand. Mandić wrote it studying under Ivan Tomašić in Krk in 1715.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Strohal 1916" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
| matricula
|
| 1717-1807, 1857, 1857
|
| Kali (župni ured)
| Kali
| 126 p
| 29.2 x 21.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Madrikula sv. Križa. Glagolitic to 1807 when brotherhood abolished under Napoleon, then Latin from 1857 when reestablished. One of the last manuscripts with Glagolitic to be in use for records.<ref name="Cvitanović 1949" /><ref name="Kero 2015" />

| Christenings (1723-1756), deaths (1719-1756), marriages (1720-1757), confirmations (1735-1753). Parish priests Ivan Uravić (1719-1732) and Ivan Baldigare (1732-1757).<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| 8

| Oficij B. D. Marije Karmelske. Scribe: Ivan Uravić parish priest of Dobrinj, who translated it as well, from a Latin breviary printed 1695 or 1694. He also wrote IV a 44.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| II c 19 (Kuk. VII)
| Arhiv HAZU
| Baška
| 26
| 29 x 10.5&nbsp;cm
