|
|-
| register
|
| 1722-1726
| Fragm. glag. 131
| Arhiv HAZU
| Dobrinj
|
|
|
| Fragments removed in 1960 from the Dobrinj register of 1560-1566 (sign. IX 10), dating to the 18th century but some specifically 1722-1726. They include (1) a 19.5 x 7.5&nbsp;cm fragment (2) a 20 x 29.5&nbsp;cm fragment 1722-1726 (3) a 20.3 x 28.5&nbsp;cm bifolium from the same period (4) a 20.3 x 15&nbsp;cm folio (5 and 6) very small fragments from the same period (7) a 14 x 20.5&nbsp;cm fragment (8) 2 strips of a folio 21 x 14&nbsp;cm. There are also 21 small pieces of paper 3 x 19&nbsp;cm on which the confirmations were written (''buletini'') before being entered into the parish registers, which is notable because very few of these survive.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" />
|
|-
| breviary
|
| 1722?
| IV a 44
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 40
| 20 x 14.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Novi oficij - dodatak brevijaru. Largely ikavian. Scribe: Ivan Uravić parish priest of Dobrinj, matching IV a 46 which was written 1721.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
| cure and curse book
|
| -1723
| R 3372 (St. sign. SM.32.F.24)
| [[National and University Library in Zagreb|NSK]]
| Poljica
| 24
| 14.1 x 10.3&nbsp;cm
| 1 co

|
|
| 1724-1725
| IV a 121 (IV a 152)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 613
| 18.5 x 14&nbsp;cm
|
| Kuzmićev zbornik crkvenih govora i kršćanskog nauka. Scribe: fra Marko Kuzmić. He wrote the first part 1724-1725 in the monastery sv. Ivan in Zadar and the second half 1725 on Školjić (the islet Galevac by Zadar). Intended for the press but unfinished. Still in Sutomišćica on Ugljan in the 18th century.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Strohal prilike" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
| christenings
|
| 1728-1775
| VIII 200
| Arhiv HAZU
| Montrilj
| 45 (I), 26 (II)
| 28.3 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| Mostly Glagolitic (by priests Anton Milohnić and Ivan Lesica). Transition to only Italian in 1762 with final Glagolitic entry 11 February 1762. These Glagolitic scribes priests bore surnames characteristic of Krk, explaining the use of Glagolitic in Istria after its extermination from everywhere but monasteries.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

| Arhiv Zadarske nadbiskupije
| Veli Iž
| 144 p
| 31.1 x 10.5&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Madrikula sv. Duha.<ref name="Cvitanović 1949" /><ref name="Kero 2015" />
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://glagolab.unizd.hr/?pr=i&id=13972 GUZ], [https://pisanabastina.unizd.hr/?kr=i&id=14006 PB]
|-
|
|
| 1729-1730
| VII 114
| Arhiv HAZU
| Baška
| 38
| 14 x 9.7&nbsp;cm
|
| Kršćanski nauk (priolov). Translation of the ''Dottrina'' of Lorenzo Priol. Written by several hands including one hand A f. 1-26v. Hand A was a certain priest Bar<nowiki>[tol]</nowiki> whose language matches Baška. Acquired by Vjekoslav Štefanić together with VII 115 in Draga Bašćanska in the house of Juraj Derenčinović who had inherited it from his father. Given by Štefanić to Arhiv JAZU in 1958.<ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
| song
|
| 1729
| IV a 75 (IV a 66)
| Arhiv HAZU
| Zadar archipelago
| 10
| 19.7 x 15&nbsp;cm
|
| Mrtvačke "Šekvencije". Written on an island of the Zadar archipelago. Possibly in Sali. Possibly part of the Berčić collection.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

|-
| miscellany
| CGrd
| 1700s (beginning)
| I d 40 (Kuk. 748)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 769
| 45 x 34&nbsp;cm
|
| Grdovićev zbornik. Written entirely by Ive Grdović. One of the largest Glagoitic manuscripts. Acquired by Kukuljević 1857 in Zadar. Kukuljević wrote it was written in island dialect in Poljana by Zadar and was revered by the  Glagolitic priests of the region to the extent they made pilgrimages to it.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Strohal Grdovićev">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |journal=Vjesnik Zemaljskog Arhiva |volume=XVII |language=hr |date=1915 |page=350}}</ref><ref name="Kukuljević 1857" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| memorials for deceased brothers

| 1734-1769
|
| Monastery of Saint Mary Magdalene in Porat, Krk
| Dubašnica, Krk
| 78
| 28.5 x 10.3&nbsp;cm
|
| Knjiga zadušnica za umrlu braću.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="Galović 2003" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1734, 1749, 1767, 1785
| kutija 8
| HDA
| Vrbnik
|
|
|
| Kutija 8. Contains (1) Dvije notarske isprave iz Omišlja i Miholjice (1734. i 1767), (2) Fragment notarske knjige iz Dobrinja (1749) i jedna notarska isprava (1785), (3) Registar notarske knjige iz Dubašnice, (4) Italian language Notarska knjiga Krka (1692-1693).<ref>Unclear from Kolanović 1983 if kutija 6 i 7 which have "Croatian" texts have any texts in Glagolitic. They were written in the 17th to 19th centuries.</ref><ref name="Kolanović 1983" /><ref name="Galović 2003" />
|
|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
| christenings, confirmations, marriages, deaths
|
| 1735-1832
| IX 31
| Arhiv HAZU
| Punat
| 190
| 31.6 x 21.6&nbsp;cm
|
| Christenings (1735-1805, 1812-1829), marriages (1735-1832), deaths (1794-1832), confirmations (1735-1831). Glagolitic to 1793 then Latinic.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

| miscellany
| CHrž
| 1735-1740
| VII 34
| Arhiv HAZU
| Dubašnica (samostan sv. Mandalene)
| 103
| 19.2 x 14.3&nbsp;cm
|
| Hržić miscellany (Hržićev zbornik). Scribe: Šimun Hržić. Includes notes. Remained in the monastery it was written in until 1882 when the gvardijan Benko Žgombić gave it to Ivan Milčetić.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Galović 2003" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| 1740
| Glagolitica I-13
| [[Croatian State Archives]]
| [[Ugljan]] (island), Dubašnica
| 14
| 14.5 x 9.5&nbsp;cm

| Ištoriě od dvih žen uglěnskih. Purchased by HDA from Antun Masanec. Before that part of Branko Vodnik collection, in turn an acquisition from the Milčetić collection. | homiliary
|
| 1743? - before 1770
|
| Olib (župni arhiv)
| Olib
|
| 28.6 x 21&nbsp;cm
|
| Script is that of Šime Radov Olibljanin, chaplain in Olib 1743-1777. Likely written before 1770. Contains 32 homilies, likely not his own.<ref name="Cvitanović 1957" />

| christenings
|
| 1743-1805
| br. 692
| Državni arhiv Zadar
| Olib
| 200 p
| 31 x 21.8&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Glagolitic to 1797, sporadically to 1800, then Latinic.<ref name="Cvitanović 1957" /><ref name="Kero 2012">{{cite book |first1=Pavao |last1=Kero |first2=Pavao |last2=Galić |first3=Grozdana |last3=Franov Živković |first4=Marija |last4=Kero |title=Glagoljska matica krštenih župe Uznesenja BDM na Olibu 1743. - 1805. |language=hr |series=Monumenta glagolitica archidioecesis Iadertinae |location=Zadar |date=2012}}</ref><ref name="Burić and Modrinić 2014" />

| Arhiv Zadarske nadbiskupije
| Ugljan (town)
| 26 p
| 42.2 x 14.7&nbsp;cm
|
| Glagoljski godovnjak. Glagolitic to 1839 then Latinic. Begun by parish priest Jure Svorcina, continued by others. Found 1942 by D. P. Vlasanović in Tkon and returned to Ugljan.<ref name="Filipi 1951" /><ref name="Kero 2015" />

|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
| ritual
|
| 1745-1750 (about)
| III a 8
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 20
| 14.5 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| Evanđelja i molitve o užašću. Glagolitic with Latinic table at end. Glagolitic part written by Frane Tancabelić, who also wrote the ''Polica od osmarije'' in Baška to 1741 (II c 19). Tancabelić became curate in Sveta Fuska (Linardići) near Krk. Language with ikavisms and some cakavism. Includes notes on f. 1.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|

|-
| protocols
|
| 1745-1818
| Glagolitica 10 + 11 + 12 + 13 + 14 + 15 + 16
| [[Croatian State Archives]]
| Dubašnica
|
|
|
| Koncepti notarski protokola Dubašnice. Kutija 1, omot 1-10+11-22+21-22 contains 22 concepts: Notarski koncepti Jurja i Ivana Sormilića (3 June 1745 - 21 September 1770). Kutija 2, omot 1-9+9-20-20-21 contains 19 concepts: Notarski koncepti Ivana Sormilića, in addition to ''Razne izane isprave u razdoblju 1767-1791. godine'' and ''Koncepti notarskih zapisa u Dubašnici i Omišlju 1771-1772''. Kutija 3, omot 1-8+8-20+20-21 contains 21 concepts: Notarski koncepti većinom Pavla Sormilića (21 November 1793 - 1 January 1818).<ref name="Kolanović 1983" /><ref name="Galović 2003" />

| Zbirka propovijedi don Ante Škifića. Scribe: Ante Škifić (main scribe) who began to write it in 1744. Probably on Dugi otok, possibly the same Ante Škifić who was the keeper of the parish register u Savru on Dugi.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| Arhiv HAZU
| Šibenik area?
| 10
| 28 x 20.3&nbsp;cm
|
| Čudesa koja su se dogodila onim ki se nisu pravo ispovidali. The Štokavskoikavski dialect may point to an origin in the Šibenik area.<ref name="Strohal 1909">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |journal=Školski vjesnik |location=Sarajevo |date=1909 |pages=904–913}}</ref><ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| calendar
|
| 1700s (first half)
| br. 13
| Krk (arhiv samostana trećoredaca)
| Krk
| 39
| 20 x 14&nbsp;cm
|
| Liturgijski kalendar-direktorij "žunta". Somewhat older than 1752.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1700s (second quarter)
| VII 115
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 69
| 14 x 19.8&nbsp;cm
|
| Kršćanski nauk (Priolov). Scribes: hamd A f. 1-14 (possibly more than one person), hand B f. 17, 27-29, 30v-41, 42v-47v, hand C f. 17v-26v, 29v-30, 31v-42, 48-67v, hand D 68v-69v. The name of the scribe of hand D was Matij according to his note on f. 4. Hand B writes in the dialect of Vrbnik (or maybe Omišalj). Hand C may have been from Baška on dialectal evidence, which also places hand A in Draga Bašćanska where the manuscript was found. The work may have been the collective work of the clerical school in Krk (town). Acquired by Štefanić who gave it to Arhiv JAZU in 1958.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1750 (before)
| VII 111
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 19
| 14.3 x 9.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Zaklinjanje protiv nevremena i Večernja za mrtve. Scribes: hand A wrote f. 1-16v likely a little before 1750, then by 1750 the book was in the hands of hand B (possibly Mikula Tomašić) who wrote the Večernja za mrtve. Already 1753 it was owned by Frane Frančić who was the desetinar in Baška 1777. Acquired by Vjekoslav Štefanić 1929 in the house of Jure Derenčinović in Draga Bašćanska, donated by him to JAZU in 1958 together with several other manuscripts.<ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|

| Kvateran skule gospe Luzarija i gospe Karmena. Glagolitic to 1791 then Latinic. Includes 1 page 20 x 15&nbsp;cm from a separate lost codex.<ref name="Cvitanović 1957" /><ref name="Kero 2015" />

|
| 1752-1857
| VIII 164
| Arhiv HAZU
| Draga Bašćanska
| 118
| 28 x 18.8&nbsp;cm
|
| Knjiga bratovštine "od duš od prkatorija" Drage Bašćanske. Glagolitic to 1807 then Latinic.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
|
|
| 1752-1753
| III a 13 (Kuk. 337)
| Arhiv HAZU
| Koper
| 99
| 17.2 x 10.7&nbsp;cm
|
| Žunta za govoriti oficij. Scribe: Dominik Zec. After the closure of the Franciscan monastery in Koper in 1806 it was brought to Krk by a monk. Includes several notes by a later hand in Latinic and Glagolitic by Mate Linardić (i.e. Latinic on f. 91). So specifically brought to the monastery in Dubašnica. Acquired by Kukuljević on Krk from Petar Bogović.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1912">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Fra Dumenigo Zec |journal=Prosvjeta |volume=XX |location=Zagreb |date=1912 |language=hr |pages=1012}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1912 Javor">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Fra Dumenigo Zec |journal=Javor |date=1912 |pages=173–176}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| 1754
| VII 22
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 26
| 14.3 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| "Činь umrvšimь". Uses Karaman orthography. Latin note 15 October 1754 shows the manuscript was intended for the press. Acquired by JAZU with Milčetić remains in 1948. Acquired by Milčetić on Krk. Milčetić acquired it from Vinko Premuda.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| deaths
|
| 1761-1833
|
| Arhiv Zadarske nadbiskupije
| Vrgada
| 112 p
| 28 x 10.4&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Glagolitic to 1811 then Latinic from 1812. Deaths from 23 October 1761 to 14 October 1777 discovered first, previously placed inside christenings register. In 1959 the rest was found. Parish priest was Martin Mihić during the tansition to Latinic.<ref name="Jurišić 1962" /><ref name="Franov-Živković 2013" /><ref name="Franov-Živković 2015 brak" /><ref name="Kero 2015" />

| Dižmarska knjiga bašćanskog kapitula. Scribe mainly priest Miho Čubranić of Jurandvor. First noticed by Štefanić 1934 in the archive of the župni ured in Draga Bašćanska, transferred 1948 to JAZU together with Premuda library.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

| 10

| Neki franjevački obredi. Scribe: fra Mikula Milohnić on Krk. Glagolitic with Latinic on f. 6-8 by a different hand in 1828, not by Vicenc Hrabrić of Baška who did own it (and also owned VII 21 as a deacon in 1808). Acquired by Milčetić in Baška. | Bratovštine Kotara Duha Svetoga 1764-1850. | Knez Ivan VII Frankapan potvrđuje da je Omišljanima prodao livadu i pasište Rt.<ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Milčetić 1884">{{cite journal |first=Ivan |last=Milčetić |title=Arkeologično-istorične crtice s hrvatskih otoka |date=1884 |journal=Vjesnik Hrvatskog arkeološkog društva |issue=VI |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=2cnVzfAnYXgC}}</ref> Original dated 29 October 1453, lost. | IV a 108 (Kuk. XIXb 471)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 11
| 19 x 12&nbsp;cm
|
| Oficij od sedam žalosti i pjesma o tri kralja. Scribe Franciscan, likely Pavao Livić. Includes note of ownership by Andrija Grubelić of Prvić (by Šibenik) on 20 May 1775 who still owned it 15 May 1786. Later brought to Franciscan monastery in Krk. Acquired by Kukuljević in the monastir fratarah male bratje u gradu Krku.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1916">{{cite book |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Zbirka starih hrvatskih hrvatskih pjesama |language=hr |location=Zagreb |date=1916}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| Kvateran Bratovštine Gospe od Luzarija. Glagolitic to 1821 then Latinic.<ref name="Cvitanović 1949" /><ref name="Franov-Živković 2010 Preko">{{cite journal |first=Grozdana |last=Franov-Živković |title=Bratovštine (skule) župe Blažene Gospe od Luzarija u Preku na otoku Ugljanu u 18. i 19. stoljeću |language=hr |journal=Radovi Zavoda Za Povijesne Znanosti HAZU U Zadru |issue=52 |date=2010 |pages=231–259}}</ref><ref name="Kero 2015" />

|-
|
|
| 1778-1827
| IV a 80/10
| Arhiv HAZU
| Sali
| 34
| 20 x 14.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Bilježnica Mate Šimoncina Puhova. Glagolitic with some Latinic but Glagolitic to the end. Scribes: Mate Šimoncin and Mate Puhov, though the two could be the same person. A rare example of a manuscript written by a literate villager along with IV a 80/41 and IV a 80/17. Acquired by Ivan Berčić.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

| rule
|
| 1700s (middle)
| III a 22 (Kuk. 350)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 28
| 20 x 14.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Konstitucije Franjevaca III reda. Scribe: Aguštin Keršić. Translated from the Roman printed edition of 1734 by fra Ivan Krizostom Keršić Cresanin made in December 1734. This is a copy of that by Aguštin Keršić made much later. Given by Roman Gršković of Porta to Kukuljević.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1913 Serafinski">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Konstitucioni fratrov tretoga reda iz 1734 |language=hr |trans-title=Constintutions of the Brothers of the Third Order from 1734 |journal=Serafinski Perivoj |location=Sarajevo |date=1913}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Galović 2003" />

|
|
| 1700s (middle)
| inv. br. 18
| Poljica (župni ured)
| Poljica
| 20
| 26 x 9.7&nbsp;cm
|
| Evidencija vječnih obaveza poljičkog klera. Dated to middle 18th century despite "1682" on f. 4 on palaeographic grounds and evidence of "1734" and "1748" on f. 8. Earlier date taken as transcribed.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

| Računi bratovštine duša od čistilišta. Glagolitic with sporadic Latinic and Italian.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

| Kvateran Župe svetog Ante.<ref name="Kero 2015" /><ref name="Franov-Živković and Kero 2013 Radošinovci">{{cite book |last1=Franov-Živković |last2=Kero |first1=Grozdana |first2=Pavao |first3=Pavao |last3=Galić |first4=Marija |last4=Kero |title=Glagoljski kvateran župe Sv. Antuna Padovanskog i ostalih glagoljskih vrela od kraja 17. do početka 19. stoljeća |language=hr |journal=Radovi Zavoda Za Povijesne Znanosti HAZU U Zadru |issue=60 |date=2018 |volume=60 |pages=213–219 |doi=10.21857/y54jofprkm |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/index.php?show=clanak&id_clanak_jezik=308520}}</ref>

| chronicle
|
| 1785-1846
|
| Samostan sv. Mihovila na Zaglavu
| Zadar, Zaglav
| 95 p
| 23.8 x 15.8&nbsp;cm
|
| Knjiga godova župe Zaglav. Begins March 1785 but with a transcription of an older book by brother Bonaventura Dragozetić Cresanin living in Zadar at the time. The older book began 1 September 1660. Glagolitic to 1826 then Latinic, with Latinic 1814 for the Zaglav christening register 1814-1840.<ref name="Strgačić 1951" />

| 1796-1830
| Glagolitica 16
| [[Croatian State Archives]]
| Dubašnica, Krk (town)
|
|
|
| Kutija 4: Notarski zapisi Dubašnice i Krka. Includes Glagolitic and Latinic. Contains (1) Notarski zapisi na talijanskom jeziku (1796-1823), (2) Notarska knjiga notara Jure Milčetića, pisana hrvatski latinicom (3 February 1804 - 15 February 1808) with f. 48, (3) Notarski spisi na talijanskom s izvornim popisom (1775-1830).

| legal
|
| 1700s
| Glagolitica II-1
| HDA
| Krk<ref>Modruš according to Šurmin, rejected by Ivšić.</ref>
|
|
|
| Knez Ivan VIII. Frankapan daje u patronat svom upravitelju i činovniku (faturu) Marinu Gujašiću crkvu Sv. Ivana na Sužanu kod Omišlja. Original dated 15 August 1464.<ref name="Kolanović 1983" /><ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Strohal 1910" /> Survives only in Glagolitic transcription together with transcriptions of documents from 10 November 1465 (Demarcation by [[Ivan VII Frankopan|Ivan Frankopan]] of Vlach lands of {{interlanguage link|Kras, Krk|lt=Kras|hr|Kras (Dobrinj)}}) and August 1468 (Knez Ivan Frankapan zabranjuje vlahom oko Omišlja). This was a translation from the Italian translation of P. Petriš.<ref name="Kolanović 1983" /><ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| Dugi otok

| 20.6 x 14.2&nbsp;cm

|-
|
|
| 1700s
| br. 15
| Vrbnik (župni ured)
| Vrbnik
| 7+24
| 28 x 19&nbsp;cm, 28.5 x 19.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Spisi vrbničkog klera. A fascicle with two bindings. The first includes copies from earlier but begins 14 July 1721. The second is Italian and Latinic from 1809 because Vrbnik priests had switched to writing their native language mainly in Latinic by then.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />
|
|-
| prayer book
|
| 1700s
| VII 162
| Arhiv HAZU
| Baška?
| 18
| 16 x 11&nbsp;cm
|
| Molitvenik. Cakavisms may point to an origin in Baška, as with Tomašićev molitvenik (sign. VII 161). Acquired by JAZU in 1959 through Gršković collection.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
| miscellany
| CDor
| 1700s
| VII 113
| Arhiv HAZU
| Baška
| 58
| 13.3 x 5.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Priručnik Mika Dorčića. Scribe: Miko Dorčić of Baška. A younger hand wrote in the empty pages in the first half of the 19th century. Miko Dorčić also wrote the 1734 Kršćanski nauk (sign. R 3369). He died in Baška 1772. Manuscript discovered 1928 in a villager's house in Draga Bašćanska by Štefanić, who donated it to Arhiv JAZU 1958.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" />
|

| masses served
|
| 1700s
| IV a 80/52
| Arhiv HAZU
| Veli Iž
| 1
| 16 x 14&nbsp;cm
|
| Polica izrečenih misa.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" />
|
|-
| prayer book
|
| 1700s
| IV a 79
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 37
| 18.2 x 14&nbsp;cm
|
| Molitveni zbornik (šekvencije). Main hand is of don Anton Vodopija (parish priest in Sali in 1710). Two other hands wrote in it not long after 1724. Later it was owned by student Vid Grbin of Sali (later parish register scribe in Žman 1769-1770) who wrote on f. 37v. Given to possibly Berčić by a certain Petešić in 1866. Entered Arhiv JAZU in 1894 with Berčić archive.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1700s
| I a 99
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 29
| 14 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| Dio teološkog priručnika (O ženidbi i drugo). Scribe same as sign. III a 7 and I a 34, so Barić Mandić of Baška.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1700s
| VII 52
| Arhiv HAZU
| Baška
| 9
| 14.3 x 10&nbsp;cm
|

| 1700s
| IV a 130
| Arhiv HAZU
| Iž (island)
| 16
| 21 x 15&nbsp;cm
|
| Priručnik za ispovjednika. The parish priests' surnames help localise it. Acquired 1854 from Veli Iž.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| 1700s
| IV a 80/24
| Arhiv HAZU
| North Dalmatia
| 1
| 27.3 x 19.2&nbsp;cm
|
| <ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1700s
| IV b 14 (Kuk. 1023)
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 4 (I), 2 (II), 10 (III)
| 22 x 15&nbsp;cm, 21 x 14.5&nbsp;cm, 21 x 16.7&nbsp;cm
|
| ''Miscellanea.'' Document I written by same hand as IV a 108 (from 1775), containing Krnja legenda o sv. Roku. Document II is a bifolium for the Great Week. Document III is a Latinic transcription from Glagolitic by Jakov Volčić in Veprinac on 19 September 1854.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

| Draga Bašćanska

| Blagoslovi i zakletve (egzorcizmi). Discovered by Ivan Koštal in (Slovene) Gorica, today lost.<ref name="Koštial 1914">{{cite journal |first=Ivan |last=Koštial |title=Čakavska "Duhovna bramba" iz Bašćanske Drage |language=hr |trans-title=Chakavian "Duhovna bramba" from the Baška Valley |journal=Vjesnik Staroslavenske Akademije |volume=II |location=Krk |date=1914 |pages=68–71 |url=https://archive.org/details/vjesnikstaroslav02star}}</ref><ref name="Strohal 1928">{{cite journal |first=Rudolf |last=Strohal |title=Priručna knjiga "Duhovna obrana" u hrv. glagolskoj knjizi |trans-title=Manual "Duhovna obrana" in Croatian Glagolitic Books |journal=Zbornik za narodni život i običaje |volume=XXVI |location=Zagreb |date=1928 |pages=342–346 |url=https://dizbi.hazu.hr/a/?pr=i&id=177830}}</ref><ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

| Omišalj (župni ured)
| Omišalj
| 48
|
|
| Akti procesa između omišaljske općine i bratovštine sv. Marije velike. Includes transcriptions of older legal acts. Glagolitic and Italian.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

| homily
|
| 1700s
| IV a 135
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 4
| 19.5 x 13.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Propovijed za mladu misu. Written in Dalmatia, maybe from the environs of Zadar.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| homiliary
|
| 1700s
| Fragm. glag. 116
| Arhiv HAZU
| Kvarner
| 10
| 20 x 14.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Odlomci crkvenih propovijedi. Written on a Kvarner island.<ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1700s
| Fragm. glag. 126
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 1
| 21.5 x 15.3&nbsp;cm
|
| Najava blagdana i nedjeljna pobožnost. Written in one of the following years: 1750, 1761, 1767, 1778, 1789, 1795. Written shortly before September 20. Acquired by JAZU in 1959 with the Gršković library.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" />
|

|
|
| 1700s
| IV a 80/38
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 4
| 20.2 x 14.3&nbsp;cm
|
| Djelo vjere, ufanja i skrušenja. Štokavskoikavski dialect.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

| exorcism
|
| 1700s
| IV a 134
| Arhiv HAZU
| North Dalmatia
| 6
| 20 x 14&nbsp;cm
|
| Exorcism against wherewolves (Egzorcizam protiv vukodlaka). Possibly came to JAZU through Berčić remains.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Strohal 1910 egzorcizmi" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> Two photographs in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
| curses
|
| 1700s
| VII 21
| Arhiv HAZU
| Baška
| 62
| 14.3 x 10.4&nbsp;cm
|
| Zaklinjanje protiv nevremena. Scribe: Mate Hrabrić f. 1-43v, a different hand 44-55v and 58-60v and possibly 56v-57. Includes language from Kašićev Ritual Rimski. Mate Hrabrić mentioned in a list 1782. Acquired by Ivan Milčetić, who loaned or gave it to Vinko Premuda. Entered JAZU upon the death of Premuda.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| breviary
|
| 1700s
| VII 58
| Arhiv HAZU
| Baška
| 10
| 19 x 13&nbsp;cm
|
| Oficij slavnoga okupitelja. Language matches Baška. Text follows that of the Latin language Venetian ''Breviarium Romanum'' of 1757, connecting the manuscript with the Franciscan monasteries. Acquired by JAZU in 1948 with the remains of Vinko Premuda of Baška.<ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| dialogue
|
| 1700s (second half)
| VII 120
| Arhiv HAZU
| Krk (island)
| 30
| 19.7 x 14&nbsp;cm
|
| Razgovaranje o ljudskim djelima. Scribe likely from Vrbnik on dialectological grounds. Acquired by Štefanić on Krk. Štefanić gave it to Arhiv JAZU in 1958.<ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1700s (second half)
| IV a 73 (IV a 86)
| Arhiv HAZU
| North Dalmatia
| 6
| 19.5 x 14.2&nbsp;cm
|
| "Pištula gospodina našega Isukrsta". Dated to after 1740-1750 on watermark grounds. Štokavskoikavski used but with čakavisms. Paper. Manuscript history unknown before JAZU.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1700s (second half)
| IV a 81 (IV a 122)
| Arhiv HAZU
| Sali?
| 44
| 19.7 x 14.2&nbsp;cm
|
| Priručnik moralne teologije. Scribes: hand A f. 1-2v, hand B f. 3-22v and 25-42, hand C on f. 13, f. 22v-24, f. 44v. Hand C is similar to hand B but with major differences. Language is štokavskoikavski throughout. Written after the end of the reign of pope Benedict XIV in 1758. Certainly written in the territory of the Zadar archbishopric, possibly in Sali. Purchased by Ivan Berčić in 1848 from the Arbanasi parish priest. Acquired by JAZU with Berčić library<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.
|
|-
|
|
| 1700s (second half)
| VII 121
| Arhiv HAZU
| Vrbnik
| 65
| 17 x 14.4&nbsp;cm
|
| Dvije moralističke rasprave. Written by 6 alternating hands of the same school: hand A f. 2-9 and f. 14, hand B f. 9v and f. 55, hand C f. 9v-13, f. 15-23, hand D f. 23-35, hand E f. 36v-38v, hand F f. 39-40. All young clerics from Vrbnik. Written not long after the composition of the text during the papacy of Benedikt XIV (1740-1758). In 1757 the book belonged to Ivan Volarić (dižmar of Vrbnik 1765-1766) and the next note is from 1764. Acquired by Štefanić on Krk many years before 1969 and donated by him to JAZU in 1958.<ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1700s (second half)
| IV a 93
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 32
| 21.3 x 14.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Kršćanski nauk iz moralke. Written by 1797. Acquired by Ante Rančić parish priest of Brbinj in 1793. Anton Petrov of Brbinj was an owner just before Ante Rančić. Acquired by Berčić in Brbinj in 1851.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />
|

|
| 1700s (second half)

| Gradska knjižnica in Zagreb
| Dubašnica
| 15
|
|
| Liturgijski direktorij s dodacima oficija. Translated from Latin by Bare Kraljić of Sv. Anton in Dubašnica. Acquired by Josip Brunšmid (died 1929)<ref name="Strohal 1915" /><ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="Galović 2003" /><ref name="OSU 1981" />

|-
| legal
|
| 1700s (second half)
|
| Dobrinj (župni arhiv)
| Dobrinj
|
|
|
| Pavao Banić i njegov brat Dminić prodaju zemlje i drmune plovanu Mavru od Dobrinja. Original dated 12 March 1379.<ref name="Šurmin 1898" /> Kept at Arhiv HAZU. Glagolitic transcription by Antun Cutinis from second half of 18th century discovered in the same book in the župni arhiv in Dobrinj in which the 1100 grant survives, but it seems to be a back-translation from Latin or Italian.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" /> Also survives in 18th century Latin transcription by Antun Cutinis, which preserves the Glagolitic year and one I. Acquired by Kukuljević.<ref name="Kukuljević Sakcinski 1863" />
|
|-
|
|
| 1700s (second half)
| VIII 182
| Arhiv HAZU
| Dubašnica
| 6
| 31.7 x 22.3&nbsp;cm
|
| Večernje i slavoslovija na najveće blagdane. Written with Karaman orthography on Venetian paper by a Franciscan. Probably in the monastery sv. Marije Magdalene u Dubašnici (Portu) on Krk. Acquired by JAZU in 1948 with Premuda archive.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /><ref name="Galović 2003" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

|-
| prayer book
|
| 1700s (end or second half)
| I a 1
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 49
| 7.4 x 5.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Svećenički molitvenik. Written by a single hand. Language more influenced by Russian Church Slavonic than even the 1688 and 1791 printed breviaries. Donated to JAZU by parish priest Granić of Muć. Paper.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| 2

| 2 co

| breviary
|
| 1700s (end)
| Fragm. glag. 125
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 2
| 23 x 16&nbsp;cm
| 2 co
| Dvolist brevijara. Letters imitate those of the ''Propaganda fide'' of Rome. Uses Karaman orthography. Acquired by JAZU with the remains of Jerko Gršković of Vrbnik in 1959.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| legal
|
| 1700s (second half) / 1800s (beginning)
|
|
| Jablanac (Karlobag)
|
|
|
| Priest Luka Mikulanić of Jablanac swears before witnesses to repay his debt of 150 [[Venetian lira|libra]]<ref name="Šurmin 1898" /><ref name="Strohal 1910" /> Original dated 11 April 1485 lost. Survives only in this Glagolitic transcription.<ref name="Bratulić 2017" />

| Beli (Cres)

|

{{collapse bottom}}

==1800–1899==

{{collapse top|bg=#c04de5|fc=#FFFFFF|List of 19th century Glagolitic manuscripts}}
{| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%; font-size: 90%"
! Type
! Abbreviation
! Date
! Designation
! Library
! Place of origin
! Folia
! Dimensions
! Columns and rows
! Notes
! Scans
|-bgcolor="MistyRose"
| note
|
| 1800
|
| Vrgada (sakristija)
| Vrgada
|
|
|
| Glagolitic note by Marko Hrastin in the 2nd copy of the 1640 Ritual on Vrgada.<ref name="Jurišić 1962" />
|
|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
|
|
| 1800-1862
|
| Brbinj (župni ured)
| Brbinj
| 192 p
| 28.1 x 19.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Kvateran crikve s. Kuzme i Damijana. Glagolitic to 1815 inclusive then Latinic, with Italian in 1836 and 1837.<ref name="Cvitanović 1949" />
|
|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
|
|
| 1801-1818
| br. 16
| Vrbnik (župni ured)
| Vrbnik
| 150
| 31.5 x 22.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Kapitulska knjiga instrumenata. Glagolitic and Italian.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />
|
|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
| marriages
|
| 1803-1812, 1821-1837
| br. 1039
| DaZd
| Sestrunj
| 36 p
| 26.7 x 9.1&nbsp;cm
|
| Glagolitic to 1810 inclusive then Latinic.<ref name="Cvitanović 1949" /><ref name="Burić and Modrinić 2014" />
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://www.dazd.hr/hr/pregled/invbr1039/invbr1039sestrunjmkv1803-1837 DaZd], [https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/3:1:3QSQ-G99X-XGV6 FS]

|
|
| 1803
| inv. br. 12
| Poljica (župni ured)
| Poljica
| 20
| 29 x 11&nbsp;cm
|
| Polica vječnih obaveza poljičkog klera. Completely Glagolitic except for some notes on first folio.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

|-
| receipts and expenditures
|
| 1803-1814
| inv. br. 17
| Bogovići (župni ured)
| Dubašnica
| 66
| 31.2 x 21.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Kapitulska knjiga: primici i izdaci. Completely Glagolitic with one Italian note 1803.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="Galović 2003" />

| receipts and expenditures
|
| 1803-1814
|
| Bogovići, Krk
| Dubašnica, Krk

|

| <ref name="Galović 2003" />
|
|-
| receipts and expenditures
|
| 1804-1840
|
| Monastery of Saint Mary Magdalene in Porat, Krk
| Dubašnica, Krk
| 280
| 30.8 x 21.6&nbsp;cm
|
| Blagajnička knjiga primitaka i izdataka. Completely Glagolitic. Last entry end of November 1840.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" /><ref name="Galović 2003" />

|-
| curses
|
| 1826 (about)
| IV a 80/26
| Arhiv HAZU
| North Dalmatia
| 2
|
|
| Zaklinjanja sv. Sisina. Scribe: Mate Puhov of Sali, who also wrote IV a 80/10, 17 and 41. Intended to be worn as an amulet by the children of Antun Puhov (Matina sina): first his daughter who was born January 1826 but died in December, then his son who was born 1827.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| notebook
|
| 1800s (beginning)
| IV a 80/17
| Arhiv HAZU
| Sali
| 29
| 18.3 x 14.2&nbsp;cm
|
| Komad bilježnice Mate Puhova. Glagolitic with hand A f. 1-7 and 29 and hand B the rest. Hand A was Mate Puhov the younger and hand B was Mate Puhov the elder (Mate Šimoncin). Latest entry dated 1828.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

| homily
|
| 1800s (beginning)
| IV a 80/6
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 6
| 20 x 14.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Propovijed o paklenim mukama. Written certainly after 20 February 1803 because the last page of the homily is written on a paper used for a circular letter of the Zadar archbishopric with that date.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" />

| 1800s (beginning)
| IV a 80/25
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 8
| 19.5 x 14&nbsp;cm
|
| Poslanica o nedjelji i propovijed. Scribe same as IV a 80/1, 4, 12, 18. Language štokavskoikavski. Consists of 2 bindings, each by a different hand. One scribe probably wrote on f. 8v "D: Jure Çoban".<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1969" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" /> One photograph in Štefanić 1970.

| 1800s (beginning)
|
| Omišalj (župni ured)
| Omišalj
| 19
| 31 x 21&nbsp;cm
|
| Zbirčica apokrifnih legenda. Latinic with a Glagolitic? note from a text written by Dume Grego. Contents same as R 3375 in Zagreb, which was written by Dume Grego kurat of Miholjica (by Omišalj), and the much older Arhiv HAZU IV a 48. Scribe: parish priest Nikola Grego (identified from a note in a much younger hand at end).<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />

| Mise plaćena za dušu pokojnog oca i drugih članova obitelji Marca Antonija Lantane. Latinic with Glagolitic on f. 55. Part of Lantana family archive. Acquired by Državni arhiv u Zadru 1945.<ref name="Kolić 2007" /><ref name="Kolanović 2014" />
|
|-
| notes
|
| 1840s
|
| Vrgada (sakristija župne crkve)
| Vrgada
|
|
|
| The remains of various Glagolitic missals were collected and placed inside a cover made from a missal fragment. On these remains there are Glagolitic and Latinic notes. Including a Latinic one by Šime Banov of Vrgada from 1843.<ref name="Jurišić 1962" />
|
|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
| receipts and expenditures
|
| 1842-1875
|
| Glavotok
| Glavotok
| 210
| 33.2 x 25&nbsp;cm
|
| Glagolitic to October 1857 then Latin and Latinic from 1859. Glagolitic with Latinic ductus.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />
|
|-
| chronicle
|
| 1843?
|
| Glavotok
| Glavotok
| 44
| 38.5 x 25&nbsp;cm
|
| Knjiga aniversarija. Glagolitic. Script uncharacteristically conservative for period.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />
|
|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
| note
|
| 1866
|
| Karlobag (Capuchin Monastery)
|
|
|
|
| Mixed Glagolitic-Cyrillic note by Matija "Mate" Grynhut/Grünhut as a novomisnik that his copy of the 1706 missal had been given to him by vladika Venceslav Soić.<ref name="Vlašić-Anić 2004" /> Grünhut was noted by Soić in 1882 to be among the priests of the Senj-Modruš bishopric who still served mass from a Glagolitic missal.<ref name="Soić 1882">{{cite book |first=Vjenceslav |last=Soić |title=Razprava ob obstojećoj praksi staroslavenskog ili glagoljskog jezika pri vršenju svete mise po obredu rimokatoličkom u sdruženih biskupijah senjskoj i modruškoj |language=hr |trans-title=Treatise on the Surviving Practice of the Old Slavic or Glagolitic Language in the Fulfilment of Holy Mass of the Roman Rite in the Joint Sees of Senj and Modruš |location=Bakar}}</ref>

==1900–1999==

{{collapse top|bg=#814de5|fc=#FFFFFF|List of 20th century Glagolitic manuscripts}}
{| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%; font-size: 90%"
! Type
! Abbreviation
! Date
! Designation
! Library
! Place of origin
! Folia
! Dimensions
! Columns and rows
! Notes
! Scans
|-bgcolor="MistyRose"
| dictionary
|
| 1900s (beginning)
| br. 51 a
| Krk (arhiv samostana trećoredaca)
| Prague
| 160
|
|
| Latinsko-staroslavenski rječnik J. Vajsa. Latinic with Cyrillic and Glagolitic. The book it was copied from was brought from Prague. Scribe not given but matches writing of Josip Vajs who was in Krk 1902-1906 and spent time with fra Ljudevit Brusić who owned the manuscript. Vajs could not remember what the manuscript was written for when asked in 1958.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />
|
|-bgcolor="LavenderBlush"
| [[Roman Martyrology]]
|
| 1910 (August 3)
| R 6215
| [[National and University Library in Zagreb|NSK]]
| Zadar
| 1 (Gl.)
| 33.2 x 22.8&nbsp;cm
| 1 co
| Mučenikoslovlje rimskoje. In Latinic but with Glagolitic introduction. By Ćiril Studenčić. Not a regular manuscript but a copy made by cyclostyle in Zadar (50 copies originally). Originally from a Slavic translation written 1889 in Krk town by Ćiril Studenčić and Ljudevit Brusić, sent to Dragutin Parčić in Rome. Parčić translated some of the months. One in Zagreb as R 6215, one in Glavotok Franciscan Monastery. According to Štefanić it was never sung.<ref name="Štefanić 1960" />
| bgcolor=#F2CEEC | [https://digitalna.nsk.hr/pb/?object=info&id=580425 NSK]
|-bgcolor="MistyRose"
| miscellany
|
| 1930 (about)
| VII 69
| Arhiv HAZU
|
| 468
| 20.7 x 16&nbsp;cm
|
| Premuda's copy of the Klimantović miscellany (Premudin prijepis Klimantovićeva zbornika). Scribe: Vinko Premuda. Latinic with Glagolitic initials and many Glagolitic numbers. Acquired by Arhiv JAZU in 1948.<ref name="Milčetić 1911" /><ref name="Štefanić 1970" />
|

|
| 1975 (October 20)

| Vrgada (sakristija)
| Vrgada
|
|
|
| Empty pages of the Vrgada copy of the 1688 breviary were used to practice writing Glagolitic and Italian. A Latin note mentions don Ivan Vulin of Pakoštane as the owner in 1775.<ref name="Jurišić 1962" />

| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata I, 32

|
|-
|
|
|
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata I, 2, 4, 5
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
| 2
|
|
| Dvolist. Acquired by Berčić from B. Pletikosa in Tkon 31 August 1869.<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />
|
|-
|
|
| ?, 1800s (beginning)
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata I, 3, 6, 7
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
|
|
|
| Ostrižak. Acquired by Berčić on Žman 25 August 1866. Contains part of Gospel of Matthew from an older time and a Glagolitic note of ownership from the early 19th century by Matij Milinov of Ugljan.<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />
|
|-
|
|
| ?, 1748
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata I, 4, 8, 9
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
| 2
|
|
| Dvolist. Includes Augustine and a newer note from 1748. Acquired by Berčić in Žman on 25 August 1866.<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />
|
|-
|
|
|
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata I, 9, 17, 18
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
| 2
| 21.5 x 17.5&nbsp;cm
|
| Dvolist. Acquired by Berčić in Prvić 1848.<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />
|
|-
|
|
|
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata I, 10, 19, 21
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
| 2
| 30 x 22
|
| Dvolist. Acquired by Berčić in the monastery S. Michaelis in Zadar from the prior of sv. Ivan Krstitelj monastery in 1848.<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />
|
|-
|
|
|
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata I, 12, 13 (23), 14, 15, (24, 25), 16 (26)
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
| 3
|
| 2 co
| Discovered by Berčić in the house of Mufa Belić on Ugljan 25 September 1848. Fragments 12 and 13 are a bifolium. Fragments 14, 15 and 16 are a strip of a single folio.<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />

|
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata I, 43 (70), 71
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
| 1
|
|
| Text is sv. Lucija. Includes note by don Anton Belić curate of "Tribohuni" from 5 November 1684. Belić also wrote a Cyrillic note and a prayer started in Glagolitic and ended in Cyrillic.<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />

|
|
|
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata I, 44 (72), 73
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)

| 1
|
| 2 co
| Once served as a book cover. Acquired by Berčić in Preko.<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />

| inv. br. 49
| Ljubljana (Narodna in univerzitetska knjižnica)
|
|
|
|
| In the remains of Štefan Kocijančić, there is a Glagolitic transcription of a fragment he found on the cover of III a 36 that has been lost and is not the same as the negative print that survives on it.<ref name="Štefanić 1970" />

|
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata II, 66-77
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
|
|
|
| Dvolisti. 69 and 70-71 found in Ugljan 1848, 72-73 damaged by smoke, 74-75 is 22.5 x 16&nbsp;cm, 76-77 found in Sv. Martin on Cres 1848.<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />
|
|-
|
|
|
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata II, 78, 79-80, 81-82, 83-84, 85, 86-69, 90-91
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
|
|
|
| 78 is a fragment of the Lekcija iz Ishoda, 79-80 a strip, 81-82 a bifolium, 83-84 a bifolium of format 21 x 14&nbsp;cm found in Glavotok 1851, 85 a folio from Rava 1851, 86-89 of format 28 x 21&nbsp;cm found in Preko 1851, 90-91 strips of a manuscript 25&nbsp;cm long in 2 columns from Splitska Poljica of which at least 91 bears the finding-note "Dom. XIX p. Pentec".<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />
|
|-
|
|
|
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata II, 108
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
| 2
| 15.5 x 10&nbsp;cm
|
| Dvolist lekcije iz evanđelja i epistole (Muka).<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />

| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata II, 155-160
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)

|
|
| Acquired by Berčić in Žman 1866.<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />
|
|-
|
|
|
| Berčićevo sobranje fragmenata I, 85 (139), 140
| Petersburg (гос. публ. библиотека)
|
| 1
|
|
| Once belonged to don Giovanni Gellenovich in 1857. The name of don Nicolo Bernich in Dobrinj is also written in it. Given to Berčić by Kirinčić of Dobrinj on 7 November 1863.<ref name="Milčetić 1955" />
|

==References==

{{reflist}}

==Literature==

* [[Julia Verkholantsev|Verkholantsev, Julia]]: ''The Slavic Letters of St. Jerome: The History of Legend and Its. Legacy'', Cornell University Press, Ithaca, New York 2014.
* Bakmaz, Ivan: "Biblijska čitanja u hrvatskoglagoljskim brevijarima" in ''Glagoljica i hrvatski glagolizam. Zbornik radova s međunarodnoga znanstvenog skupa povodom 100. obljetnice Staroslavenske akademije i 50. obljetnice Staroslavenskog instituta.'' pages 139-149. Zagreb-Krk 2004.
* [[:hr:Josip Kolanović|Kolanović, Josip]] and [[:hr:Amir Obhođaš|Obhođaš, Amir]]: ''Zbirka mikrofilmova glagoljskih rukopisa i isprava'', Zagreb 2006.
* [[:cs:Josef Vajs|Vajs, Josef]]: ''[https://archive.org/details/nejstarbrevi00cath Nejstarší breviář charvatsko-hlaholský]'', Prague 1910.
* [[:cs:Josef Vajs|Vajs, Josef]]: ''[https://archive.org/details/vajs-j.-rukovet-hlaholske-paleografie.-uvedeni-do-knizniho-pisma-hlaholskeho-v-praze-1932 Rukovet Hlaholske Paleografie.]'', Prague 1932.
* [[:cs:Václav Hanka|Václav Hanka]]: ''[https://archive.org/details/ostattsislovians00hank O ostatcích slovanského bohoslužení v Čechách.]'', Prague 1859.
* {{cite journal |first1=Andrea |first2=Antonio |last1=Radošević |last2=Magdić |title=Hrvatskoglagoljski misali i brevijari u bibliografijama od 19. stoljeća do digitalizacije |journal=Slovo |number=49 |date=2009 |url=https://hrcak.srce.hr/48044}}
